· A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
· An annual bonus
· Share schemes including free shares!
· Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping.
· 30 days’ holiday, with bank holidays on top
· A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies.

We have interview slots booked this week so please apply directly via LinkedIn and provide the most recent copy of your CV. If you feel like this role could be a good fit for you, please reach out!

Job Description

About the Team

Analytics at Wolt is a business-critical competence team that covers Analytics Engineering, Data science, and Data analytics. In total, we are a team of 60+ professionals, all united by our excitement to put Wolt’s valuable data assets into everyday use.

As the name suggests, our Merchant Analytics team’s main goal is to dig into the data of our Merchant products and Merchant Operations in order to understand the Merchant behavior and enhance the experience.

About The Role

We're looking for awesome people to join Wolt as an Analytics Engineer role in Helsinki, Stockholm or Berlin. We have Data Scientists and Analytics Engineers working as embedded data professionals in different business domains and now we’re looking to grow to the next level of maturity and establish proper analytics teams in these domains.

As an Analytics Engineer, you will be the partner for the business leaders and product leaders in the Merchant Ops domain. You’ll work closely with Data Scientists, Software Engineers, Product Designers, Product Leads and Operation Managers.

Domain Overview

You’ll be a part of the Operations team in Merchant Analytics team

Wolt as a platform focuses on serving three main groups: The Customers, the couriers and the merchants. In a nutshell, the Merchant Group strives to make Wolt an integral part of our Merchant’s daily business. Their core mission is to provide merchants with self-service tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use.

Merchant Analytics is an embedded analytics function within the Merchant Group. The team works to unlock insights related to the marketplace and turn them into actionable recommendations which drive the success of merchants at Wolt. While keeping merchants at heart, the analytics team focuses on all kinds of analytics projects which can benefit merchants while ensuring a seamless consumer experience and also supporting Wolt’s marketplace strategy.

If you are wondering whether you do possess the relevant skills and background, there is a hint for you 🙂 We are looking for potential so even if you are missing some of the mentioned skills, apply and let’s have a discussion about it :)

Our humble expectations

 Plenty of experience working as a BI Developer, Analytics Engineer or Data Engineer.
 Strong hands-on experience with data integrations, data pipelines, data models, and dashboards.
 Tech skills: Python, SQL, Airflow, Kafka, AWS, and one of the modern BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker or similar).
 Since you’ll be taking care of our internal stakeholders, we’re looking for someone who truly enjoys interacting with people on a daily basis. The ability to search for information and ask relevant questions from various teams will be crucial.

FAQ:

 I’ve never worked with workflow automation tools like Airflow or Azkaban before. Is this a blocker for me to be an Analytics Engineer?

You’ll get to build and maintain data pipelines, which will require you to work with Airflow on a regular basis. Experience with such tools is highly appreciated but not a must as we are willing to teach you. All you need is the desire to learn, and learning will be even easier if you have worked with Python before.

 What is the split of dashboard development and data plumbing tasks? 

Focus of this role is on building the basis for reporting needs, hence majority of the tasks will be related to creating datasets, wrangling data and implementing metrics. At the same time, there will be opportunities to create dashboards in order to serve the needs of stakeholders.

 Will I work with raw data or participate in data collection?

Our Humble expectations:

4+ years of experience in data related roles - data engineering, business intelligence or analytics engineering.
Expertise with SQL and ETL tools (Airflow, DBT or similar) 
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualisations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilising tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
Ability to influence senior leadership to make critical decisions
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience
You are able to work and communicate effectively in English

Next Steps

Our offering to you

Lots of room to build the direction of analytics at Wolt. Our Product and Operations organizations will be growing too, meaning that you have the chance to build the team around you and shape the way the organization works with data and analytics. 
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You have the chance to decide the ways of working - a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the locations above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup. 
In addition to our country-specific benefits, our compensation package includes a monthly salary based on your expertise and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie. 🚀
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work. 🤩 

Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realise you really, really want to join us!

If you want to check up on your application or have any further questions about the position you can turn to Group Talent Acquisition Partner / Analytics, Michal Szafraniec at michal.szafraniec@wolt.com

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal Szafraniec

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

job_title: Data Solutions Engineer - Schwerpunkt Data Engineering (m/w/d)
job_desc:
Start: ab Mai/Juni | unbefristet | Berlin (hybrid)

Was wir machen - Unser ❤️ schlägt für Daten.
Die Trendence Institut GmbH ist ein unabhängiges Beratungs- und Marktforschungsunternehmen für Employer Branding, Personalmarketing und Recruiting. Seit über 24 Jahren erheben wir die relevanten Daten zum Thema Arbeit und haben bis heute 6 Millionen Schüler:innen, Studierende und Young Professionals zu ihren Karriereplänen und Wunscharbeitgebern befragt. Die Ergebnisse unserer Studien erleichtern jungen Talenten die Berufsorientierung und sind für Unternehmen wichtige Basis ihrer Personalarbeit.

Als Data Solutions Engineer in unserem dynamischen Team hast du die einzigartige Gelegenheit, die Welt der Daten zu revolutionieren. In dieser Schlüsselrolle bringst du deine Expertise in den Bereichen Data Engineering, Softwareentwicklung, Data Analysis und Machine Learning ein, um wegweisende Datenlösungen zu schaffen. Du wirst nicht nur Dateninfrastrukturen entwickeln, sondern auch intelligente Algorithmen entwerfen, die unsere datengesteuerte Zukunft prägen. Deine Arbeit wird ein zentraler Bestandteil unserer Bestrebungen sein, innovative Lösungen für komplexe Herausforderungen zu entwickeln. 

DEINE AUFGABEN.
Du entwickelst und wartest robuste und skalierbare Daten-Pipelines
Du überwachst und optimierst die Leistung unserer Daten-Pipelines
Du führst Datentests durch und stellst damit die Integrität und Qualität unserer Daten sicher
Du modellierst und implementierst Data-Cubes zur Unterstützung von Business Intelligence und Datenanalyse
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Data Scientists und Analysten zusammen, um Datenanforderungen erfolgreich umzusetzen
Du hilfst beim Entwurf und der Implementierung statistischer Modelle
Du evaluierst neue Technologien - wie etwa Graph Datenbanken & LLMs - und hilfst dabei, diese in den aktuellen Stack zu integrieren

DEINE QUALIFIKATION.
Du hast einen Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Datenwissenschaften oder einem ähnlichen Bereich
Du bringst mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit
Du sprichst fließend Englisch und hast gute Deutschkenntnisse
Du hast ausgeprägte Kenntnisse in Python und Erfahrung mit unterschiedlichen Datenbanktechnologien
Du kennst dich mit Big Data-Technologien und dem Aufbau von Daten-Pipelines aus
Idealerweise hast du bereits mit Airflow sowie im GCP-Umfeld (BigQuery, dataform, Cloud Run) gearbeitet
Du hast Kenntnisse in der Datenmodellierung und Erfahrung mit Business Intelligence-Tools
Du brennst für die Themen Data Analysis, Data Visualisierung und Data Science
Du hast Interesse an weiterführenden Themen wie Machine Learning Engineering oder Graph Datenbanken
Dich zeichnen sehr gute Kommunikation, ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten sowie herausragende Problemlösungskompetenz aus

MEHR ÜBER UNS.
Data - dein Team: Wir sind ein Team aus Data Engineers, Data Analysts und Data Managern, die eines vereint: wir lieben Daten. Gemeinsam bilden wir das Rückgrat unserer datengetriebenen Entscheidungsprozesse. Durch den Einsatz modernster Technologien und Methoden bleiben wir an der Spitze des technologischen Fortschritts. Unser Data Team arbeitet mit den neuesten Tools und Plattformen und ist stets bestrebt, die Grenzen dessen, was möglich ist, zu erweitern.
Kultur: Wir legen sehr großen Wert auf eine respektvolle und wertschätzende Kommunikation, die wir als wichtigen Bestandteil unserer Kultur sehen. Ein langfristig angelegter und durchdachter Onboardingplan in alle Aufgaben und die Kultur von Trendence sind für uns selbstverständlich. Dazu gehört auch Feedback geben und nehmen zu können als ein wichtiger Teil der Unternehmenskultur.
Flexibles Arbeiten: Schon vor Corona steht Trendence für flexibles Arbeiten! Egal ob im Büro direkt am Gendarmenmarkt oder im Home Office. Wir legen Wert darauf, dass alle Mitarbeitende in jeder Position Verantwortung für die Arbeitsaufgaben übernehmen. Der Arbeitsort ist daher weniger entscheidend als die gute Kommunikation und ein grundlegendes Vertrauen in die Kolleg:innen.
Weiterentwicklung: Wir unterstützen dich in deiner persönlichen und beruflichen Weiterbildung. Dafür bieten wir interne und externe Expert:innen an, die dich auf dem Weg begleiten werden. Mit unserer Kooperation mit nilo.health bieten wir allen die Möglichkeit, mit qualifizierten und erfahrenen Psychologinnen oder PsychotherapeutInnen von nilo.health online in Kontakt zu treten. In den nilo.sessions kann jedes Thema adressiert werden - egal ob persönlich oder berufsbezogen.


Klingt gut?
Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Solltest du die Aufgabe spannend finden und gerne noch ein wenig mehr über Trendence und unsere Kultur erfahren wollen, kannst du dir folgendes Video von unserem Sommerfest 2022 ansehen.
👉🏻 https://vimeo.com/790326141
oder du gehst auf unsere Karriereseite und liest dir alles Relevante über uns durch.
👉🏻 https://www.trendence.com/arbeiten-bei-trendence

job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Connected Network (all genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

In Zalando ZEOS (B2B Logistics), we aim to provide our partners with a profitable fulfillment experience, not only within Zalando but across multiple European marketplaces. To do this, Machine Learning, Operations Research, and Data-driven solutions play a pivotal role. We need Machine Learning Engineers who are excited to leverage Zalando’s large amounts of data and modern technology landscape to build and deploy innovative and impactful scientific and data-driven products in the B2B Logistics space.

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer within the B2B Logistics Applied Science and Data Engineering team, you will be working with Applied Scientists, Data Engineers, Software Engineers, and Product Managers responsible for bringing new ML and OR solutions into the ZEOS partner platform. The forecasting and inventory optimization models you deploy will generate key insights for our partners enabling them to make data-driven decisions about their stock and optimize logistics operations for Zalando and our partners. You will have a key role in defining ZEOS’ Applied Science strategy and helping leadership to identify new opportunities and use cases. Above all, your work will change the way our partners experience logistics services.

WHY YOU SHOULD BE INTERESTED…


 You will be joining a growing team of Applied Scientists and Data Engineers spearheading Applied Science within the ZEOS department. We trust your entrepreneurial capabilities. 
 Responsible for the team’s end-to-end MLOps, and production of machine learning services, including workflow automation and orchestration 
 Tackle challenges for developing algorithms and running them efficiently on resource-constrained platforms 
 Raise the bar in MLOps and help us build long-term sustainable Machine Learning and Applied Science solutions for our partners by introducing best practices for model testing, experimentation, versioning, serving, retraining, monitoring, and alerting 
 Design, implement, and maintain forecasting and inventory optimization solutions that will help our partners make informed decisions about their stock, their growth options, and their monetization opportunities. 
 Define and implement experiment tracking and model monitoring setups to measure our models’ and solutions’ performance and enable their evolution over time. 


WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF…


 Educational background in Software Engineering, Information Technology, or equivalent field. 
 6+ years of experience building software in the industry. 3+ of those years working in the context of Machine Learning or Applied Science projects. You balance technical acumen with business understanding and excel in collaborating with applied scientists and product stakeholders to identify the right balance between MLOps excellence and time-to-market. 
 Experience owning end-to-end Machine Learning or Applied Science projects, with proven experience deploying and maintaining Machine Learning or Operation Research models in production environments. 
 Comfortable using Python and experienced with Machine Learning as well as software development lifecycle. 
 A true team player who thrives in a cross-functional group encompassing multiple different areas of expertise. 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a detail-oriented and self-starter mindset. You value a diverse and fast-paced business environment and hence balance your passion for data, machine learning, and software engineering with pragmatism to drive results and impact. 


TECHNOLOGIES YOU WILL USE

These are technologies that you can expect to work with and learn about, you don’t need to have experience with all of them, however, it’s a plus if you have experience with these or similar technologies.


 Python 
 SQL 
 Scientific and HPC Libraries
 pytorch 
 numpy 
 scipy 
 numba 
 ortools 
 … 
 GPU Processing 
 Spark 
 Databricks 
 AWS Sagemaker 
 AWS Cloudformation 
 AWS Step Functions 
 AWS API Gateway 
 AWS Lambda 
 AWS S3 
 Docker 
 Kubernetes 
 Nakadi (Kafka) 
 Experiment Tracking 
Weights & Biases / MLFlow / In-house alternatives
 Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Testing 
ABOUT ZALANDO


It’s the perfect time to join Zalando’s journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to becoming the Starting Point for Fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 25 markets.

Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 49 million active customers.

Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset

do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/domore-our-sustainability-strategy

Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

job_title: Referentin / Referenten (m/w/d) als Daten- und KI‑Expert, Data Scientist oder Data Engineer
company_name: German Federal Ministry of Digital and Transport
job_desc:
Wir, das Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr (BMDV) sind der Taktgeber für Digitalisierung und klimafreundliche Mobilität als wesentliche Grundlagen für unsere moderne Gesellschaft. Die Digitalisierung bietet unzählige Chancen, das Leben einfacher zu machen und den Mobilitätsanforderungen der Zukunft zu begegnen. Mobilität muss für alle bezahlbar und zugleich klimafreundlich sein. Sie muss alle Regionen des Landes in der Zukunft verlässlich vernetzen. Die Unterstützung digitaler Zukunftstechnologien und ihrer infrastrukturellen Voraussetzungen ist eine unserer Kernaufgaben. Die Planung, Schaffung und der Erhalt moderner Breitbandnetze sowie einer leistungsfähigen und modernen Verkehrsinfrastruktur bilden das Fundament für unsere Aufgabenerfüllung.

Das Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr (BMDV) ist Teil eines 357.582 km² großen Karrierenetzwerks, bestehend aus über 40 Behörden mit rund 24.000 Beschäftigten. Mehr unter https://www.damit-alles-läuft.de

Das Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr (BMDV) sucht für das Referat Z 35 (Datenlabor) der Zentralabteilung zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt, unbefristet, eine/einen
Referentin / Referenten (m/w/d) als Daten- und KI‑Expert, Data Scientist oder Data Engineer

Der Dienstort ist Berlin oder Bonn.
Referenzcode der Ausschreibung 20240494_9346

Dafür brauchen wir Sie:
Konzeptionelle Entwicklung sowie Programmierung und Betreuung von Datenanwendungen
Konzeption und Umsetzung von Projekten für die innovative Datennutzung
Schnelle und agile Entwicklung von Datenanalysen und Visualisierungen für datengetriebene Entscheidungen mit Erstellung von Dashboards zur Datenvisualisierung
Entwicklung von Datenmodellen zur Informationsgewinnung unter Nutzung von statistischen Verfahren und modernen Data-Science-Methoden, wie z. B. Maschine Learning oder Text Mining
Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen des BMDV, den Behörden im Geschäftsbereich und externen Dienstleistern im Zusammenhang mit Projekten des Datenlabors
Entwicklung von innovativen technischen Ansätzen für Datenmanagement und Datenanalysen sowie Dashboard-Design
Bedarfserhebung und Beratung im Themenbereich Datennutzung
Projektmanagement mit innovativen Methoden und gutem Stakeholdermanagement und Fortschrittscontrolling

Ihr Profil:

Das sollten Sie unbedingt mitbringen:
Abgeschlossene wissenschaftliche Hochschulausbildung mit der Fachrichtung Mathematik, Statistik, (Wirtschafts‑)Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder als Data Scientist, Data Engineer oder vergleichbare Hochschulstudiengänge mit datenbezogener, empirischer oder digitaler Ausrichtung (Master, Magister bzw. Diplom/Universität)

Das wäre wünschenswert:
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Datenaufbereitung, Datenanalyse und Datenvisualisierung
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, auch in ungewohnten Situationen und unter Berücksichtigung von Beteiligten fehlerfreie und nützliche Arbeitsergebnisse zu liefern
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, Arbeitsaufträge auch in einem größeren Verantwortungsbereich termingerecht zu erledigen
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, Sachverhalte auch gegenüber wenig vertrauten Adressaten zielgruppenadäquat zu vermitteln
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, auch in unsicheren Situationen und mit Personengruppen konstruktiv, verlässlich sowie unterstützend zusammenzuarbeiten
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, vertraute, aber auch komplexe Sachverhalte zu erfassen und sich durch Abwägen einer Vielzahl zusammenhängender Faktoren ein Urteil zu bilden
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, unter einer kurz-/mittelfristigen Perspektive, auch Verantwortung für die übertragenen Aufgaben innerhalb eines größeren Arbeitsbereiches zu übernehmen
Im Rahmen der Fachkenntnisse sind wichtig:
Eine höhere Programmiersprache (z. B. R oder Python)
Erfahrung mit klassischer Statistiksoftware und modernen Analyse‑/Visualisierungstools (z. B. Tableau, Power BI o. ä.)
ausgeprägte mathematisch-analytische Fähigkeiten, ein Gespür für quantitative Zusammenhänge und Freude an der Arbeit mit Daten
Kenntnisse bzw. praktische Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Anbindung von Schnittstellen (APIs), WebScraping, maschinelles Lernen und/oder künstliche Intelligenz, Datenaufbereitung, Datenanalyse und Datenvisualisierung, zusätzliche Erfahrung in Softwareentwicklung ist wünschenswert
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, auch wenig vertraute Inhalte unter Einsatz von Gestattungstechniken und vor einer Gruppe begeisternd zu präsentieren
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, auch Zusammenhänge und Abhängigkeiten eines größeren Verantwortungsbereiches und angrenzender Bereiche zu erkennen und zu berücksichtigen

Das bieten wir Ihnen:
Die Vergütung erfolgt nach Entgeltgruppe 14 TVöD.

Eine Verbeamtung ist bei Erfüllung der persönlichen Voraussetzungen möglich.

Beamtinnen und Beamte werden in ihrem bisherigen Amt (maximal Besoldungsgruppe A 14) nach einer vorangehenden Abordnung versetzt.

Beamtinnen und Beamte können im BMDV bei Vorliegen der Voraussetzungen die Besoldungsgruppe A 15 BBesO erreichen.

Im BMDV wird eine Zulage für oberste Bundesbehörden gezahlt. Die Zulage beträgt bei Vollbeschäftigten bis zu 330,00 Euro.

Das Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr versteht sich als familienfreundlicher Arbeitgeber und wurde entsprechend zertifiziert. Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.berufundfamilie.de

Unseren Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern stehen Kindertagesplätze im Rahmen eines Kooperationsvertrages mit einem überregionalen freigemeinnützigen Träger von Krippen, Kindergärten und Horten in Berlin, Potsdam und Nordrhein-Westfalen sowohl dienststellennah Belegplätze in einer Kindertagesstätte in Berlin und zwei Kindertagesstätten in Bonn zur Verfügung.

Die Behörde unterstützt die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie. Wir bieten unseren Beschäftigten individuelle Arbeitszeitabsprachen sowie Teil- und Gleitzeit, um die Vereinbarkeit von Berufs- und Familieninteressen zu berücksichtigen. Es gibt die Möglichkeit des mobilen Arbeitens. Bei Betreuungsengpässen steht ein Eltern-Kind-Arbeitszimmer zur Verfügung. Wir fördern aktiv die Gesundheit der Beschäftigten durch das Angebot an Sport- und Gesundheitsmaßnahmen. Die Aus-, Fort- und Weiterbildung, auch während einer Elternzeit, erfolgt angepasst an den individuell festgestellten Bedarf.

Das BMDV hat im Jahr 2020 die Urkunde der Charta der Vielfalt unterzeichnet und fördert aktiv Unterschiedlichkeiten und gestaltet Vielfalt in der Behörde.

Besondere Hinweise:
Von Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern des BDMV wird eine ausgeprägte Antidiskriminierungs- und Gleichstellungsorientierung erwartet.

Die Stelle ist grundsätzlich zur Besetzung mit Teilzeitbeschäftigten geeignet.

Bewerbungen von Frauen sind ausdrücklich erwünscht. Bei gleicher Qualifikation werden Frauen nach Maßgabe des § 8 Bundesgleichstellungsgesetz (BGleiG) bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher fachlicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt. Es wird nur ein Mindestmaß an körperlicher Eignung verlangt.

Wir begrüßen die Bewerbung von Menschen aller Nationalitäten. Die Auswahl erfolgt durch eine Kommission.

Zur Durchführung eines Leistungsvergleichs werden für die Tarifbeschäftigten des BMDV und seines Geschäftsbereichs vom Personalreferat des BMDV Leistungseinschätzungen, die sich verfahrensmäßig an den jeweils im Geschäftsbereich geltenden Richtlinien für die beamtenrechtliche Beurteilung orientieren, eingeholt. Die Tarifbeschäftigten erklären mit ihrer Bewerbung ihr Einverständnis zur Durchführung dieser Maßnahme.

Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen?
Dann bewerben Sie sich bitte bis zum 26.03.2024 über das Elektronische Bewerbungsverfahren (EBV) auf der Einstiegsseite: https://www.bav.bund.de/Einstieg-EBV

Wählen Sie dort „Bewerbung mittels Referenzcode“ aus und geben Sie bitte im Verlauf Ihrer Bewerbung den Referenzcode 20240494_9335 ein. Die Benutzerdokumentation finden Sie über den o. g. Link.

Bitte laden Sie im weiteren Verlauf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Lebenslauf, Motivationsschreiben, Arbeitszeugnisse/dienstliche Beurteilung, Uni‑Diplom/Masterurkunde, ‑zeugnis und Staatsprüfungen [Zeugnisse, Urkunden]) als Anlage in Ihr Kandidatenprofil hoch.

Zusätzlich pflegen Sie bitte in Ihrem Kandidatenprofil unter „Ausbildung/Abschlüsse“ Ihren Studienabschluss und unter „Berufserfahrung“ Ihre letzten 3 Arbeitgeber ein.

Bei ausländischen Bildungsabschlüssen bitten wir um Übersendung entsprechender Nachweise über die Gleichwertigkeit mit einem deutschen Abschluss. Nähere Informationen hierzu entnehmen Sie bitte der Internetseite der Zentralstelle für ausländisches Bildungswesen (ZAB) unter https://kmk.org/zab oder unter dem Infoportal zu ausländischen Bildungsabschlüssen https://anabin.kmk.org/anabin.html. Bei der Zeugnisbewertung ggf. anfallende Gebühren können nicht erstattet werden.

Arbeitnehmerinnen und Arbeitnehmer werden gebeten, ein Zeugnis ihres letzten Arbeitgebers ihren Bewerbungsunterlagen beizufügen.

Beamtinnen und Beamte werden gebeten, ihre aktuelle dienstliche Beurteilung beizufügen.
Wir bitten Sie zu beachten, dass fehlende erbetene Bewerbungsunterlagen dazu führen können, dass wir Ihre Bewerbung im weiteren Verfahren nicht berücksichtigen.

Ansprechpersonen:
Für Fragen im Zusammenhang mit dem Elektronischen Bewerbungsverfahren steht Ihnen die Bundesanstalt für Verwaltungsdienstleistungen unter der Rufnummer 04941 602‑240 zur Verfügung.

Folgende Ansprechpersonen stehen Ihnen im BMDV zur Verfügung:

für fachliche Fragen: Frau Dr. Grass, verena.grass@bmdv.bund.de, Tel.: 030 18300‑7828
für organisatorische Fragen: Herr Klebe, maximilian.klebe@bmdv.bund.de

https://bmdv.bund.de
https://www.bav.bund.de

Introduction Sentence

More than one billion daily events are produced across our products such as Joyn. Collecting and processing that data is the fundamental prerequisite to getting the insights we need to improve our products. The Data Tech team develops and provides the services to support P7S1 in these regards. If you love to work in that space, we are your team.

In this position, you work within our hybrid model “Highly Remote”. You can work mostly remote within Germany. You can find all information here.

The contractually agreed place of work will be Unterföhring near Munich or Berlin. Possible travel costs to the place of work will not be reimbursed.

What You Can Expect In This Role

You design, build, and configure advanced Data Pipelines to transfer our first party data to various first- & third-party consumers, both batch-wise and in a real time streaming fashion 
Also, you assist our Data Scientist in creating Data Products from our Data 
You collaborate with our Data Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Experts, and Analysts to source the ideal data to create new features and enhance our solutions 
We cultivate a "you build it, you run it, you own it" culture, where you are responsible for testing, integrating, and deploying your code automatically using GitLab CI/CD as well as taking care of running our services in production on GCP and/or AWS 
You contribute to developing our Data Collection & Consent Management system 
Participate in technical design and architectural discussions with your and other teams to solve real user and business issues 

Your Essential Experience And Education

You have a passion for software engineering, Data, and Data Analysis 
You are proficient in Python and the ecosystem, experience in Javascript / HTML / Typescript would be a plus 
Snowflake and ETL / ELT are no foreign words for you 
You have experience using Databases, SQL, Data Warehouses, and Cloud Providers such as AWS / Google Cloud Platform 
Besides that, you have first touchpoints with building / automating CI/CD Pipelines and set a high standard for clean code and documentation 

What's in it for you?

Take advantage of our wide range of training and development opportunities at the ProSiebenSat.1 Academy
Benefit from a great flexibility and the possibility of mobile working thanks to our hybrid working model "NWOW" (New Ways of Working) as well as 30 days of vacation per year
Make use of our international mobile working agreement from 25 EU countries and Switzerland - for up to 30 days within twelve months
Benefit from a highly discounted, Germany-wide membership at Urban Sports Club as well as numerous other special discounts of our partners
Receive support in all situations of life, e.g. with our campus-owned daycare center, a childcare allowance or the BUK Family Service with free advice, for example on the topic of care. With our regular "Mental Health Days", we also send a clear signal for more awareness on the topic of mental health in everyday work life
Use our wide range of campus services at our headquarter including a canteen with fair prices, different coffee bars or our massage service
Enjoy an open corporate culture without a dress code
Join our P7S1 employee networks and get engaged in a topic you are passionate about, e.g. PROUD, Greenteam, fempowerment, language buddies

Closure

We are looking forward to your application!

Apply within 5 minutes via our job portal or use the video application option.

Your profile doesn't fit 100%? No worries, apply anyway! We support your professional & personal development on the job.

You can find out more about our application process here.

Please note that we can not accept applications by mail due to data protection reasons.

This Position is available at Seven.One Entertainment Group GmbH.

Company Text

Click here to learn more about the ProSiebenSat.1 Group located in Unterföhring near Munich and our diverse portfolio.

As a signatory of the Diversity Charter, ProSiebenSat.1 is committed to a working environment free of prejudice and actively promotes diversity and equal opportunities among employees.

You have a disability and would like to apply? Then you are very welcome.

We know that we are not entirely accessible yet, but we are working on it. Let's talk about how we can eliminate any barrier together and find an individual solution if needed.

Although we refer to one gender in the text, all genders may be implied.

About The Company

Affinidi is a technology company dedicated to changing data ownership for good. We empower businesses and individuals with control and ownership of their data, with a comprehensive approach to managing their holistic identity – accounting for all aspects of their digital footprint while ensuring privacy and security.

Affinidi’s technology enables users to benefit from decentralised digital identity solutions. We believe that everyone has the right to own and control their data, and we are committed to creating a trusted digital credentials ecosystem that empowers businesses and individuals to securely exchange data and services across borders and industries.

We are in search of a self-motivated, and experienced Data & Analytics Engineer to join our Affinidi Elements team. In this role, you will work with global peers on teams dedicated to the design, development, testing, implementation, and integration of data-focused products and services, that are both developer, and consumer-facing. As a Data & Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for the development, prototyping and implementation of the data layers that power the next generation of data and identity products from Affinidi. Your expert skills in designing, architecting, and building quality systems will intersect with your hands-on coding, performance testing, and integration experience. This position reports to the Director of Engineering.

Our work culture at Affinidi is shaped by the following tenets:

 We are unapologetically customer-focused 
 We invest in cultures and teams to enable high performance 
 Embraces experimentation and builds fast 
 We have the courage to be misunderstood 
 We work together to unlock data 

What’s in it for you:

Develop, implement, and maintain best-in-class data/analytics pipelines and system as part of the core Affinidi Elements product offering
Prototype, program and help ship the next generation of Affinidi Elements products that lets developers and consumers access data, services and data models seamlessly and securely
Build a scalable web services architecture that supports privacy-preserving data access, data cataloging, search and discovery, data transformation
Be responsible for the development of innovative, nonstandard approaches for knowledge discovery including the use of AI/ML 
Develop features and improvements to the broader Affinidi Elements product in a secure, well-tested, and performant way, primarily using Typescript, Python, R, Rust
Refine and optimize the implemented data processing methods to provide more accurate results or remove inefficiencies or enhance the service offering
Troubleshoot, identify, and resolve technical data and analytics-related issues.
Drive continual improvement of the Affinidi Elements data and analytics solutions and systems for protection against evolving threats and efficiency
Analyze and interpret highly complex data to arrive at actionable recommendations
Collaborate with Product Management and other stakeholders within Engineering to maintain a high bar for quality in a fast-paced, iterative environment
Solve technical problems with large scope and complexity while you advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance
Craft code that meets our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale systems environment. Maintain and advocate for these standards through code review.
Confidently own moderate to significantly complex features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects.
Mentor other engineers, contribute to team and organizational improvements in processes and tooling

You will be a great match if you:

Have 10+ years of overall professional experience
Have 3-5 years of experience database development and tools such as data mining, OLAP, ETL, data modelling, complex SQL queries, performance tuning, and Postgres database development (DDL, DML, stored procedures) - (a must-have)
Have extensive expertise in AWS cloud computing and native databases, especially Redshift, as well as the various data processing tools in the AWS platform - (a must-have)
Can demonstrate hands-on experience building a data/analytics pipeline from the ground up, as well as hands-on experience working with data to power AI/ML training and inference
Have experience with performance and optimization problems, a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent such problems, and a desire to share your knowledge and scale through others
Enjoy working in a fast-paced startup environment where you can be autonomous and experimental, be part of a truly global team, and can work up and down the stack 
Have strong technical documentation skills, including the C4 Model and Architectural Decision Records 
Understand design patterns and have working experience in developing and deploying microservices in the cloud, and have a proven track-record in doing so 
Care about privacy by design, security, testing, high-performance systems, and mentoring others, and have an inclination towards clear communication, inclusion and visibility

Bonus points:

Experience working cross-functionally, and across locations and timezones 
Domain expertise in decentralized identity solutions 
Experience in developing systems with cryptography requirements 

 What can you expect from us: 

 Hybrid working model 
 Flexible working hours 
 Unlimited vacation policy 
 Competitive compensation package 
 Work within international environment 
 Learning Budget 
 Mobile Allowance 
 Home Office Allowance 

Sounds like you? Apply now!

 Equal Opportunity 

We believe in hiring different and diverse talent and providing a safe space where everyone can share their views without fear, where differences are celebrated, and where no one is left out. Inclusive cultures are the foundation for collaboration and innovation within our team.

For information about the way Affinidi collects, uses, and discloses your personal data when you submit an application for employment, please refer to the Privacy Notice accessible at https://www.affinidi.com/candidate-privacy-notice . By applying for employment with Affinidi, you acknowledge having read and understood the Privacy Notice, and you consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data submitted to Affinidi in accordance with the Privacy Notice.

About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the world’s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweek’s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom .

The Engineering Team

At Chainlink Labs, our engineering team pushes the scale and capabilities of decentralized applications across the industry. The Chainlink Network holds >70% market share in the oracle space, solving real-world problems by enabling smart contracts to securely interact with off-chain data/computation.

We value talented and driven craftsmen who work collaboratively to tackle complex challenges, deliver product impact, and grow as builders. Join us and shape the future of blockchain technology and decentralized finance.

Be the data engineer powering the solutions to a unique challenge -- monitoring uptime and reliability of independent/3rd party oracle providers. Chainlink Labs is going through a transition from traditional time series-based monitoring toward an event-driven architecture and alerting approach. This transition is not only critical for monitoring but is also essential for delivering data for analytical workloads that support executive decision-making processes. You will have a significant impact as we grow the Chainlink ecosystem and ensure the best experience for our customers by ensuring reliable uptime.

You’ll develop and build highly scalable, secure, and reliable software that will change the way smart contracts function at a fundamental level. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and master the latest research concerning distributed systems, cryptography, blockchains, game theory, consensus algorithms, and decentralized applications.

You will be given a high level of autonomy/ownership over your projects, the opportunity to expand your scope of knowledge, and the chance to help build the decentralized infrastructure of the future.

Your Impact

Lead the design and deployment of data pipelines that power our real time monitoring/observability services to detect and alert the team of needed action.
Make recommendations to ensure sufficient metrics are collected to create alerts with every new feature release
Thinking creatively about attack vectors, possible failures, and disaster scenarios, modeling them in reproducible test environments, and developing fixes
Implementing resilient distributed systems to achieve extremely high reliability in a variety of blockchain environments

Requirements

At least 5+ years of professional experience as a software developer / DevOps engineer or equivalent
Professional experience with Golang 
Experience with Kafka required
Experience with Apache Pinot would be nice, but not required

Our Stack
Golang, Java, Kafka, Postgres, Pinot, Kubernetes, AWS

Desired Qualifications

Experience using DeFi products
Strong interest in blockchain, web3 or decentralization

Are you skilled in the art of transforming raw information into strategic insights? Do you see yourself as a key player in building the foundations for a Data driven mindset transformation? Here at SoSafe we might have the right position for you. Get ready to have a huge impact, establish the bases for our data architecture and shape the future of our analytics infrastructure. Be part of one of the fastest growing Tech Start-Ups and become a Cyber-Security-Hero with us! Help us build the product that creates the Human Firewall within organizations.

Your mission


Embrace a culture of continuous learning and improvement, staying updated with industry trends and best practices while mentoring others and promoting innovation within your team 
Design, develop, and deploy data engineering solutions to address complex business challenges, overseeing the entire data lifecycle journey from ingestion to end-user reporting 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and translate them into scalable and efficient data solutions 
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL/ELT) data from various sources 
Own deliveries end-to-end within your team, ensuring that your work aligns with the goals of the domain and impacts organizational objectives effectively 
Prioritize quality in delivery by embracing aspects such as maintainability, complexity, testability, and progressive rollout mechanisms 
Identify and mitigate technical risks that may impact delivery, implementing incremental mitigation strategies over time 
Advocate for the right level of investment in solutioning and strive for robust implementations, providing reliable estimations and preventing system clutter 
Foster a collaborative mindset, encouraging cross-functional collaboration and empowering less experienced engineers to take ownership of their work 
Optimize the performance of data pipelines and processing systems to ensure reliability and scalability 
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data engineering, evaluating new technologies and frameworks to enhance our data capabilities 
Contribute to research and development projects, driving innovation and influencing the direction of data engineering within the organization 
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, presenting complex data concepts in a clear and concise manner


Your profile


5+ years of experience designing, developing, and optimizing end-to-end data solutions in real-world applications 
Proficiency with stacks using technologies such as Python, AWS (DMS, Redshift), Java, Spark, Kafka, and SQL, along with expertise in data libraries and frameworks 
Passion for continuous growth and learning, embracing change, and proactively adapting to new requirements and environments 
Strong problem-solving skills with a structured and holistic approach to complex challenges 
Ability to identify and mitigate technical risks, ensuring on-time and safe delivery of new product capabilities 
Mastery in software engineering principles and effective design patterns suitable for different development scenarios 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, fostering teamwork, collaboration, and mentorship 
Proven track record of driving technical excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement within your team 
Fluent in English and optionally German 
You are a team player and open-minded for after-work socialising 


Why Us?

At SoSafe, you'll be part of a cybersecurity team that thrives on innovation, safeguarding organizations against evolving threats and making the digital world a safer place. You will have the opportunity to make a real impact, surrounded by a dynamic and supportive team and environment committed to your professional growth.

About Us

We are one of the fastest-growing security awareness scale-ups worldwide. By putting people first and focusing on behavioral science, we are disrupting the status-quo of Cyber Security.

Backed by strong VC funding by those such as Highland Europe and Global Founders Capital, we are looking for more motivated team players who will assist us with our ambitious mission and international expansion. At SoSafe, you will take ownership for your work and your growth, taking your career to the next level! If you want to have an impact and are looking to contribute in meaningful ways within an open-minded environment that values diversity and community, SoSafe might just be the right place to work for you!

Are you our next Cyber Security Hero?

job_title: Senior Data Engineer & Databricks Specialist (all genders)
job_desc:
At flaconi, we believe that diversity fuels creativity, innovation and growth. It thrives in all its forms of beauty. Our team is a mosaic of individuals from different backgrounds, cultures and life journeys, all united by a shared passion for beauty. Our commitment is grounded in our core values, particularly #trustinpeople. We hold ourselves accountable for creating an environment where every employee feels honestly valued, heard and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives to foster belonging.

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer & Databricks specialist (all genders) to join our Data & Analytics department at flaconi. You will be part of our Data Engineering team of 8 people and play a prominent role in driving the transition to a data lakehouse architecture powered by Databricks. What can you expect in this role? Innovative projects in a cloud environment with a modern tech stack and room for exploring new technologies. In addition, an attractive business setup from e-commerce that includes many (also unstructured) data sources and use cases. Together with the team, you follow the ‘You build it, you run it’ mindset: You participate in the full development process, from design, through implementation and testing, to code reviews and deployment.


Your role
You drive the transformation from a classic data warehouse approach to a data Lakehouse on Databricks; ensure that the data platform can scale with the company, handling increasing data volumes while maintaining optimal performance, flexibility and reliability
To achieve this, you design and maintain the data architecture, including data models, schemas, and integrations
You build and maintain scalable, high-performance data pipelines, ensuring efficient and reliable data processing. This includes: supporting the business needs to include new data points or ingest new sources whenever needed, and implementing automation for data pipeline monitoring, error handling, and performance optimization
You develop and optimize our ETL processes from our various and numerous sources. You implement data quality checks and validation processes to ensure accuracy and completeness of the data
You proactively monitor data infrastructure performance, troubleshoot issues, ensure proper communication flows to the end users of the data products
You document processes, procedures, and configurations to ensure knowledge sharing


Your profile
Several years of experience with the Databricks platform, including proficiency in designing solutions leveraging a diverse assortment of data sources, and a solid understanding of data governance and the Unity Catalog
Proficiency in Python programming and experience with data processing frameworks - Scala is a plus
Solid knowledge of SQL and hands-on experience with relational databases incuding. data modelling
Strong understanding of cloud computing platforms and related services (AWS)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Good written and verbal English

What we offer you
Full transparency: For this role, we have a salary band between 75000€ and 95000€ gross per year. The salary that we will offer you will always be within this span and is based on the skills that you show during the recruitment process.
Our employees matter to us: We offer you a permanent contract and will cover the costs for your BVG or Deutschland ticket.
Work-life balance: 29 vacation days, flexible working hours, up to three days of working from home a week and in specific cases the option to work 100 % remotely; the possibility of a paid sabbatical.
flaconi Academy: Actively shape your own career path by taking advantage of our internal and external training opportunities.
We care about your well being: We want to support you also during difficult times. For this, we offer you and your close relatives counseling sessions with mental health professionals.
flaconi Fitness: a wide range of sports options & discounts on memberships.
Family first: Our “emergency-daycare” is there for you in out-of-the-ordinary situations to look after your child on site at our office.
Thinking about tomorrow together: flaconi subsidizes your savings contribution to the company pension scheme with an additional 20%.
A comfortable working space with everything you need: High end technical equipment, fruits and drinks, no dress code and dogs are welcome in our office!
Other perks: Great discounts in our online shop as well with our partner companies, cool team events & company parties!

job_title: Systems Engineer - Public Sector - Federal Customers - Germany
job_desc:
Company Description

Our Mission

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.

Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Our Approach to Work

We lead with flexibility and choice in all of our people programs. We have disrupted the traditional view that all employees have the same needs and wants. We offer personalization and offer our employees the opportunity to choose what works best for them as often as possible - from your well-being support to your growth and development, and beyond!

Job Description

Your Career

As a Systems Engineer, you’ll enable sales engagements into a set of large new enterprise accounts. You will play a key role in navigating complex accounts in order to generate and deliver winning proposals, contract bids, statements of work, and RFI/RFP responses. It is business critical to meet and exceed sales quotas by building and implementing strategic account plans targeting enterprise-wide deployments of the Palo Alto Networks Next-Generation Security Platform.

Your Impact

Establish yourself as a trusted advisor to prospects and customers working with your Account Manager and the local partners within your territory
Identify and document specific problems with prospective and current customers which can be solved through the deployment of integrated solutions
Architect and propose validated solutions which address the identified cybersecurity problems in each unrivaled environment
Ensure ongoing customer happiness, support, and adoption
Continuous self-improvement and learning to maintain technical leadership of applicable technologies (data center, SDN, public cloud, security, networking, etc.)
Understand and effectively differentiate against our top competitors
Act as the customer advocate for any issues that require technical assistance and follow up with the customer until the issue is resolved

Qualifications

Your Experience

4+ years of experience as a successful pre-sales SE, systems integrator, or equivalent experience
BS in Computer Science or equivalent or equivalent military experience required
Working knowledge of Palo Alto Networks products, with a focus on Next-Generation Firewall and some comparative technologies - Continuous technical development
Experience with systems installation, configuration and administration of routers/switches, UNIX/Linux, and Windows-based systems
Experience that emphasizes L2-L4 Networks (L2 switching architectures including Spanning Tree, IP routing that includes OSPF and BGP, and L4 Load balancing)
Understand and effectively present our security platform to technical and non-technical audiences
Strong analytical skills to evaluate complex multivariate problems and find a systematic approach to gain a quick resolution, often under duress
Mature and effective time-management skills
Prior experience selling network infrastructure-based security appliances, including but not limited to - Firewalls, SSL/IPSec VPNs, Security Proxies and Caches
Familiarity working with Channel partners and understanding of a channel-centric market approach
Previous work in the enterprise networking security space
Experience and knowledge of modern network threats and malware, network forensics, automation tools and technologies, and endpoint security technologies
Experience with Public Sector clients and working on public tenders
German language skills on professional level or beyond are required
Significant industry certifications (SANS, CISSP, CCIE, etc)

Additional Information

The Team

As part of our Systems Engineering team, you’ll support the sales team with technical expertise and guidance when establishing trust with key clients. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our systems engineer team, you are driven by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredible complex cyberthreats.

Our Commitment

We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Over 4.000 employers win their talent through our machine learning algorithms.

With over €50M funding and a team of 400+, we are expanding to revolutionize the European job market (from Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg and Vienna).
Join the HeyVolution. 💛

We offer you an influential role in a fast-growing company:
Embark on a transformative journey as a Data Engineer with Heyjobs' Marketing Technology Team, where your role holds the key to revolutionizing our marketing performance. Your team oversees the entire development cycle of our marketing machinery, from data layer development and Data Science/Machine Learning to MLOps, ensuring seamless continuous delivery. This system isn't just a pipeline, it's a dynamic, multi-component powerhouse driven by Machine Learning, generating vital data that fuels all subsequent marketing automation processes within our company.
You will work on projects in areas like marketing budget optimization, bidding optimization, audience generation, cost allocation as well as conversion value prediction. We have built a fully automated Marketing optimization engine, allowing us to market thousands of jobs in a highly optimized and automated fashion. Your job will be to work with our data pipelines, engineering and performance marketing teams to bring this to the next level.
You'll have the opportunity to influence the selection of the tech stack and the appropriate direction to support business features. You will also be involved in projects to solve scaling challenges.
You will maintain existing complex pipelines that include DWH models and ML/DS components as well as continue designing and developing greenfield components with scalability and quality in mind.
Additionally, you will be a part of the Data Engineering Guild which is an internal group of professionals from various data teams that regularly meet to share knowledge and learn together.

🎯 How you can contribute to HeyJobs
Enable the company's growth by developing and owning Marketing data pipelines and process to ensure end-to-end DS/ML delivery
Design and develop greenfield components with scalability and quality in mind
Help to plan and deliver on quarterly objectives and initiatives together with your team and in close collaboration with your product manager and other stakeholders
Leverage Data Catalog and Lineage tools to further enable the team and streamline the process
Help to improve tech/product vision, processes and architecture
Collaborate with your fellow colleagues with regards to architecture evolution and general practice improvements for R&D
Together with all your colleagues, help jobseekers find the right job to live a fulfilling life with the HeyJobs platform faster and easier

🤝 What sets you up for success
Expert knowledge in SQL, Data Modeling and Python
Experience with Data Warehousing and Data/Software Architecture
Experience with pipeline orchestration tools like Airflow
Experience with AWS Tech Stack (Redshift, S3, Glue, Spectrum, Athena, Lambda, Lake Formation etc.)
Pragmatic, can-do attitude (you like to dive deep and get things done)
Eager to learn and grow professionally
Strong interest in understanding and driving the business meaning and impact of data
Great English communication skills (written and verbal)
Bonus: 
Hands-on MLOps experience (you deployed ML models to production)
Experience with Data Analysis and Data Products/Algorithms
Experience with Data Quality frameworks like Great Expectations, or Data Observability platforms like Monte Carlo.
Docker/Terraform
Technologies you’ll use:
SQL, data modeling, Python, Pandas
Great Expectations for data quality, Castordoc data catalog
AWS Redshift, S3 (AWS-based Data Lake), Glue, Athena
Airflow, Docker, CircleCI, Terraform
Grafana, Datadog, PagerDuty
ECS, AWS Batch and other AWS services

❤️‍🔥 What you will love about us
People & Values: We treat people in the way people should be treated, we bring out the best in everyone, we put our people first. Learn more here.
Work-Life Balance: 28 holidays*, plus 1 additional day p.a., minimum 3 weeks work from anywhere per year and a 1-month paid sabbatical* every 3 years, flexible work hours
Growing individually and as a team: 7 step career framework, bi-yearly performance reviews, 3 days of yearly educational leave & 500€ budget*, HeyJobs Leadership Training Programs
Benefits: €50 monthly allowance* with Ben Card to spend on something you actually need and want. HeyJobs discounts for sustainable products and services via FutureBens & more
Societal Impact Employee Groups: Follow your passion with HeySustainability, HeyVoices, HeySisterhood, HeyPeace or found your own circle
Events & Feel Good initiatives: Fresh fruit, great drinks, monthly team lunch, 3 company-wide events per year, quarterly team events & plenty of feel good initiatives
Great offices with high quality equipment: MacBook / ThinkPad, Sennheiser Headset, screen for home office + additional hardware; HQ Berlin (Kreuzberg, Paul-Lincke-Ufer); HeyHub Cologne (Design Offices Gereon), HeyHub Vienna (centrally located in 1020 Vienna) all with standing desks, hybrid set-up meeting rooms & AC - good public transport connections & great lunch options

At HeyJobs diversity and inclusion is key to creating a culture attracting the best talent and ultimately leading to achieving our vision. Together, we are 30 different nations, 45% women and 50% female leaders.
We are explicitly not hiring anyone who discriminates on the basis of religion, national origin, gender-identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you. We encourage individuals from LGBTQIA+ and other underrepresented groups to apply.
We are proud to have been continuously ranked as one of Berlin's best tech employers!
See for yourself: Top Startup Employer (German), Kununu, Glassdoor, Top 25 LinkedIn Startups.

THE ROLE & THE TEAM


Zalando’s Enterprise Applications and Architecture department works with state-of-the-art technologies to deliver innovative solutions to all parts of our platform. As a part of ERP Engineering, you will work with the newest ERP products. We have close partnerships with SAP innovation centers, AWS, and renowned implementation partners. Our ERP System (S/4HANA) runs on a HANA database and we deliver frequent roll-outs of new ERP technology and business processes. You will benefit from a unique corporate culture where results are what matter!


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)

Be a part of an agile, experienced  frontend  and  backend  ERP engineering team to perform complex programming, testing, and debugging for the ongoing development of our ERP landscape

Design, build, and maintain large-scale  backend  ERP  microservices  using technologies such as BTP, ABAP, CAP, RAP, CDS Views, Python , Java , Apache Flink, Nakadi, and Kubernetes

Ensure a state-of-the-art software development methodology

Share your knowledge with your colleagues helping them grow their technical skills

Interact with various teams and stakeholders with different backgrounds and a large spectrum of competencies


WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF...


At least 5 years of current and relevant work experience developing complex ERP microservices

You know and understand how to design, develop, and operate large scale distributed systems, microservices on cloud infrastructure (preferably AWS with Kubernetes)

You have experience with streaming processing systems (e.g. Apache Kafka, AWS Kinesis)

You have knowledge in SAP S/4HANA ERP as a huge plus

You are and advocate for agile processes, operational excellence, and coding best practices such as clean code, readability, and test-driven development

You have practical work approach and flexibility with changing requirements

You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners

 Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 
 27 days of vacation a year

 Family services, including counseling and support 
 Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) 
 Mental health support and coaching available

You make the difference. Whether in business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory or Consulting: at Deloitte, we help our global clients continuously evolve. Discover a diverse working environment that is constantly in motion and always revolving around one central hub: you and your expertise. What impact will you make?

Do you want to leverage the full power of the cloud for our clients in Consulting – Cloud Transformation & System Engineering? Our teams guide businesses on their cloud journeys, from strategizing to developing and integrating high-performing, future-proof applications, as well as transforming major IT divisions into agile entities, moving complex IT landscapes to the cloud, and operating innovative software services. Ensure our joint success and make the difference with us as a Senior Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x).

Locations: Berlin, Cologne, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Hanover, Leipzig, Munich and Stuttgart.

Your impact:

As a Senior Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x) you are involved in supporting the projects from the initial stage until the go-live stage. You are responsible for designing flexible cloud architectures in an agile environment, ensuring compliance with clean code and software crafting standards. Additionally, you manage the continuous improvement of the infrastructure.

Innovation: Together with your colleagues you will develop innovative solutions and advise customers on future-proof solutions
Conception: As part of your position, you will implement proof of concepts and develop various solutions.
Best practices: Develop best practices for testability, maintainability, and scalability to support an open team culture
Knowledge transfer: Share best practices and mentor development teams
Community: Step up and make your contribution, for example by actively taking part in conferences and meet-ups.

Your skillset:

Bachelor’s or master’s degree , or Austrian HTL degree, ideally IT-focused (e.g. (business) informatics, mathematics, or physics), or equivalent education/training/experience
Experience in programming, software development in the cloud environment (AWS, Azure or GCP), implementing microservices, cloud infrastructure (e.g. Terraform) and security concepts in cloud-based applications, and containerization (e.g. docker or kubernetes)
Hands-on in continuous integration and deployment (e.g. Git, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, SonarQube, Azure TFS) using PowerShell, Linux/Unix-Shell, and cloud deployment models at the enterprise level
Practical knowledge of interface development and database technologies (e.g., SQL or data warehouse), and nice to have experience in machine learning libraries and NLP
Fluent English and German (B2) language, both written and spoken and willing to travel occasionally

Your chance:

Best-in-class ongoing education at Deloitte University and through individual qualification programs and training sessions
Extensive professional development opportunities with structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation, and support for societal engagement and corporate volunteering
Work-family balance with a family advice service, mobile working, part-time hours, sabbaticals, support for family caregivers, counseling for parental leave, and much more
A focus on health and fitness with regular health-themed days, partnerships with fitness providers, and support for sporting and team events
Attractive employer benefits including bicycle and car leasing, a company smartphone for private use, and flexible working models (such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working)
Plenty of scope for creativity and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture – for instance through our ALL IN global diversity and inclusion initiative as well as local employee networks

Equal opportunities for all: We look forward to receiving applications from people who are as diverse as we are – irrespective of age, disability, ethnic origin and nationality, gender, religion, sexual identity or social background. Any questions? You can find all the information you need about our application process in our application FAQs.
