 Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse

Worum es geht:

Das Unternehmen ist einer der führenden IT-Dienstleister im deutschsprachigen Raum. Mit rund 6.800 Mitarbeitenden unterstützt das Unternehmen Kunden aus verschiedenen Branchen bei der Digitalen Transformation.

Das Competence Center Data Engineering ist verantwortlich für die Umsetzung komplexer Big Data und Cloud Analytics Projekte für namhafte große Kunden. Als Data Engineer bist du Teil eines innovativen und stetig wachsenden Software Engineering Teams. Du profitierst von erfahrenen Kolleginnen und Kollegen und absolvierst ein spezielles Ausbildungsprogramm, um dein Wissen auszubauen und zu vertiefen.

Deine Aufgaben als Cloud Data Engineer:

 Implementieren von Data Pipelines, Data Ingest und Data Processing
 Engineering von Container basierten Analytics Plattformen und effizienten CI/CD Pipelines
 Projektbasierte Umsetzung von Business Anforderungen mit Analytics Services von AWS, Azure und GCP oder etablierten On Premises Big Data Technologien
 StetigeWeiterbildung in Technologienausdem Cloud- und Software Engineering-Umfeld

Dafür wird dir geboten:

 30 Tage Urlaubstage im Jahr
 Zeitliche und örtliche Flexibilität (bundesweit remote möglich + 2 - 4 Monate pro Jahr Remote-Arbeit aus dem (EU-)Ausland möglich je nach Aufgabenbereiche
 Offene Unternehmenskultur, dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld und moderner Führungsstil
 Spannende abwechslungsreiche Projekte im Cloud-Umfeld mit unterschiedlichen Industrien
 Projektzuweisung, die deiner Kapazität und deinem Interesse entspricht
 Etabiliertes Umfeld, in dem du dich technisch und professionell weiterentwickeln kannst
 Unterstützung deiner persönlichen und fachlichen Weiterentwicklung mit einem breiten Angebot von Weiterbildungen und Zertifizierungen
 Patenschaft von fachlichen Kolleg*innen und solides On-Boarding Programm
 Freiraum für eigene Kreativität und Entwicklung

Hiring Process:

1st Gespräch mit dem Fachbereich - 2nd Gespräch mit dem Fachbereich - Angebot/Absage

Für denselben Geschäftsbereich suchen wir ebenfalls nach DataOps Engineers, Data Architects und Consultants in ganz Deutschland. Bewerbe dich gerne bei uns, auch wenn du nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllen kannst.

Impressum - https://www.frankgroup.com/de/impressum/

job_title: Senior Data Engineer for Partner Tech (all genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


Zalando Partner Tech is the technology organisation within Zalando responsible for sourcing fashion products and consumer goods into Zalando. Through our platform and tools, we provide a wide range of products to customers all over Europe. The organisation is composed of more than 300 talented individuals who are dedicated to creating the best platform and inspiring opportunities for multi million euro fashion brands and physical retail stores, connecting them with consumers across multiple European markets.

As a Senior Data Engineer within Partner Tech, you will get the opportunity to build a new data platform from the early stages together with your team. You will work in a welcoming and inclusive team of data engineers and software engineers. You will be responsible for the collection, transformation, and visualisation of data, consumed by Zalando Partners and internal users. You will communicate frequently with your team’s stakeholders to understand and react to their needs in order to raise the data capabilities of all of Partner Tech.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)


 Be in the driver's seat. You enjoy being proactive, addressing intricate business problems and taking the initiative to independently explore and understand them. 
 Proactively look for ways to enhance existing tooling and processes. 
 You will support the implementation of a reliable and performant data infrastructure that integrates with internal and 3rd party tools. 
 Collaborate with diverse teams of talented data analysts, applied scientists, business analysts, product managers, and software engineers to implement and maintain high-performance data-processing and data integration systems on top of lake house architecture. 
 Work with senior data engineers, and peers in central data platform teams to develop the system architecture and ensure seamless integration into Zalando's central data platform. 
 Establish and enforce data quality standards throughout the ETL process. 
 Set up mechanisms to proactively identify and address potential issues before they impact data integrity. 



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF... . 



 5 + years proficiency in engineering best practices, designing, implementing scalable data pipelines from data lake 
 Experience of running data processing pipelines using distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark. Databricks experience is a must. 
 Experience in working with MPP data warehouse, e.g. Redshift, Big Query, Snowflake 
 You have solid programming skills in Python 
 Hands-on experience with a cloud ecosystem (AWS, GCP) and integration with orchestration services (Airflow). 
 You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English with an ability to articulate complex technical topics and solutions concisely and simply. 
 Nice to have Experience to technically guide and lead data engineers and analysts 


If you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every requirement. You may be the right candidate for this or other roles!


OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners 
 Two paid volunteering days a year 
 Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration 
 Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 
 27 days of vacation a year to start 
 Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement) 
 Family services, including counselling and support 
 Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) 
 Mental health support and coaching are available 
 Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review 


Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

job_title: Spezialist:in für das Zugbeeinflussungssystem S-Bahn Berlin (ZBS)
job_desc:
Die Deutsche Bahn ist nicht nur einer der wichtigsten Mobilitätsdienstleister:innen, sondern auch eines der größten Ingenieurbüros Deutschlands. Um neue Brücken, Tunnel, Bahnhöfe, Gleise und Signalanlagen zu realisieren und nachhaltig instand zu halten, arbeiten aktuell mehr als 10.000 Ingenieure bei uns – längst nicht genug. Als Ingenieur:in bei der Deutschen Bahn kannst du dabei etwas planen, managen oder überwachen, das bleibt: die Infrastruktur für kommende Generationen.

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als Spezialist:in für das Zugbeeinflussungssystem S-Bahn Berlin (ZBS) (w/m/d) für die DB Netz AG am Standort Berlin oder Leipzig.

Deine Aufgaben:

Ziel deiner Stelle ist die Systementwicklung und -betreuung für ZBS über den gesamten Produktlebenszyklus hinweg
Dafür erstellst du betreiberseitige Anforderungen, prüfst herstellerseitige Lösungen und definierst Regelwerk. Damit gestaltest du den Handlungsrahmen für Planer:innen, Instandhalter:innen und Bediener:innen
Du prüfst Produkte der Hersteller hinsichtlich der Einsetzbarkeit bei der DB Netz AG und gibst sie für den Bereich der S-Bahn Berlin frei
Im Rahmen der Systembetreuung ZBS unterstützt du Infrastrukturprojekte bei der Ausrüstung des Netzes mit ZBS sowie das Anlagenmanagement bei den Aufgaben der Instandhaltung
Du führst Verträge mit externen Dienstleistern, die bei der Systementwicklung und -betreuung unterstützen


Dein Profil:

Grundlage deiner Karriere bildet ein Studienabschluss mit signaltechnischem Schwerpunkt oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
LST, ETCS, ESTW und LEU sind dir bekannte Begriffe aus einem Fachgebiet, indem du bereits durch mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in beratender, planerischer oder vergleichbarer Funktion erfolgreich tätig warst
Du bist vertraut mit dem Entwickeln von Anforderungen und verfassen von Regelwerk
Neben deiner Fachexpertise helfen dir auch deine offene Kommunikation, deine kooperative und gleichzeitig selbstständige Arbeitsweise sowie dein Durchhaltevermögen, dir anspruchsvolle Themen anzueignen und diese inhaltlich aktiv mitzugestalten
Du fühlst dich motiviert, in einer der größten Vorhaben der modernen Mobilität mitzuwirken und ein Teil der #Starken Schiene Deutschland zu werden. Dann bewirb dich jetzt


Benefits:

Du erhältst bis zu 16 Freifahrten innerhalb Deutschlands pro Jahr und weitere Fahrvergünstigungen für Deine Freunde und Familie.
Wir fördern flexible, individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle und unterstützen, wo es betrieblich möglich ist, durch moderne Arbeitsformen wie Homeoffice oder mobiles Arbeiten.
Faszinierende Projekte und Aufgaben bei einer der vielfältigsten Arbeitgeberinnen des Landes fordern Dein Können und warten auf Deine Handschrift.


Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerber:innen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

mobile.de is Germany's largest vehicle marketplace with about 1.4 million listed cars, trucks, and motorcycles. Both private customers and more than 40,000 registered vehicle dealers use the platform. Including listing exports to the sister platform Kleinanzeigen, mobile.de reaches about 20 million unique users per month (AGMA digital facts; mobile.de and Kleinanzeigen; categories: cars, motorcycles, commercial vehicles, motorhomes; Ø month April 2022 to March 2023). As a "one-stop shop," mobile.de offers not only buying and selling services but also financing and leasing solutions, among others. The company, founded in 1996, is a subsidiary of Adevinta, a globally leading provider of online classifieds portals.

mobile.de is part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist and sustainability leader with 25+ products in 10 countries.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

We seek an experienced Senior Product Analyst to join our cross-functional team in Trust & Safety, User Account and Product Operations. Reporting to the Product Lead, you will help provide strategic insights to understand user behaviour, evaluate impact, and steer product development according to our strategic goals.

What You'll Do

Provide analytical insights around user behaviour and key performance metrics to support ongoing and upcoming product development initiatives
Work with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers and marketers, to establish a robust measurement and reporting
Deep dive analytical data to understand user behaviour patterns and performance of operational processes
Identify opportunities to improve the product and processes
Support and collaborate with product development teams to validate hypotheses with research and experimentation (e.g. split testing) in a hybrid work model.

Who You Are

You have relevant 5+ years of Product Analytics related experience and a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field
Able to analyze complex data sets, identify trends, derive meaningful insights and provide actionable recommendations
Proficient in data analysis tools and languages (e.g. SQL, Python)
Able to communicate effectively and articulate complex analytical findings to both technical and non-technical partners
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills to address complex challenges
Proficient in using data visualization tools (e.g. GA, Looker, Tableau) for creating impactful dashboards
You understand well user behavior and experience and can make recommendations for product improvement
Familiar with A/B testing methodologies and experimentation to improve product features
Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and able to prioritize effectively
Experience in the field of Trust & Safety, User Registration, Login and SEO analytics is a bonus

Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:

An attractive Base Salary 💸
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
Employee Stock Purchase Program with a match from Adevinta 📈
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱

On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

job_title: Director Data Science (m/f/d) – any German Office
job_desc:
Director Data Science (m/f/d)

In Deutschland - Berlin | Bonn | Cologne | Frankfurt/Main | Hamburg | Munich

Looking for an innovative, agile work environment where you can have an impact on big-name companies and startups? Join Elevate - Simon Kucher’s service line for digital consulting projects. Be part of a dynamic team delivering digital growth by combining specialist knowledge in tech and data with creativity to deliver end-to-end projects with proven impact across industries.

Help businesses make informed decisions and drive growth by transforming raw data into actionable insights. Ready to boost your personal development in data science, analytics, and AI? Become a pioneer of the digital transformation and support us as a Director Data Science.

What makes us special: 
Advance your career with exciting professional opportunities in our thriving company with a startup feel
Add to your experience with our projects that focus on growth, have a positive impact, and truly matter
Voice your unique ideas in a corporate culture defined by our entrepreneurial spirit, openness, and integrity
Feel at home working with our helpful, enthusiastic colleagues who have great team spirit
Broaden your perspective with our extensive training curriculum and learning programs (e.g. LinkedIn Learning)
Speak your mind in our holistic feedback and development processes (e.g. 360-degree feedback)
Enjoy our benefits, such as daycare allowance, corporate discounts, and wellbeing support (e.g. Headspace)
Unwind in our break areas where you can help yourself to the healthy snacks and beverages provided
See another side of your coworkers at our frequent employee events and highly anticipated World Meeting and Holiday Party

How you will create an impact: 
You use your expertise to advise and support our customers from different industries in developing artificial-intelligence-driven products.
You take charge of multiple end-to-end data science projects and their respective project teams, ensuring on-time delivery of deliverables.
You independently tackle complex problems, formulate innovative solutions, and present well-founded recommendations to our clients.
You cultivate and maintain robust client relationships, gaining a deep understanding of their distinct needs and delivering customized solutions.
You promote the benefits, use cases, and impact of machine learning and AI both internally to senior leadership and externally to our clients.
In serving as the data science expert on highly innovative and analytical project opportunities, your contribution to business development is significant.
You act as a mentor to team members, offering constructive feedback to nurture their professional development.
You actively engage in activities outside of your project work to help build a brand for Simon-Kucher in the analytics community, e.g., accepting invitations to be a guest speaker, contributing through articles, blog posts, and other forms of thought leadership.
You put your attention to detail to good use by conducting research and observing changes in the advanced analytics market.

About you: 
You possess a minimum of 6 years of extensive consulting or industry experience working in data science.
You exhibit strong entrepreneurial thinking and a well-established network, coupled with exceptional communication and presentation skills, including addressing large audiences.
You showcase a track record of effectively leading strategic projects, managing diverse teams and stakeholders, resulting in successful outcomes.
You combine robust analytical and conceptual abilities with a keen eye for detail, reflecting a conscientious and dynamic approach.
In a programming language of your choice (e.g., Python, R), you can demonstrate your skills in modeling.
Your proficiency in selecting and applying AI and ML methods such as Random Forest, Neural Networks, Support Vector Machines, etc., sets you apart.
You have knowledge of the most common cloud-based machine learning engines.
You hold an exceptional university degree and are proficient in both business English and German.

About Simon-Kucher
Simon-Kucher is a global consultancy with more than 2,000 employees in 30 countries.
Our sole focus is on unlocking better growth that drives measurable revenue and profit for our clients. We achieve this by optimizing every lever of their commercial strategy – product, price, innovation, marketing, and sales – based on deep insights into what customers want and value. With nearly 40 years of experience in monetization topics of all kinds, we are regarded as the world’s leading pricing and growth specialist.

We believe in building a culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion, creating an environment in which our people feel valued, are able to be themselves and feel their contribution matters. If we get that right, remarkable things will happen; people will grow faster, innovate, feel valued, and create better outcomes for everyone – our people, our clients and, of course, our business.

Your personal contact:
Jacqueline Döring-Gil
Willy-Brandt-Allee 13, 53113 Bonn
Tel. +49 (0)228 9843-0

 Better growth starts here. With you.

job_title: Senior Applied Scientist - Zalando Marketing Services (all genders)
job_desc:
We are ambitious and committed to be the starting point of fashion for our customers and partners; therefore we are scaling our Applied Science backbone for Ads Personalization working backwards from user, content and context understanding.

As a Senior Applied Scientist in Zalando Marketing Services , you will play a key role in developing and delivering effective and scientifically-sound solutions to our main business problems real-time recommendation for our Sponsored Product and Campaign advertisements. Open-research problems are involved, at the intersection of Deep Learning, Auction Theory, Econometrics, Causal inference, and high-load low-latency Machine Learning Engineering, giving opportunities for scientific contributions.

We are looking for someone who can lead the research part of projects end-to-end and guide more junior colleagues into delivering impact from science-based systems. You will support the team working in a structured and transparent way and achieve results that we can all proudly celebrate. This position is a unique opportunity to have visible impact, and connect with exceptional talents from many different backgrounds.

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)


 Create and evolve real time recommender systems for Zalando's advertisement offering, using data such as cross-device graph, user history, browsing history, customer preference, images and embeddings of items and contents etc. 
 Collaborate with Business Owners, Product Managers and Engineers to define the vision and the roadmap for content optimization on Zalando 
 Develop methods to extract deep customer insights for our brands and teams at Zalando to help improve products and contents 
 Contribute in defining and executing roadmaps, in a way that balances research and delivery in our product landscape 
 Foster an inclusive culture and diverse team environment 



 WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF 



 PhD or MSc in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, with at least 3 years of industry experience in Machine Learning/Data Science/Deep Learning. Experience in Advertising/Ecommerce and background in Economics are considered a plus 
 Experience in project leadership and mentoring more junior colleagues under uncertainty and ambiguity 
 Proven track record in developing solutions from initial idea to production 
 Proficient in explaining details, benefits and impact of the projects to diverse audiences 



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

 Employee shares program 
 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners

Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Dich! Hilf uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Dir bieten, ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Mach mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Deiner Karriere!

Im Siemens Messgerätewerk Berlin werden mit rund 1.000 Mitarbeitenden sehr erfolgreich unterschiedlichste Schutzgeräte für die elektrische Energieverteilung und Netzüberwachung entwickelt und produziert.

Verändere mit uns die Welt von morgen.

Als Fachexperte (w/m/d) für Industrieautomatisierung und Digitalisierung bist Du essenzieller Teil unsere Produktions-& Technologieabteilung und bei der Umsetzung von Projekten und Inbetriebnahmen, mit dem Schwerpunkt maschinenspezifischer Applikation sowie die Einbindung in das innerbetriebliche Netzwerk. 
Dabei liegt Dein Fokus auf der ständigen Weiterentwicklung unserer Fertigungsprozesse,-Maschinen, der damit verbundenen Prozesssteuerung im Bereich der Flachbaugruppenfertigung sowie deren Datenanbindungen.
Eine Deiner Aufgabe im operativen Technologie-Support ist die sorgfältige Analyse von Störfällen und deren Behebung an Clients und Applikationen im Fertigungsumfeld.
Du hast die Verantwortung, Sicherheitsvorgaben und Schutzkonzepte (Cybersecurity) im Rahmen der Automatisierungen verlässlich umzusetzen.

Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium, vorzugsweise im Bereich Automatisierungstechnik, Informatik, Maschinenbau / Produktionstechnik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation (z. B. Industrial Engineering oder Mechatronik), idealerweise mit mehrjähriger relevanter Berufserfahrung.
Alternativ hast Du einen Abschluss als Techniker und bringst langjährige, relevante Berufserfahrung mit.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Automatisierungstechnik und Erfahrung im Bereich von Produktionsmaschinen (vorzugsweise Elektronikproduktion) sowie Informatik sind wünschenswert, um Dir den Einstieg zu erleichtern.
Kenntnisse im Bereich SQL, Datenbanken und Clouddiensten helfen Dir bei der kontinuierlichen Erhöhung des Digitalisierungsgrades.
Erfahrungen im Bereich Robotik, mit Schwerpunkt auf autonome Transportsysteme (AGV), und ein umfängliches Wissen über Netzwerktopologien und Maschinenkommunikation sind wünschenswert.
Solltest Du bereits Kenntnisse oder Erfahrungen mit den Softwareprodukten der Firmen ASM oder Asys haben, ist das von Vorteil.
Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse zur verlässlichen Kommunikation innerhalb des Werkes und mit externen Partnern. 
Lernfähigkeit und Teamfähigkeit, hohes Verantwortungsbewusstsein bei der Arbeit, fortgeschrittene Fähigkeiten zur Problemlösung sowie eine analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für Dich selbstverständlich.

Was wir bieten.

Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung 
Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
Vielfältige Gesundheitsangebote
Attraktive Siemens Altersvorsorge
Barrierefreie Standorte
Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Du willst: Bewirb Dich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

https://new.siemens.com/ - wenn Du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.

FAQ - wenn Du eine Frage zum Thema Bewerbung bei Siemens hast.

Warum zu uns

Seit Dezember 2022 ist die con|energy consult gmbh Teil der Tagueri AG. Unter dem gemeinsamen Dach werden professionelle Lösungen für die Energiethemen der Gegenwart und Zukunft angeboten.

Spannende Projekte, die mit großer Eigenverantwortung und im ständigen Austausch mit den Kund:innen erfolgreich entwickelt werden, sind die Basis, auf der das offene Miteinander und die gemeinsame Mission, die Energiewirtschaft von Morgen zu gestalten, aufbauen. Wir fördern die Stärken jedes Mitarbeitenden, um auch den Freiraum zur persönlichen Entfaltung im Beruf zu bieten.

Bei con|energy consult können Sie nicht nur Ihre Karriere vorantreiben, sondern die Zukunft mitgestalten. Werden Sie Teil unseres Teams als Data Scientist Schwerpunkt Energiewende*.

Was wir gemeinsam vorhaben

Kundenspezifische Aufgabenstellungen im Zuge der kommunalen Wärmeplanung und integrierten Infrastrukturplanung analysieren und modellieren
Bei der Konzeptionierung und Programmierung unserer cloudbasierten Softwarelösung simergy unterstützen
Modellentwicklungen unseres Simulationsmodells (zum Teil) verantworten
Große Datenmengen zur Beantwortung aktueller Fragestellungen analysieren, verarbeiten sowie visualisieren
ETL-Prozesse erarbeiten und weiterentwickeln
Mit dem Projektteam, Stakeholder:innen und Kund:innen direkt kommunizieren (intern als auch extern) und eng zusammenarbeiten

Womit Sie überzeugen

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Energiewirtschaft oder Energietechnik
Berufserfahrung im energiewirtschaftlichen Umfeld von Vorteil
Analytische und konzeptionelle Denkweise sowie hohe Affinität zu Zahlen und Algorithmen
Erfahrung und Freude an der Modellierung von komplexen technisch-wirtschaftlichen Zusammenhängen
Erfahrungen in einer Programmiersprache wie z.B. Python
Erste Erfahrungen mit Relationalen Datenbanken wie z.B. SQL sowie Cloud Computing (z.B. AWS, Docker)
Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Geodaten und Tools wie z.B. QGIS von Vorteil 
Gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Ausgeprägter Teamgeist und Verantwortungsbewusstsein
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift 

Worauf Sie sich freuen

Unsere Besondere Unternehmenskultur

Arbeiten in einem renommierten, stark wachsenden Beratungs- und Dienstleistungshaus, das sich zusammen mit der Tagueri AG mit einem eigenen Nachhaltigkeitsprogramm für die Energiewende engagiert 
Zahlreiche Team- und Unternehmensevent, wie unser jährliches Sommerfest zusammen mit unseren Familien

Unsere Benefits für Wohlergehen und Wachstum:

Smartes Arbeiten, z.B. Mobiles Arbeiten an bis zu zwei Tagen pro Woche 
Zusatzleistungen, z.B. JobRad, Job-Ticket sowie Öko-Zuschuss

Unser gemeinsamer Weg:

Anspruch und Abwechslung in den Projekten bei namhaften Kund:innen der Energiewirtschaft und ihren Partner:innen
Intensive Einarbeitung durch ein strukturiertes Onboarding
Regelmäßige Feedback- und Mitarbeitendengespräche zur schnellen persönlichen Weiterentwicklung

Was Sie wissen sollten

Wir suchen Persönlichkeiten! Daher prüfen wir Ihre Bewerbung nicht ausschließlich auf eine bestimmte Stelle bezogen, sondern als eine Bewerbung an das Unternehmen Tagueri sowie con|energy consult gmbh. In einem persönlichen Gespräch finden wir gemeinsam heraus, ob Ihre Ziele und unsere Vorstellungen zueinander passen.

Sie finden sich nicht im Themengebiet und Standort wieder? Lassen Sie uns gerne Ihre Initiativbewerbung zukommen. Vergleichbare Themen haben wir auch an anderen Standorten!

Alles Weitere erzählen wir Ihnen in einem persönlichen Gespräch. Senden Sie Ihre Unterlagen entweder per Mail an bewerbung@tagueri.com oder nutzen Sie den "Jetzt Bewerben"-Button (Dateigröße max. 35 MB).

Über uns

con|energy consult ist Teil der Tagueri AG, einer wachsenden Unternehmensberatung mit über 750 Mitarbeitenden deutschlandweit.

Wir bei con|energy consult beraten Unternehmen der Energiewirtschaft, ihre Partner:innen und Kommunen, wenn es um strategische, wirtschaftliche, politische und organisatorische Fragen zur Energieversorgung und ihrer Transformation geht. Wir sind leidenschaftliche Expert:innen in den Themen der Energie-, Wärme- und Mobilitätswende – vom ersten Kund:innengespräch bis zum erfolgreichen Abschluss. Dabei sind wir uns unserer gesellschaftlichen Verantwortung bewusst und unterstützen unsere Kund:innen in der sich stetig verändernden Energiewelt.

Wir sind uns unserer gesellschaftlichen Verantwortung bewusst und daher fördern und leben wir eine tolerante, feedbackgebende und nachhaltige Unternehmenskultur.

 Geschlecht, Hautfarbe, Alter, Herkunft, Hobbys, Religion, sexuelle Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität? Für uns nicht relevant! Diskriminierung lehnen wir ab! Um unser Engagement für ein diverses Miteinander zu unterstreichen, haben wir in 2022 die Charta der Vielfalt unterschrieben.

With its leading delivery platform to ship parcels, Seven Senders makes international shipping a simple matter. Established in 2015, we have 250+ employees and delivered 100m+ parcels thus far.

Job Description

The Cost & Revenue Data Management team at Seven Senders aims at providing the basis for a truly data-driven company and delivering world-class financial services. This includes one of our most important processes: the invoicing of our customers. We combine data from a multitude of data sources along the supply chain for a more efficient, reliable, and faster invoicing process.

As our (Junior) Data Manager (f/m/x), you will take ownership of the creation of invoices for our customers and take responsibility for the end-to-end process - from data collection to final invoice creation in our SQL-based invoicing tool.

You have an impact on the following topics
Manage and execute the monthly invoicing process, ensuring accurate and timely billing
Collect the necessary data for invoice creation, ensuring completeness and accuracy
Utilize and maintain our automated SQL-based invoicing tool
Collaborate on cross-functional projects, contributing to the development of new features

Qualifications

This is what you need to succeed
You are number driven and ideally already have some work experience in a Data team
You have a strong command of SQL for data manipulation and analysis
You are proficient in Excel and/or Google Sheets, enabling effective data presentation
You have an analytical mindset complemented by excellent communication skills
You pay attention to detail, ensuring data accuracy and quality

Additional Information

7 reasons to join Seven Senders
Flexibility:Our new brand office is at Alexanderplatz, we have a hybrid model of working with flexible remote-office set-up and flexible working hours. And if you wish, for up to 2 months per year you can work from almost anywhere.
Benefits: We offer annual inflation increases, German & English language courses.
Growth: We want you to grow and develop your career with us. Apart from exciting work, we offer a development platform via our 7Senders Training Academy.
Commitment: We offer unlimited permanent German contracts in an established industry.
Mission Zero: Climate-neutral and long-term impact. With our green initiatives, we are reaching climate neutrality for ourselves, and, hopefully, we're inspiring the entire logistics sector to join us to create a sustainable future.
Real impact: You will be a key player in driving our data-driven financial services forward.
Culture: We embody collaboration, open doors, and no-fuss results-focus and we are successful with our data-driven and efficient working approach. We like to celebrate and come together: team events and BBQ parties are here for you. We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, or disability.
If you meet the above qualifications and are excited about the opportunity to join our team, we encourage you to submit your application today. Please scroll down to submit your English CV. We look forward to hearing from you!

Data is a critical part of our product development process and we are the chief advocates for its quality and usage. We are looking for a Principal Product Analyst (f/m/d) who can quickly jump in, understand, evaluate, recommend, and make an impact on the digital experiences on Zalando for customers.

You will be working in an exciting team focused on delivering a tailored discovery experience to our customers via a great personalization, browse and search experience. Working closely with teams of Product Managers, Software Engineers, Applied Scientists, and Business Leaders, you will be leading data-explorations, A/B tests, hypothesis analysis, and other statistical approaches focused on understanding the products and the customers, as well as the continuous reporting and monitoring of critical business KPIs. Your analytical understanding helps you to see clearly how our experiences perform and how they can be improved. Your strong communication skills provide you a solid foundation to convey the insights and findings to a wide range of stakeholders, including those in the leadership positions.

In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


 Create a strategy, align with key partners, generate insights, deliver analysis, and deliver ongoing improvements independently for an ambiguous problem. 
 Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding of what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved. 
 Be a data explorer, an educator, and a partner in decision making. 
 Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights 
 Give (analytical) evidence supporting business decisions - investments, roll-out, and/or additional deep-dives. 
 Define the key performance metrics for the teams to judge and monitor product performance. 
 Advising in the set-up of A/B Tests or other quasi-experiments for new features and business opportunities, analysing, and deep-diving into the results to give recommendations. 
 Serve as an interface between data stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment, communication, and understanding of data products and analyses. 
 Experience in working directly with Senior stakeholders. 


WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF


 5+ years of relevant working experience in a data-intensive analytics role where you learned how to work with raw data, such as in Digital Analytics, Product Analytics, or Business Intelligence, preferably in e-commerce. 
 Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined. 
 Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery. 
 Experience with advanced analytics and statistical software languages (R or Python). 
 Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and/or quasi-experimental analysis methodologies. 
 Experience in tracking and analysis of onsite user behaviour (for example using Google Analytics or a similar service). 
 Strong communication skills and the ability to explain processes, choices, and insights to stakeholders. 


If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!

Unter der Marke Circle K betreut unser Kunde Convenience-Shops in 1.200 Servicestationen deutschlandweit. Deine Aufgaben

Du bist für das Pricing aller Kraftstoffe für ein Gebiet von 250 Tankstellen zuständig
Mit Hilfe von Tools analysierst Du täglich die Performance und Preiselastizität der Tankstellen in Bezug auf Mengen, Margen, Wettbewerb und Verkehrsflüssen
Du bist erster Ansprechpartner für die Tankstellen und den Außendienst in Bezug auf Pricing

Interessiert?

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Circle K in Deutschland

Circle K ist neu auf dem deutschen Markt, aber Teil des weltweiten Konzerns Alimentation Couche-Tard. Wir sind damit Teil eines führenden Unternehmens im Convenience- und Kraftstoffeinzelhandel, das in 30 Ländern und Regionen mit mehr 16.000 Filialen tätig ist, von denen etwa 11.000 Kraftstoffe anbieten. Couche-Tard beschäftigt mehr als 130.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit. Die Marke Circle K kennst Du vielleicht von einer Urlaubsreise nach Dänemark, Polen oder Skandinavien. Dort sind wir seit Jahren erfolgreich im Bereich Retail und versorgen Menschen tagtäglich, damit sie mobil sind und sich unterwegs stärken können.

Werde ein wichtiger Teil unseres gemeinsamen Wachstums!

Unsere Mission bei Circle K ist es, das Leben der Menschen jeden Tag ein wenig einfacher zu machen. Unsere globale Familie in 30 Ländern macht dies für unsere Millionen von Kundinnen und Kunden weltweit möglich. Deshalb wollen wir unserer Kundschaft und unseren Mitarbeitenden helfen, ihre Ziele zu erreichen und mit uns zu wachsen. Wir zeichnen uns durch unsere Kultur des Miteinanders aus. Wir sind stolz auf unsere Mitarbeiter und deren Entwicklung. Wir sind stolz auf das, was wir aufgebaut haben und auf das, was wir anstreben. Unabhängig davon, woher Du kommst oder wohin Du Dich beruflich entwickeln möchtest, bei Circle K gibt es einen Platz, an dem Du wachsen kannst.

Wenn Du wächst, wachsen wir - gemeinsam.

Über uns

Seit fast 60 Jahren bringen wir als Personalvermittlung Unternehmen und Bewerber erfolgreich zusammen. Wir verstehen uns dabei aber nicht nur als Personaldienstleister – wir geben unseren Mitarbeitern die Möglichkeit zur beruflichen Entfaltung und unseren Kunden den besten Service. Mit unserem umfassenden Markt- und Branchenwissen bieten wir Dienstleistungen in den Bereichen Zeitarbeit, Outsourcing und direkter Personalvermittlung an. Wir begleiten unsere Mitarbeiter persönlich und erarbeiten mit ihnen gemeinsam, wie sie ihre Fähigkeiten ausbauen und ihre Ziele erreichen können. Dank unserer umfassenden Weiterbildungsprogramme finden wir für jeden eine individuelle Lösung. Wir beraten neue Bewerber gerne und helfen dabei, genau den passenden Job zu finden.

Are you ready to take the helm of a science team at the forefront of performance marketing innovation? Zalando, Europe's leading fashion platform, is looking for an Head of Data Science to join our Performance Marketing powerhouse, to lead the charge for leading scientific solutions in the field.

About The Role

In this pivotal position, you'll be steering a team dedicated to crafting data-driven strategies that resonate with millions and convert intent into long-term customer value. Your domain will be the Measurement marketing effectiveness, and developing innovative solutions to optimize marketing channel performance, where you'll apply your mastery of machine learning, predictive models, optimisation algorithm, experimentation and causal inference to drive success in our significant marketing investments.


WHO YOU ARE?


Embarking on a journey to redefine the nexus of data science and performance marketing, we are in search of an exceptional leader. Here's who you are in the landscape of our ambitious mission


Scientific Leader You are a visionary with a passion for guiding teams through the frontier of data science in performance marketing. With a Master's or PhD in a quantitative field, your leadership is informed by deep technical knowledge and strategic thinking. 
Leading Leaders Boasting at least 3 years in leading leaders, you are adept at managing diverse teams, and tea leads foster an environment where machine learning, econometrics, and experimentation are leveraged to drive business outcomes. 
Collaboration Champion You excel at fostering synergistic partnerships, working cohesively with product teams, engineers, and marketing professionals, alongside senior and principal scientists, to steer the team towards a shared vision and unified goals. 
Catalyst for Innovation With a track record of empowering teams, you encourage ownership and continuous innovation, translating scientific rigor into tangible solutions that propel the business forward. 
Business Savvy You bring a robust understanding of business operations, particularly within performance marketing, and use this to guide your team through organizational challenges towards clear, department-aligned goals. 



WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



 Mentor other applied scientists, review and guide their work, help develop roadmaps for the team and be a role model for them 
 Keep the team up-to-date with the latest research in causal inference methods. 
 Provide egoless constructive scientific feedback to peers and coach team members to become great researchers 
 Contribute to and improve team and company processes that ensure high quality research through documentation, peer review, and structured feedback 


What We Are Looking For


 Ph.D. in Quantitative fields, Computer science, Statistics, or other quantitative science fields with an emphasis on computational research methods. Demonstrated experience to manage an industrial research project for at least 5 years. 
 Experience applying advanced causal identification research methods (experimental and/or quasi-experimental designs). 
 Strong general scientific problem solving skills. Thinks strategically, but also stays on top of tactical execution. 
 As a self-starter, you drive results and have the ability to communicate relevant analytical insights from data to both technical and non-technical audiences. 
 Demonstrated ability to mentor other scientists. Strong sense of ownership, urgency and drive. 



Why Join Us?



 You'll be a key player in a department that's a driving force behind Zalando's growth. 
 You'll have access to cutting-edge infrastructure and massive datasets. 
 You will build leading solution to optimize advertising on platform like Google Search and Meta 
 Your work will blend scientific rigor with real-world business impact, celebrated globally. 
 You'll shape the future of marketing as Zalando transforms into The Starting Point for Fashion. 



Perks at Work 



 Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events 
 Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings 
 Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts 
 Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations) 


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

About Zalando

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 35+ million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Please note that all the applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.


Ready to Lead, Inspire, and Innovate?


Apply now and join us on this exhilarating journey where your work will not only be seen but felt across the fashion industry and beyond.

THE ROLE & THE TEAM

In Zalando ZEOS (B2B Logistics), we aim to provide our partners with a profitable fulfillment experience, not only within Zalando but across multiple European marketplaces. We provide a holistic approach to delivering the optimal fulfillment solution to meet our partners’ needs by unifying these services under a single umbrella, and we see that Data and Analytics will play a pivotal role in enabling data-driven insights and decision-making for our partners and business stakeholders.

As a Data Analytics Engineer within the B2B Logistics Data Engineering team, you will be working with Data Engineers, Analysts, Reporting Engineers, and Product Managers. You bring with you equal amounts of technical and business acumen. You will play a key role in designing and building an analytics data layer that will serve as the gold standard of KPIs for analytics and reporting stakeholders across the department.

WHY YOU SHOULD BE INTERESTED…


 You will join a relatively new and growing team of Data Engineers spearheading Data Engineering and analytics within the Connected Network department. We trust your entrepreneurial capabilities! 
 Work in a multi-functional setup to identify and support our partner’s analytics needs and use cases and collaborate across the engineering, reporting, and analytics teams to build and develop the analytics layer of our data platform. 
 You will enable stakeholders to work effectively and independently with data by designing, implementing, and testing high-quality data models adhering to engineering best practices 
 Design, implement, and maintain ETL pipelines feeding downstream applications to help our partners gain meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions to optimize and grow their business. 


WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF…


 You are a true team player who believes in the power of a group rather than individuals 
 You have 4+ years of Data Engineering experience working with analytics and reporting teams and stakeholders 
 You are experienced in distributed data processing using Spark SQL and PySpark (Databricks is a plus) 
 You are proficient with Python with a passion for writing clean, modular, and maintainable production code 
 You are knowledgeable in SQL, Relational or MPP data warehouses, ETL design and development, pipeline orchestration; 
 Experience with a data visualization tool 
 You have experience building data solutions on cloud, preferably AWS 
 You can communicate complex business processes clearly and concisely, capture KPIs and analytics requirements from stakeholders and turn transactional data into aggregated datasets to enable reporting use cases 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a detail oriented and self-starter mindset. You value a diverse and fast-paced business environment, and hence balance your passion for big data and analytics with pragmatism to drive actions and impact 
 Knowledge on Airflow, Git, CI/CD, and DevOps are nice to have. 



ABOUT ZALANDO


It’s the perfect time to join Zalando’s journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to becoming the Starting Point for Fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 25 markets.

Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 49 million active customers.

Data Analytics Manager – Berlin, Essen, Hamburg or Munich, Germany

We are looking for Senior Data Analytics Managers or Data Scientists to strengthen our clients team who are based in in either Berlin, Essen, Hamburg or Munich to work on multiple European-wide consulting programmes of work in the areas of data analysis and data science.

You will lead projects in the area of data analysis, focusing on data, technologies and strategy as well as the development and further development of sub-service line data analytics.

You will be responsible for planning the scope, schedule, budget and communication with stakeholders, helping them define data, and understand what insights they need, and then visualise this, to then help them form effective investment or business driven plans or decisions.

This role will require you to lead teams in national and international big data projects where you will evaluate various methods and tools for data analytics as well as data mining and support the end clients in the conception and development of BI and big data platforms and the selection of storage technologies. Exceptionally strong stakeholder management and problem solving skills will be required.

Skills & Experience required
Consultancy experience working with clients on large complex enterprise data programmes

We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Analyst to join our Rider Experience team and help us scale and improve our main Rider app for millions of users across 45 countries.

About Us
Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 100 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role
At Bolt, our Rider Experience team is passionate about creating a fast, user-friendly, and enjoyable ride-hailing experience. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to co-lead and guide our efforts in addressing complex challenges related to rider experience, optimising user journeys, and identifying opportunities for product enhancements.

As a Senior Product Analyst, you’ll be more than just a data expert; you'll be part of key decision-makers, actively contributing to the success of our mission by shaping the future of our product and fostering user satisfaction alongside our dedicated Rider Experience team.

Your daily adventures will include:
Collaborate closely with product managers, UX designers, engineers, and other cross-functional team members to proactively identify data-driven opportunities to improve our user experience
Analyse customer journey data to identify funnel optimisation opportunities, enhancing conversion rates, and minimising user drop-offs
Conduct in-depth analysis of large datasets, extracting insights and trends that inform product improvements and contribute to user growth
Investigate user behaviour patterns and gather feedback to provide actionable insights for product development and user experience improvement
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualisations to communicate findings and monitor product performance across various KPIs
Design and execute A/B tests, analyse results and provide recommendations to optimise and iterate on product features
Champion a data-driven culture within the team and organisation, helping to inform decisions and prioritise initiatives based on data insights

About you:
You hold a BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
You have at least 2-4 years of experience dealing with large volumes of data
You can rank your SQL skills as “outstanding” and Python/R experience as “profound”
You have experience with some BI tools and data visualisation
You can prove your ability to lead experimentation: applied statistics, designing and analysing experiments, providing recommendations
You have a strong interest in and understanding of the consumer-facing side of the marketplace, focusing on enhancing user experience and engagement
You have a high interest in the bigger picture, the ability to understand and contribute to product strategy
Your verbal and written communication skills are outstanding
You are fluent in English
If you had a chance to gain some experience with ML frameworks, it would be an advantage

Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:
Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.

mobile.de is Germany's largest vehicle marketplace with about 1.4 million listed cars, trucks, and motorcycles. Both private customers and more than 40,000 registered vehicle dealers use the platform. Including listing exports to the sister platform Kleinanzeigen, mobile.de reaches about 20 million unique users per month (AGMA digital facts; mobile.de and Kleinanzeigen; categories: cars, motorcycles, commercial vehicles, motorhomes; Ø month April 2022 to March 2023). As a "one-stop shop," mobile.de offers not only buying and selling services but also financing and leasing solutions, among others. The company, founded in 1996, is a subsidiary of Adevinta, a globally leading provider of online classifieds portals.

mobile.de is part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist and sustainability leader with 25+ products in 10 countries.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

At mobile.de, we are seeking a Senior Data Scientist (d/f/m) for our C2B Team in Berlin. Our team's mission is to empower Private Sellers and our Dealers, providing them with the best tools and data-driven insights to reach the perfect match. We focus on bridging the gap between individual sellers and dealerships, ensuring a seamless and efficient sales process. In this dynamic environment, we maintain a collaborative approach, fostering a close-knit and supportive team atmosphere. Join us in our pursuit to revolutionise the way private sellers engage with the automotive marketplace.

What You'll Do

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will help us refine and personalise our pricing models. This ensures our sellers get both accurate and competitive prices for their cars based on the market situation and our dealers get access to a wide range of quality vehicles at fair and transparent prices.

Translate customer insights / business problems into impactful experiments/ ML challenges
Build POCs and demonstrate their value to stakeholders
Implement complex solutions using readable, reusable code along with the right technology
Iterate on and improve our pricing algorithm to ensure it's both competitive and precise
Leverage data to better understand user behaviours and segment them accordingly
Work closely with the team to use these insights to create specific products or services
Proactively support the team in shaping the strategic approach to develop our products and businesses
Implement continuous improvements to ensure we stay ahead in the market

Who You Are

Relevant education on MSc or Ph.D. level (statistics, computer science, economics, or similar)
4+ years of experience in software development and data analysis using Python, R, SQL and/or NoSQL
Proven data science experience - preferably in marketplaces and tech industries
Strong background in Machine Learning and Cloud Platforms
Experience in cross-functional product development (e.g. Developers, UX, Product Managers)
Passion for Agile (Kanban/Scrum) software development, product discovery, and continuous deployment
Based or entitled to work in the EU

Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:

An attractive Base Salary 💸
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
Employee Stock Purchase Program with a match from Adevinta 📈
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱

On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

About us
 We exist to help women make informed decisions about their fertility and overall female health by making products that fit seamlessly into their lives.
 
 ⭐ ABOUT THE COMPANY
 inne is the next generation of female health tech enabling natural contraception and fertility care.
 We exist to help women make informed decisions about their fertility and overall female health by making products that fit seamlessly into their lives, and have developed our first innovative biotech product which enables women to analyze fertility hormones in their saliva. Since our launch in 2020 we have enabled thousands of women to track their progesterone levels and helped hundreds of women to predict their ovulation for conception.
 
 We are an interdisciplinary team who has seen first hand how women’s need for female health education and accurate fertility insights have been underserved. Through our mission, we are pushing the boundaries of science, technology and design guided by our values.
 
 We are just about to take the next step into an incredible journey of female health, launching new products in 2024. If you want to be part of creating a wave in female health, you have come to the right place!
 
 ⚡ YOUR MISSION 
Be responsible for the continuous improvement and expansion of the inne hormonal algorithm
Perform in-depth analysis and build models on top of the rich hormonal and user input data of inne
Contribute to the continuous optimization and implementation of best practices and adoption of new technologies in the data science and tech team
Own data science projects end-to-end from problem-framing to production and monitoring
Collaborate with our diverse team of developers, embedded engineers, designers, product managers, and scientists
Have a direct impact on the inne MINILAB
 
 ☀ ABOUT YOU 
Programming Experience in Python and typescript/javascript and in bringing data science code into production
PhD or MSc in statistics, physics, mathematics, computational biology, or any similar field
3+ years of work experience in the tech industry
Understanding of key statistical concepts and the ability to perform and interpret data analyses
Experience in working closely with product team and designer to deliver user-centric solutions
Working experience in an Agile/Scrum methodology
Knowledge of SQL, cloud platforms, BI tools, and ML/AI is a plus
 
 ❤ WORKING WITH US
 Being part of our team means joining an expedition.
 
 We uncover, we learn, we innovate and we do it with compassion at the heart of it all. Our goal is to shed light on the connection between hormones and female health and create new resources for women to access a deeper understanding of themselves.
 
 If you are looking for a job that is more than “just a job” and you are hungry to bring your skills to the amazing mix of talent behind inne, then this is the right place for you. Join us to push the boundaries of female health!
 
 ✨ OUR OFFER AND BENEFITS 
Competitive salary.
Flexible vacation with a minimum of 25 days per year.
Workation policy: possibility to work remotely for up to three weeks at a time, and can be combined with up to two weeks vacation.
Possibility to participate in the company’s virtual stock options programme.
Monthly sessions with an external coach.
Urban Sports Club membership sponsored.
Hybrid work model with a beautiful, central and dog-friendly office location in Berlin.
An opportunity to work in a fast-growing startup that has developed its own innovative product.
A fun and friendly work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.
