BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We are transforming how the music industry works, by enabling our teams to drive business growth, operate more efficiently and effectively and better serve our artists and songwriters via the power of robust data driven decision making, using our modern data stack.

As an experienced Data Scientist (f/m/d), you will be at the forefront of establishing our Data Science function and delivering key contributions to BMG’s overarching advanced analytics agenda. In close collaboration with business stakeholders and our data team, you will design advanced analytics models to provide actionable insights, introduce predictive analytics cross-functionally and globally implement AI and machine learning projects with strategic business impact. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

Your Tasks 
Demonstrate conceptual thought leadership regarding the feasibility of various ML (machine learning) and selected AI initiatives (including generative AI) with strategic business impact
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and management to deliver business objectives via scalable, robust data science solutions
Develop advanced statistical / ML models, to extract meaningful insights from large data sets
Conduct EDA, feature engineering, and model evaluation to ensure robust and accurate models (e.g. to forecast revenue, predict music consumer demand and spot talents early to guide investments, A&R and marketing; hypothesis testing and causal analysis; semantic analysis of audio and text content)
Provide training to junior team members and suggest best practices to scale an effective and efficient data science function

Your Skillset 
Master's or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or similar fields
Demonstrable, extensive experience of delivering commercially beneficial data science / ML / AI solutions
Expert in Python and SQL
Advanced knowledge of data analysis, statistical modeling, ML/AI frameworks and data manipulation tools
Experience with implementing LLMs (large language models)
Prior music industry exposure and experience working with dbt, git, GCP and/or Looker is a strong plus

Your Mindset
Strong problem-solving skills, with a strategic, results-driven mindset to derive business insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, confident to present findings to senior management
Collaborative mindset, thriving in an international and cross-functional team environment
Desire to be on the edge of technological development
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment

What We Offer
A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, an annual Headspace membership, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, discounts for Bertelsmann employees etc.
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.

About The Opportunity

As a WFM Forecasting Expert in the WFM team, you are responsible for producing high quality demand forecasts for different work streams across operations. Your forecasts will be used for capacity planning, budget planning, and shift scheduling of our in-house teams and external partners. Additionally your forecasting expertise will be used to support the implementation of new products and key initiatives, and you will be the internal go-to person for forecasting related questions. You will challenge existing frameworks and implement innovative solutions using your experience and knowledge.

In This Role, You Will

Forecast resource requirements across different teams and work streams to meet customer/stakeholder demand and required service levels.
Produce analytics on forecast performance, as well as volume evolution and the effect of internal or external factors on volume such as new product launches.
Assist in the further development of forecasting methodologies, models and tools in order to increase forecast accuracy and efficiency.
Partner with Growth, Membership, and Product Teams to understand the key drivers of volume and incorporate them into the forecasting and planning process.
Provide consultative support for the leadership team, guiding and advising to develop effective productivity measures, performance management intelligence and resource planning effectiveness.
Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.
Maintain an accurate events log detailing what is included in the forecast and reasons for variance to forecast.

What You Need To Be Successful

2+ years of experience working in demand forecasting, resource planning, or directly related field
Advanced level of ability in applied mathematics, statistics, scenario modelling, demand modelling and analysis
Expert with Excel or Google Sheets, and ability with SQL, Python, or R is a huge plus
Experience with business analytics platforms such as Google Looker, Metabase, or similar systems
Graduated with a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or other related field of study/relevant level of professional experience

Traits

Actively help yourself (and others) be successful.
Continuously learn and challenge the status quo.
Think globally, act locally.
Strong bias for action.
Give and receive open, direct and timely feedback. 

What’s In It For You

Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe’s most talked about disruptors 🚀.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation. 
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members. 
Vacation days vary depending on your location of work. Additional day of annual leave for each year of service. 
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses. 
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.

Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today’s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it’s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

Founded in 2013, N26 now has more than 8 million customers in 24 markets. We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

job_title: Duales Studium Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen mit integrierter Berufsausbildung 2024 (w/m/d)
job_desc:
Die Deutsche Bahn ist eine der vielfältigsten Arbeitgeberinnen Deutschlands. Wir suchen Jahr für Jahr neue Talente für ein Duales Studium. Bei uns kannst du einsteigen und gleichzeitig an einer Hochschule studieren. Durch die Kombination von Praxis und Theorie das perfekte Sprungbrett für deine Karriere.

Zum 01.08.2024 suchen wir dich für das ca. 4,5-jährige Duale Studium zum Bachelor of Engineering Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen mit integrierter Berufsausbildung zum:zur Eisenbahner:in in der Zugverkehrssteuerung (w/m/d) für die DB InfraGO AG am Standort Berlin.

Das erwartet dich: 

Zunächst startest du mit einem 1-monatigen Vorpraktikum, um das Unternehmen und die Betriebszentrale kennenzulernen. Anschließend wechseln sich deine Theorie- und Praxisphasen regelmäßig ab


Während deiner Praxisphasen machst du dich mit den Aufgaben in der Zugverkehrssteuerung vertraut. Zudem erhältst du umfassende Einblicke in die Arbeiten der Bezirksleitung im täglichen Bahnbetrieb sowie in die Planung der Fahrpläne im Regelbetrieb und während der Durchführung von Baumaßnahmen.

Für die Theoriephasen besuchst du von Anfang an Vorlesungen an der Fachhochschule Erfurt sowie die Schule ebenfalls mit dem Standort Erfurt


Nach 2 Jahren beendest du deine Ausbildung zum:zur Eisenbahner:in in der Zugverkehrssteuerung im elektronischen Stellwerk und sammelst in einem mindestens 6-monatigen Einsatz wichtige Praxiserfahrung in der Betriebszentrale in Berlin.

In der verbleibenden Studienzeit bist du während des Sommer- und Wintersemesters an der Fachhochschule Erfurt. In den vorlesungsfreien Zeiten wendest du dein Wissen in der Praxis an und festigst es


In der Hochschule erlernst du die Grundlagen der BWL und VWL, des Verkehrs- und Transportwesens, der Informatik sowie des Rechtswesens. Weiterhin erwirbst du umfangreiches Fachwissen im Bereich Eisenbahnwesen, insbesondere in Infrastrukturplanung und -bau, der Transportwirtschaft sowie in der Verkehrspolitik.

Später kannst du zwischen den drei Vertiefungsrichtungen Eisenbahnbetrieb, Trassenmanagement & Vertrieb oder Planung Eisenbahninfrastruktur wählen


Dein Profil: 

Du hast dein (Fach-)Abitur (bald) erfolgreich absolviert oder verfügst über eine entsprechende berufliche Qualifikation (beruflich Qualifizierte müssen die entsprechenden Voraussetzungen für die Immatrikulation an der FH Erfurt erfüllen) 
Mathe und Physik sind deine Lieblingsfächer 
Dein Interesse für den Bahnbetrieb sowie für wirtschaftliche und technische Zusammenhänge ist groß 
Du behältst auch in schwierigen Situationen einen kühlen Kopf und hast ein gutes Koordinationsvermögen 
Deine konzentrierte Arbeitsweise und gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit zeichnen dich aus 
Die Bereitschaft, im Schichtdienst und (nach der Ausbildung) auch am Wochenende sowie an Feiertagen zu arbeiten, bringst du mit 
Außerdem bist du mobil 


Für diese Stelle erwartet dich im Rahmen des Auswahlprozesses eine Eignungsuntersuchung. Auf unserer Karriereseite erfährst du alles über die Hintergründe, den Ablauf und die ideale Vorbereitung.

Benefits:

Du erhältst von uns ein Notebook, das Du zum Lernen und auch privat nutzen kannst."
Je nach Studienjahr zwischen 1.101 Euro und 1.233 Euro im Monat sowie ein Studienbonus von 3.500 Euro. Die Beschäftigungsbedingungen gelten für den weit überwiegenden Teil der Auszubildenden im DB Konzern. * Entgeltbeträge sind gültig ab dem 01.01.2022.
Über Teamgrenzen hinweg: Der Austausch mit anderen Studierenden, z.B. durch unser vielfältiges Event- und Vernetzungsangebot, verschafft Dir konzernweit hilfreiche Kontakte.


Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerber:innen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Wir suchen für unser Team Stromeinkauf Senior Energy Data Analyst*in/PPA-Expert*in mit Erfahrung im Energiemarkt.
DEINE AUFGABEN
Du hilfst beim Aufbau eines Grünen Stromportfolios für die Erzeugung von grünem Wasserstoff
Du arbeitest an der Schnittstelle von Strommarkt, RES-Erzeugung und innovativer Wasserstoffproduktion
Du analysierst (externe) Wetterdaten und Marktpreisdaten, und gestaltest den Aufbau unserer Datenbank
Du analysierst diverse Wasserstoff-Produktionsmodi, in Abhängigkeit von unterschiedlichen Strom-Marktpreisszenarien
Du unterstützt fachlich in allen Projektphasen von der Planung der Wasserstoff- und Prozessdampferzeugung bis zum Monitoring der Erzeugung und des Stromportfoliomanagements.
Du verantwortest die Weiterentwicklung und die Pflege unserer Datenmodelle
Analyse und Umsetzung der neuen Trends von (erneuerbaren) Stromlieferverträgen
Du baust vertrauensvolle Beziehungen zu Stakeholdern und Partnern auf und unterstützt bei der Verhandlung und dem Abschluss von PPA-Verträgen für erneuerbaren Strom
DEIN PROFIL
mindestens 6 Jahre Berufserfahrung
ein umfangreiches Wissen und Erfahrungen in der Datenanalytik und den entsprechenden Methoden und Algorithmen
Kenntnisse in Python, sowohl für die Datenverarbeitung, -auswertung und Präsentation.
Erfahrungen mit relationalen (Zeitreihen-)Datenbanken (SQL), idealerweise in Timescale und PostgreSQL.
Erfahrungen mit dem Energiemarkt und/oder Wetterdaten
Teamplayer:in die mit Leidenschaft die Energiewende mitgestalten möchten.
ein ausgeprägtes „Service-Mindset“ und nachweisliche soziale Kompetenz.
Spass daran ergebnisorientiert zu arbeiten, Pragmatismus und Eigeninitiative.
ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Verhandlungs- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.
Warum wir?
Du gestaltest die Zukunft unseres Unternehmens gemeinsam mit einem außergewöhnlichen Team
Du profitierst von einem hohen Potenzial für persönliches und berufliches Wachstum
HH2E ist ein Arbeitgeber für Chancengleichheit.
Du arbeitest in einer Kultur der Kollaboration und Eigenverantwortung.
Wir schätzen Deine Beteiligung am Erfolg von HH2E und ergänzen Dein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt um Mitarbeiteroptionen.
Hier arbeitest du, wie es zu dir passt - hybrid oder remote. Das Team freut sich, dich auch mal in unserer Home Base im ehemaligen Flughafen Tegel zu treffen. 
An mehreren Tagen pro Woche genießt Du mit uns ein Menu im coolsten Speisesaal Berlins, von unserem Koch frisch regional zubereitet.


Wenn all das spannend für Dich klingt, dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

job_title: Testing Science Manager for Responsible AI (all genders)
job_desc:
Take a leading role in the ethical and responsible development of artificial intelligence, upholding trust, compliance, and societal values.

Your mission

As a Testing Science Manager for Responsible AI, you will be instrumental in designing, building, and deploying AI solutions that prioritize responsibility and ethics. Partnering with industry leaders, you will serve as a bridge between technical teams and stakeholders. You will ensure that AI systems align with ethical principles, legal requirements, and organizational values. Your efforts will enable our clients to better serve their customers and bring our vision for responsible AI to fruition.

At Accenture, you create an environment for you to flourish in — employing methods that align seamlessly with what you want to achieve in your career. You remain flexible as part of a team full of unique people who make a difference together.

Your daily work


Transform input into responsible AI projects. You will work closely with clients to understand their unique challenges and objectives. By translating these needs into actionable project plans, you will deliver innovative solutions grounded in the principles of ethical AI.

Develop state-of-the-art AI models. Leveraging your expertise in testing science, you will guide your team in building cutting-edge AI models that are not only effective but also fair, transparent, and aligned with societal values.

Craft business deals. You will participate in client sales talks and proposal preparation, highlighting the value and feasibility of responsible AI solutions.


Who You Are


With a minimum of five years in client-facing data science roles, you can demonstrate proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, Spark, and SQL, as well as in analytical techniques such as regression modeling, clustering methods, deep learning, and natural language processing.

Boasting over three years of experience in both responsible AI — specifically in model fairness, transparency, explainability, robustness, soundness, and privacy — and machine learning modeling techniques, you excel in fine-tuning and assessing the performance of models using specialized libraries.

With a strong background in database and big data technologies for at least five years, you can handle both structured and unstructured data.

Familiarity with cloud technologies such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is part of your skillset, backed by at least one year of practical work.

You speak English and German with remarkable fluency.


What We Offer


Tailored working time model with flexible working hours

Work where you’re needed — at one of Accenture’s locations, remotely, or at a client site

Attractive career opportunities

A diverse and inclusive work culture

Rewarding corporate packages, such as insurance and pension plans


Life at Accenture

In this role, you’ll be part of Accenture Technology. We use the full spectrum of digital technologies to simplify our clients’ everyday lives, leading their business into the future. From #DevOps to #infrastructure, from #security to #workplace services.

The Accenture culture: Here, YOU are the catalyst for change

Your unique combination of skills, personality, and aspirations sets you apart. When distinct talents, strengths, and perspectives merge, the result is nothing short of extraordinary: ideas that propel the world forward. This is we champion diversity and personal development at Accenture. Create a working environment where you truly thrive; with responsibilities that resonate deeply; with a workload that is perfectly aligned with your capabilities; and methods that are tailored to your objectives. How you wish to connect, further your development, and personally evolve rests in your hands. This is your career. We are mere facilitators, helping you shape it exactly as you envision.

Contact us

Any questions? Contact us at recruiting_germany@accenture.com.

We look forward to meeting you!

job_title: Senior Applied Scientist - Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


We are ambitious and committed to be the starting point of fashion for our customers and partners; therefore we are looking for applied scientists with a strong passion for understanding user behaviour and producing great experiences. Come join our team! 

As a Senior Applied Scientist belonging to the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) team, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing our understanding of our customer and crafting highly targeted communication strategies. You will work with talented scientists and engineers to build intelligent experiences across multiple communication channels with our customers. You will be responsible for building data pipelines, developing new personalization and segmentation models as well as running online experiments.

This position is a unique opportunity to have visible impact, and connect with exceptional talents from many different backgrounds you will be part of a talented cross-functional team made up of Applied Scientists, Data Engineers and Software Engineers.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)


 Analyse client behaviour and develop targeted communication strategies using advanced customer representation and user embedding techniques 
 Develop engaging user experiences by incorporating AI-driven content personalization and multimodal content generation into existing and new products 
 Cooperate closely with data and software engineers to build efficient data pipelines and solve real-world problems related to data cleaning and preprocessing. 
 Collaborate closely with experienced colleagues within the team, applied science leaders, product managers and business stakeholders. Mentor junior and mid level applied scientists and contribute to our applied science community. 



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



 A Ph.D./M.Sc., or equivalent experience in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field. 
 Proven experience in developing, deploying, and managing machine learning models, especially in the realms of personalization, customer behaviour prediction, and multimodal content generation. 
 A deep theoretical understanding of machine learning methodologies, coupled with a track record of practical application, evidenced by publications or significant achievements in either academia or industry. 
 Proficient in Python, PyTorch, and PySpark, or similar frameworks and environments conducive to large-scale data analysis and model training. 
 Exceptional ability to lead data science initiatives, with a knack for articulating complex technical details to a diverse audience, ranging from technical experts to non-technical stakeholders. 



ZALANDO BENEFITS



Career Development



 We offer peer-to-peer performance reviews twice a year 
 Learn and develop through our extensive Zalando training platform 
 Join regular all-hands, team meetings, Q&A-sessions, and quarterly anonymous employee surveys to ask your questions and provide your feedback 
 Support from an international team of experts; mentoring and professional development opportunities

 Minimum of 27 holiday days per calendar year

 Mental wellbeing support by our Employee Assistance Program and professional consultants to help you find health resources

 Flexible working hours

 Access to the employee shares program

 Employee parents’ forums and employee resource group

 3 fully-paid child sick days per year 
 Free counselling, assistance, and referral service for all matters concerning yourself and your family via the Fürstenberg Institute

job_desc:
We are ambitious and committed to be the starting point of fashion for our customers and partners; therefore we are re-founding and scaling our Applied Science backbone for Ads Personalization working backwards from user, content and context understanding.

Open-research problems are involved, at the intersection of Deep Learning, Auction Theory, Econometrics, Causal inference, and high-load low-latency Machine Learning Engineering, giving opportunities for scientific contributions.

We are looking for a leader with experience in guiding research work, and in delivering impact from science-based systems. You will support the team working in a structured and transparent way and achieve results that we can all proudly celebrate. job_title: Applied Science Manager - Personalization & Recommendations (all genders)
job_desc:
The Discovery team assists customers in their fashion discovery journey and helps them find what they are looking for. We are developing the next generation of our discovery systems, utilizing state-of-the-art natural language processing (NLP) and/or information retrieval (IR) methods, particularly transformer-based deep neural networks and large language models (LLMs).

As an Applied Science Manager, you will lead a team of exceptional scientists and engineers that develop algorithms and engineer cutting-edge machine learning and deep learning products that enhance the experience of over 51 million customers. You will be responsible for ensuring successful design, development, testing, experimentation, and the operations of algorithms, datasets, and systems your team owns, delivering department-wide and cross-department projects in collaboration with several teams. You will work with other science and engineering leaders, product managers and other stakeholders to make sure that we are investing in the right opportunities. You are a strong people leader who will effectively coach a cross functional applied science science team and will help to develop, coach and grow our talented group of scientists.

What We'd Love You To Do (and Love Doing)


 Bring in your strong scientific and leading experience in managing teams to researching, deploying and architecting machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) based solutions in areas such as ranking and recommendations to help our millions of customers in their inspiration journey. 
 Manage a healthy, high performing delivery team of scientists, providing direction and context on topics such as customer impact and business requirements, and overseeing all aspects of the delivery lifecycle design, experimentation, implementation, and testing. Coach the team to formulate long term research plans that create customer impact in challenging fashion problems, such as outfit generation, with state-of-the-art solutions. 
 Empower the team to stay up-to-date with the latest research and how to apply it into our area. Contribute to our scientific efforts with rigorous peer reviews and through publications in international conferences. 
 Scale up, manage and mentor other junior and senior scientists, reviewing and guiding their work and provide them with constructive and actionable feedback. Help us through hiring to keep on bringing talented scientists to the team. 
 Work closely with other applied science leaders, product managers and other business stakeholders to bring our state-of-the-art solutions to the customers and to discover and identify new opportunities. 



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



 PhD or MSc (or comparative experience) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Physics, accompanied by 6+ years of industry experience, especially deep learning and IR methods, of those 2+ years in people management and leading technical work. 
 In addition to the scientific depth and research track, you must possess exceptional research management and communication skills, and above all, be a strong people leader who understands how to effectively manage and coach an applied science team. 
 Experience leading teams to solve large-scale real-world problems using machine learning throughout the entire product cycle, creating customer impact. Strong drive and entrepreneurial spirit to partnering with product, science/engineering managers and principals to connect and solve business problems with scientific solutions. 
 Experience in developing long-term research roadmaps and applying scientific methods to tackle research problems. Outstanding technical skills and deep understanding of the theory behind the state-of-the-art methods in your domain as well as a broad overview of machine learning and deep learning methods and best practices in their application. 
 In addition to technical depth, exceptional project management and communication skills, and experience in successfully leading and coaching scientists.

Security Incidents have a high potential to cause a severe business impact on the organization. They often involve ambiguity, complexity, and the need for off-playbook approaches and solutions to manage unprecedented problems. Flexibility, fast movement, and the ability to reduce complex situations to individual components to allow action-taking are key during such situations.

The Senior CSIRT Analyst coordinates task forces to respond to major Information Security Incidents. They act as a primary point of contact for all parties involved and contain, eradicate, and recover Information Security Incidents.

Most of their time, they will work during core business hours but also regularly on-call outside of business hours and on weekends.

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


 Drive Incident response activities together with a task force through the entire Security Incident Lifecycle; 
 Coordinate the investigation activities of involved Cybersecurity Analysts; 
 Partner with engineering teams and other on-call staff to drive the investigation and response and facilitate swift decision-making; 
 Interact with platform partners on 3rd party Incidents to evaluate the potential impact on Zalando; 
 Steer stakeholder communication on the highest level, keeping stakeholders in a close loop and serving as the primary point of contact throughout the entire Incident Response Lifecycle; You interact directly with senior executives, equipping them with critical information required for swift decision-making; 
 When not managing Incidents, you continuously improve our monitoring coverage, respond to security alerts, and design and execute tabletop exercises to ensure all CSIRT members and Stakeholders understand their roles and can execute their responsibilities during an Incident. 


WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF


 You have 5+ years of working experience as a Cybersecurity Analyst, raising business-critical decisions during major Incidents; 
 You have excellent communication skills, verbal and written, and a proven track record for dealing with the most senior stakeholders; 
 You have the ability to size up a situation, assess the effectiveness of various tactics, and make rapid decisions on appropriate courses of action on major Incidents; 
 You have experience in security monitoring, detection, and analysis methodologies and technologies, including network-based intrusion detection systems, extended detection and response solutions (XDR), web application and network firewalls, and SIEM solutions; 
 You can convince with working knowledge of protecting assets on AWS and working with Kubernetes on AWS. Preferably, you gained experience with AWS native security tools. Also, monitoring a Google Workspace environment is ideally part of your previous experience. 
 You have gained an in-depth understanding of the MITRE ATT&CK Framework, the Cyber Kill Chain, and NIST.

job_title: Lead Machine Learning Scientist (f/m/d) - Generative AI and Knowledge Graphs (T4PF)
job_desc:
We help the world run better

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

What you`ll do

At SAP, we integrate AI technology with extensive industry-specific data and deep process knowledge to create innovative AI capabilities for all SAP applications. Large Language Models (LLMs) hold immense potential to change the way we work and develop products. They are reshaping the landscape of Machine Learning across various domains. However, their limited ability to leverage tabular data leaves a considerable share of enterprise data untapped. It is SAP's mission to overcome this challenge within the realm of Business AI. Our goal is to adapt Foundation Models to SAP data, enabling our clients to solve their business processes more effectively.

The Role

 Unique opportunity to lead the development of Foundation Models on structured business data embedded in a rich and diverse business context
 Technical lead for the project team of AI Scientists and Data Engineers, providing strategic guidance and overseeing project execution
 Design a representation suitable for Self-Supervised Learning on data across the entire SAP application and process portfolio
 Define processes, methods, hypothesis, experiments and review results from the ground up with an understanding to put them together for End-to-End Foundational Models.
 Leverage semantic business and process knowledge in the form of a Knowledge Graph
 Collaborate cross-functionally with other teams to understand needs and requirements, ensuring the Foundation Models align with strategic company objectives of embedding AI into our product portfolio
 Maintain up-to-date knowledge of AI and Data Engineering trends and apply this expertise to improve team performance and product quality
 Establish and drive research collaborations with academic and commercial partners
 Contribute to thought leadership in a revolutionary new data modality for Foundation Models and Generative AI

What You Bring

 PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or other relevant disciplines
 Extensive experience with Foundation Models as well as Machine Learning with Knowledge Graphs (e.g., GNNs)
 Deep understanding of issues and opportunities of applying Generative AI in a business context
 Proficiency in Python, and experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or similar
 Ideally, professional experience with Machine Learning on structured data such as in the ERP or CRM domain
 Exceptional teamwork abilities, strong leadership and strategic thinking skills
 Substantial publication record related to LLMs, Foundation Models, or Knowledge Graphs

Meet your team 

SAP's AI organization is dedicated to seamlessly infusing AI into all enterprise applications, enabling customers, partners, and developers to enhance business processes and generate remarkable business value. Join our international AI team where innovation thrives, opportunities for personal development abound, and exceptional colleagues collaborate globally.

#SAPBusinessAICareers

 We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

We win with inclusion

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

Requisition ID: 387325 | Work Area: Software-Design und Entwicklung | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Berufserfahren | Employment Type: Vollzeit, unbefristet | Additional Locations: Berlin |

At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers — intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.

Overview:

We are looking to hire a Data Engineer who wants to make long-term impact on the technical ecosystems of our business by driving transformation to our systems and architecture using insightful data. With a statistically minded approach, you will transform our data to tackle business challenges and enable new technical capabilities. Passionate about data? Want to make a real impact? Let's talk!

About the Role:

 Create highly scalable and fault tolerant technical designs working with team members (up to 5 people).
 Develop and implement data pipelines that extracts, transforms and loads data into an information product that helps to inform the organization in reaching strategic goals.
 Write high-quality code, conduct and participate in code reviews, and follow strong engineering principles and standards.
 Research the technical feasibility of new ideas and actively suggest technology improvements.
 Quickly develop a thorough understanding of the product, architecting the system and shipping production ready code.
 Write maintainable code that can scale fast.
 Support and contribute to our amazing work culture.

About You:

 Deep experience & understanding of object-oriented design, design patterns, micro services architecture, data structure, algorithms and their complexities, and systems architecture
 Skilled in writing and automating tests for your code
 Proven working experience with cloud platforms.
 Demonstrated experience with OLTP databases, specifically MySQL (understanding of day to day challenges related to query execution and optimization, e.g. indexing and cascading)
 Working experience with big data aggregation frameworks (Spark)
 Experience with streaming platforms like kafka and rabbitMQ
 Experience working in an agile environment
 Experience with C++ or any front-end framework is a plus
 Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English

BIG DATA SKILLS:

 3+ years of experience with writing code in Scala
 Experience with Python, Spark, Airflow
 Experience with Scala testing frameworks
 Understanding of data-warehousing and data-modeling techniques
 Proven experience with writing code for spark data processing
 Familiarity with various OLAP data stores (Druid, Clickhouse etc) and their insights
 Experience with at least one columnar OLAP databases
 Familiarity with industry-standard analytics and visualization tools

About Digital Turbine:

Digital Turbine (NASDAQ: APPS) powers superior mobile consumer experiences and results for the world’s leading telcos, advertisers and publishers. Our end-to-end platform uniquely simplifies the ability to supercharge awareness, acquisition and monetization — connecting our partners to more consumers, in more ways, across more devices.

The company is headquartered in Austin, Texas, with global offices in New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, London, Berlin, Singapore, Tel Aviv, and other cities serving top agency, app developer, and advertising markets. Listed on Deloitte Technology Fast 500 for six consecutive years since 2015 and winner of Austin Chamber of Commerce’s Company Culture in 2020.

Digital Turbine is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We embed diversity in our mindset, products, and teams to empower an inclusive, equitable, and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators and partners, driving better outcomes.

To view our Global Recruitment Privacy Notice, please click here .

We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us improve Bolt’s Campaigns

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building models for predicting the probability of the user booking under specific circumstances. You will work on customer segmentation: discover rider, driver, and eater segments for efficient campaign targeting. As a Data Scientist, you will be developing a system for automating promo campaigns setup and scaling it for millions of Bolt customers. You will be engaged in designing optimal experimental setup for comparing different campaigns targeting methodologies and user behavior dynamics. You will work on prioritizing user acquisition channels using analytical and machine learning approaches.

Your daily adventures will include:

Machine learning and statistical model development and its deployment into a production environment)
Studying historical user behavior data to identify opportunities for optimization)
Building models for optimal users’ discount allocation )
Developing a system for automating regular promo campaign setups)
Setting up A/B tests, collecting, interpreting its results, and communicating to stakeholders)
Working with a technical stack consisting of Python, Docker, Presto, SageMaker, Airflow)
Collaborating with data analysts, data scientists, product managers, and software engineers in feature teams )


About you:

Industry experience in data science and machine learning (3+ years recommended)
Natural curiosity to identify problems, explore trends, and discover opportunities with little supervision
Capability to approach problems with first-principle thinking
Team player with strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Experience in time series analysis, modeling multivariate time series, familiarity with forecasting techniques
Experience in Python programming, including libraries like Pandas, Numpy, sklearn, OR-tools
Understanding and practical experience with statistical hypothesis testing
You will get extra credits for Ph.D. in a quantitative field (physics, mathematics, computer science, economics)
You will get extra credits for product development experience in a technology company
You will get extra credits for experience with multivariate time series forecasting methods


Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world. 
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.

Adjust, an AppLovin (NASDAQ: APP) company, is trusted by marketers around the world to measure and grow their apps across platforms, from mobile to CTV and beyond. Adjust works with companies at every stage of the app marketing journey, from fast-growing digital brands to brick-and-mortar companies launching their first apps. Adjust’s powerful measurement and analytics suite provides visibility, insights and essential tools that drive better results.

Our global team is composed of team members with life experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives that mirror our customers around the world. We seek outstanding candidates who demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous learning and skill-building. We aim to support each other to ensure equitable and inclusive experiences, furthering our goal to create a culture of belonging that values the contributions of all team members.

We're proud to have received several awards in Summer 2022, including G2's Easiest Setup, Easiest Admin, Leader, and Easiest To Do Business With. Our CPO was also honored with a Top Women in Media Award, and we were named the Best Overall Mobile Marketing Solution of 2022. These accolades are a testament to the excellence and innovation of our award-winning company.

Get to know Product / The Department

Our Product Department is a dynamic team of agile, inquisitive, and strategic minds who believe strongly in finding problem driven solutions. We're the vital bridge between business and engineering, serving as the voice both internally and beyond for our Adjust product. We don't just think outside the box; we redefine it. Our mission is to relentlessly pursue features that perfectly align Adjust's vision with our clients' objectives.

Make An Impact/ The Role

As a Machine Learning Lead, you will be leading our data science efforts and are responsible for developing statistical models and algorithms that leverage Adjust’s unique position to deliver value to our clients. With your help, data science becomes a pillar of our value proposition which allows clients to automate, measure and optimize their growth activities.

Empower Your Potential/ Responsibilities

Lead and influence the development of innovative data products from conception to operationalization
Create best-in-class statistical models and algorithms including but not limited to incrementality and marketing mix modeling
Develop processes to monitor implementation outcomes and analyze model performance
Keep yourself up to date and become the main reference point for new research and state-of-the-art models
Guide the team and foster algorithms’ scalability to provide business value 

Bring Your Knowledge/ Experience & Qualifications

5 + years of experience in data science building and deploying machine learning models (XGboost, Light GBM. Random Forest, Time Series forecasting etc. )
Experience with advanced analytics for Marketing including but not limited to marketing budget optimisation, MMM, attribution, bidding automation, A/B testing, lift test or geo test)
Expertise in delivering and maintaining production-level data science projects (from prototyping, to maintaining and improving production-ready solutions)
Familiar with SDLC processes (JIRA, Github, test automation, deployment automation etc)
Able to understand a business problem and translate, structure it into a data science problem
Fluency in Python and familiarity with its scientific stack such as numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib
Experience in building architecture proposals in distributed or complex architectural structure (PostgreSQL, Clickhouse, TimescaleDB etc)
Be the representative of your function towards the rest of the organization, so strong communication and presentation skills are needed
Experience mentoring other team members 

Enhance Your Experience / Perks & Benefits

Opportunity to make an impact on the ad-tech industry working for a forward-thinking leader in the space
International, diverse teams with a strong focus on transparency, feedback and fun
Education opportunities for ongoing professional development & continuous learning
Company onboarding program where you’ll learn the ins-and-outs of our product with your fellow newbies
Flexible workplace policy, allowing you to work either from home or our office space 
Generous vacation policy with flexible vacation days
Childcare program (Berlin only), paid parental leave
Additional private health insurance
Company Pension Plan with 40% employer contribution
English & German classes to enhance your collaboration with global colleagues and friends
Discounted Gym Membership with Urban Sports Club
Free annual BVG transportation ticket
Wellbeing support with qualified therapists
WFH program with remote online events (Coffee chats, team events, games, etc.)
Relocation package and visa assistance for you and your family

More details about our company culture and perks can be found on our career page.

Interested? Let's Talk! 

We understand that imposter syndrome may sometimes hinder exceptional candidates from applying. So, don't hold back—apply with confidence! We're excited to hear from you and can't wait to chat!

Equal opportunity employer

Adjust is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We champion a diverse and inclusive culture in all of our offices around the globe. We understand that all candidates are individuals with unique backgrounds and talents. At Adjust, we assess candidates on qualifications, merit and business needs. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you see a position that excites you, please apply! We would love to have you join us in our mission to build a global tech company where we're all proud to belong to.

⚠ Adjust works with applicants through our Careers page and adjust.com email addresses. If you are contacted through other unofficial channels, it may not be legitimate. Confirm the information here and feel free to apply directly below.

Das erwartet dich bei uns – Erfahrungen, von denen du ein Leben lang profitierst
Als Teil unseres Technology Transformation Teams bringst du dein betriebswirtschaftliches und technologisches Wissen ein, um für unsere branchenübergreifenden Mandant:innen einen unternehmensweiten Mehrwert zu generieren. Willst du unsere Mandant:innen unter anderem bei der Konzeption und dem Aufbau modernster Datenplattformen, sowie bei der Umsetzung von innovativen Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning und AI-Anwendungen und bei der Operationalisierung dieser Anwendungen unterstützen? Dann bewirb dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams. Dabei übernimmst du vielfältige Aufgaben:

Beratung unserer Mandat:innen bei der Entwicklung von Lösungen für herausfordernde Problemstellungen mit Hilfe von Advanced Analytics und AI - von der Konzeption über die Strategie bis zur Umsetzung
Identifizierung und Auswahl geeigneter Datenquellen für den Aufbau der erforderlichen Datenflüsse sowie der notwendigen IT- und Datenarchitekturen
Durchführung von Datenanalysen sowie die Aufbereitung von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten
Aktive Einbindung in die Durchführung und die Planung sämtlicher Phasen innerhalb großer IT-Transformationsprojekte mit Schwerpunkt auf Artificial Intelligence
Eigenverantwortliche Übernahme von Teilaufgaben in der Weiterentwicklung unseres Service Portfolios als Teil unserer Architecture & AI Community

Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung und erste relevante Berufserfahrung in der Management- oder Technologieberatung im Kontext von Artificial Intelligence
Passion für das Thema AI, inklusive breitem Wissensspektrum, welches lösungsorientiert eingesetzt werden kann
Analyse, Ableitung und Abstraktion von hochkomplexen, technologischen Problemstellungen und geeigneten Lösungsstrategien (Optional: Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen, Datenvisualisierungstools und/oder Erfahrung mit Data-Science-Tools, z.B.: Python, Tableau, PowerBI, Azure, AWS etc)
Ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, eine pragmatische Mentalität, Kreativität und Teamspirit
Sichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.

Product Data Science Group is seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist to join our dynamic team in Berlin at Snowflake. In this role, you will work closely with our Product and Engineering teams to inform Product’s decision making and focus on increasing engineering efficiency efforts.

You will also work on long-running analytical initiatives marked by greater complexity and high levels of autonomy that will yield substantial product enhancements. This is a strategic, high-impact role that will help shape the future of Snowflake products and services.

AS A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL:

Drive high impactful initiatives for the global data application architecture and provide foundation for all critical telemetry and events to track feature adoption and performance of various Snowflake features.
Innovate and build data platforms to store, analyze sleuth through large amounts of data to uncover feature-usage patterns, subtle issues with the system, potential performance enhancements, and areas to improve user experience.
Influence and collaborate closely with Engineers and Product Managers and executives to inform product decision making with data and to identify opportunities to create more value for our customers.
Build framework and foundational high quality data pipelines , inform engineering for relevant instrumentation of telemetry events and architect the right data model for the product. 
Build Streamlit apps and dashboards & analytical framework to help Engineering and Product Managers monitor performance and availability of our system.
Think creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often unstructured problems.


OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:

MS/Ph.D. in quantitative discipline (CS, Engineering, Math, Statistics or Data Science)
Expert-level experience working with SQL and relational data (10+ years on a regular basis).
Expert-level experience working with Python, including scikit-learn, numpy, and pandas.
Expert in working with large-scale machine generated data (e.g., log, application, or customer-usage data).
Optimize complex and long running pipelines
Data storytelling, analysis & learnings to business leaders and technical stakeholders. 
The ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. That means being flexible and willing to jump in and do whatever it takes to be successful.
Previous experience on Snowflake and Streamlit is a plus

Explore a new world of possibilities:

At HomeToGo, we’re on a mission to make incredible accommodation easily accessible for everyone. Our team is united by a passion for travel, driven by innovation and impact, and guided by open-minded leaders at every level. Our commitment to recognizing and empowering exceptional talent is the foundation of our growth. We are actively hiring candidates from all around the world, including sponsoring visas for Germany. An amazing journey of opportunity with an international team lies ahead - join us!

Your future contribution:

Which destinations or categories of rental homes should we recommend to customers when they browse our website or receive our newsletter? How can we provide the most relevant list of results in our vacation rental search? How can we account for market trends, inventory quality and customer behavior to dynamically improve our products?

HomeToGo’s Data Science team is responsible for supercharging our products, particularly in areas such as search, recommendations, and marketing. Leveraging our extensive demand, product, and supply data, we aim to deliver engagement and revenue-driving intelligence using sophisticated ML models. We are seeking to bolster our Data Science team to elevate these efforts to the next level and expand into new use cases.

As Lead Data Scientist, you will collaborate with our talented team of Data Scientists and partner with colleagues in various departments, including Search, Marketing, Analytics, and Engineering, to enhance and expand our AI-powered marketplace. This presents an exciting opportunity to join a team that significantly impacts HomeToGo's overall performance. You will tackle challenging problems and drive measurable business impact through our online A/B testing platform.

How you’ll add value:


Design quantitative models (leveraging ML and advanced analytics) to drive customer engagement, booking conversions and other key metrics
Ensure proper selection of model offline quality metrics and maintain an adequate level of model explainability
Facilitate the implementation of models into production by collaborating with your engineering partners
Ensure efficient and cohesive workflows in our Data Science efforts to maximize business impact, while acting as a valuable sparring partner and facilitator for a small team of Senior Data Scientists
Serve as a consultative and creative partner for business and product stakeholders – understanding their needs and translating them into modeling problems
Shape our long-term Data Science strategy as you help foster a close-knit Data community at HomeToGo


You’ll be successful in this role if you:


Have a proven track record as a Data Scientist in e-commerce or other modern digital services
Have extensive hands-on experience in product analytics, advanced modeling and ML, with a high comfort level using Python and SQL
Hold an MSc or PhD, with a strong academic record, ideally in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, or another quantitative field
Have experience driving Data Science projects and leading or mentoring Data Scientists, ideally with higher levels of seniority
Have experience in areas of Ranking, Recommender Systems or similar
Are familiar with modern large-scale data warehousing solutions (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery) and/or data processing engines (e.g. Spark, Presto) – ideally in the context of distributed cloud computing (e.g. AWS, GCP)
Have the ability to thrive in a cross-functional setting: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize takeaways for non-technical partners, and a desire to influence business decisions
Bring intellectual curiosity, a desire for continuous learning, and a collaborative team-player attitude


Note: We operate a rolling recruitment approach - no deadlines, just opportunities. Should the volume of applications become too high, we might briefly remove this posting to provide our hiring team the space for thorough and unbiased review. The role will be made available again if we decide we’re still looking for the right fit.

Why HomeToGo?

Your journey with HomeToGo is a two way street - we’ve got you covered! We offer a diverse variety of benefits to enable your career development and make HomeToGo a great place to work, including:


The essentials: Competitive compensation package, visa sponsorship & relocation assistance*, full IT support & equipment, corporate benefits, modern offices, 27 paid vacation days a year (+ one additional day per year of employment until 32)
Career growth: 360° feedback, open feedback culture, buddy and mentorship programs from an international team of passionate industry experts 
Personal development: German & Lithuanian language courses, internal and external workshops & trainings, company & team events, Gympass, clubs & sports (e.g. volleyball, running, yoga classes), psychological support
Startup spirit: Driven by our Leadership Principles: We are fast, nimble, and results-driven - embodying a startup mentality even as a global, public company. We encourage ownership and enable each other to succeed
Flexible work approach: Office-led and remote friendly approach; employees are offered remote work flexibility for up to 50% of the year, including work from abroad benefits. Plus, access to a Travel Industry Card 
Climate action: Committed to being a pioneer in green travel: We’ve achieved an industry-leading “Low Risk” ESG Rating (16), awarded by Morningstar Sustainalytics, and are a proud member of Leaders for Climate Action
And so much more…
Certain conditions apply


About us:

HomeToGo is the marketplace with the world's largest selection of vacation rentals, listing millions of offers from thousands of trusted partners, including Booking.com, Vrbo and TripAdvisor. From vacation homes, cabins, beach houses, apartments, condos, house boats, castles, farm stays and everything in between, HomeToGo combines price, destination, dates and amenities to find the perfect accommodation for any trip worldwide.

Founded in 2014, HomeToGo operates localized apps & websites in 25 countries across Europe, North America, South America, Australia and Asia-Pacific. HomeToGo also operates brands such as Agriturismo.it, AMIVAC, Casamundo, CaseVacanza.it, e-domizil, EscapadaRural, Tripping.com and Wimdu.

HomeToGo is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to hiring and nurturing exceptional talent, representing various backgrounds, perspectives and skills. We are authentically candid and open-minded, fostering a safe environment for diverse opinions. Our hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We do not discriminate against race, ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, religion, political, ideological or religious views, disability or age.

We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce of equality and diversity at HomeToGo and to provide opportunities to everyone. We therefore welcome your application even if you aren't completely confident that your experiences fit the job description criteria. We would really love to get to know you!

Your Role:
Using innovative data analysis concepts and technologies, you provide management with guidance on vision and strategy for a particular area for the consumer.
You are in charge of communicating with clients in a trustworthy manner and demonstrating the data analytics solution's commercial benefits.
Along with having conversations with the client, your duties will include drafting proposals, putting them in front of the client, and fostering confidence in their commercial acumen.
You convert the business needs into a solution architecture and are in charge of coming up with proposals that make use of ideas and tools like B. AI, ML, and data products, among others.

Your Profile:
You've completed a course in computer science or information technology, or a related field, with success.
Many years of experience working as a business analyst or solution architect in the automotive industries.
Extensive expertise and experience in OEM-specific fields like quality control, supply chain, shop floor, ADAS V&V, and after-sales.
Strong understanding of AI/ML, data engineering, data streaming, analytics, lakehouse, cloud, and data analysis platforms and solutions.
You speak German and English fluently for business purposes, are willing to travel for project-related reasons, and possess excellent soft skills in storytelling, communication, and presentation.

Im Rahmen einer Personalvermittlung suchen wir eine/n (Senior) Data Scientist (m/w/d), der/die sich mit Leidenschaft und Fachwissen in die Herausforderungen des hochregulierten Medizinprodukte-Umfelds einbringt.

Ihre Aufgaben im Überblick:

Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium oder Berufserfahrung im Bereich Medizin oder Life Sciences
Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning oder angewandte Statistik
Erfahrung im Training, der Evaluation und dem Deployment von NLP Pipelines und erklärbaren Machine Learning-Modellen
Erfahrung mit NLP und LLMs wie BERT, GPT oder ähnlichem zur Extraktion von Informationen aus strukturierten und unstrukturierten Texten
Kompetenz in Python sowie praktische Erfahrung mit PyTorch, TensorFlow oder scikit-learn
Grundlegendes Wissen von SQL- und noSQL-Datenbanken

job_title: Advisor Manager for Responsible AI (all genders)
job_desc:
Create the rules, guide the tech: support ethical development and application of artificial intelligence!

Your mission

As an Advisor Manager for Responsible AI, you will take the lead in creating and implementing policies, regulations, guidelines, and standards for AI. By closely collaborating with clients, you will adapt projects to meet their unique requirements. Your role ensures that the development and deployment of AI technologies by our clients are ethical, transparent, and accountable. In this capacity, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future of AI governance across various sectors.

At Accenture, you create an environment for you to flourish in — employing methods that align seamlessly with what you want to achieve in your career. You remain flexible as part of a team full of unique people who make a difference together.

Your daily work


Provide guidance in AI governance. Drawing on your expertise, you will offer invaluable insights and actionable recommendations to our clients. You will help them align their AI technologies with societal values through ethical frameworks.

Tailor solutions for responsible AI. You will contribute to the preparation and delivery of compelling proposals that effectively communicate the value and benefits of our services to both existing and prospective clients.

Stay up to date with the latest AI developments. Keeping abreast of AI regulations, you will advocate Accenture’s perspective among key clients and stakeholders. In collaboration with academic institutions, you will lead innovative research and provide training and resources to our clients through the Responsible AI Academy.


Who You Are


As a highly qualified individual, you bring at least seven years of experience in data and AI regulation, policy development, and the design and implementation of operating models, governance structures, and controls.

Your background includes work in government or legislative development, as well as collaboration with regulators, standards bodies, or participation in multilateral groups.

With at least five years of relevant work experience, you have adeptly used business analysis to address complex business challenges.

Your expertise in data ethics and responsible AI governance significantly elevates your profile.

You speak English and German with remarkable fluent.


What We Offer


Tailored working time model with flexible working hours

Work where you’re needed — at one of Accenture’s locations, remotely, or at a client site

Attractive career opportunities

A diverse and inclusive work culture

Rewarding corporate packages, such as insurance and pension plans


Life at Accenture

In this role, you’ll be part of Accenture Strategy & Consulting. We use the full spectrum of digital technologies to simplify our clients’ everyday lives, leading their business into the future. From #DevOps to #infrastructure, from #security to #workplace services.

The Accenture culture: Here, YOU are the catalyst for change

Your unique combination of skills, personality, and aspirations sets you apart. When distinct talents, strengths, and perspectives merge, the result is nothing short of extraordinary: ideas that propel the world forward. This is we champion diversity and personal development at Accenture. Create a working environment where you truly thrive; with responsibilities that resonate deeply; with a workload that is perfectly aligned with your capabilities; and methods that are tailored to your objectives. How you wish to connect, further your development, and personally evolve rests in your hands. This is your career. We are mere facilitators, helping you shape it exactly as you envision.

Contact us

Any questions? Contact us at recruiting_germany@accenture.com.

We look forward to meeting you!

If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.
A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a Product Data Scientist to join our Data Community in our HQ in Barcelona in Spain. 

THE JOURNEY

Leverage advanced statistical modelling and machine learning techniques to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the product roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Drive product discovery, formulate data-driven hypotheses and convert them into analysis and actionable insights.
Owning everything analytics end to end in the product development cycle, from ideation and opportunity sizing to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE RIDE

2-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, game theory, statistical inference, Bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisation
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modelling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights and drive decision-making
A higher education in a scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Economics.
Knowledge and experience in digital product development and working with diverse stakeholders
Good understanding of software development and agile methodologies
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python) and experience working with popular libraries such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Excellent spoken and written English

Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We believe driven talent deserves:

🌟 An enticing equity plan *if applicable
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo meal benefits so you can test new features in our beta app (and to satisfy your cravings!)
💳 Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses or office-based nursery.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ The freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year. .
👪 Enhanced parental leave (*if applicable)
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

At Glovo, we truly value diversity for the positive impact it brings to our teams, products, and culture. We're dedicated to providing equal opportunities for talent from all backgrounds.
Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Teraki is a multinational and multicultural Berlin-based tech company. We stand for innovation in the rapidly developing automotive domain of connected car, self-driving and world 3D mapping. Teraki enables improved Machine Learning performance through its edge processing products for Automotive (IoT) applications and enables the launch of new technologies by enabling on-sensor ML. We enable customers with Teraki's products to cope with the challenges that are posed by the exploding computational requirements of processing sensor data in autonomous robots and cars with different on-board sensors, cameras, RADAR systems, thus enabling wider-range access to autonomous systems.
 Your responsibilities:
Defining and collecting training datasets
Building training pipelines and real-time inference run-times (PyTorch, TensorFlow, TensorRT, Python, C++).
Experience in the field of real-time and embedded systems
Track and analyze the scientific literature and regulation on RADAR to identify relevant research questions and technical trends
Develop algorithms using and improving simulation environments, eg. with sensormodels
Conduct Machine Learning experiments, publish internal reports, and file patents.
Communication with internal and external stakeholders
 What we are looking for:
PhD or Master graduated in computer science, mathematics, physics or a related field. 
Hands-on experience with radar or camera data ideally in automotive industry, robotics or drone's domain
Strong programming skills in Python. C/C++ knowledge would be an advantage 
Demonstrated professional and research experience in machine learning, image/signal processing, numerical optimization or computer vision 
Familiar with one or few areas related to signal processing such as multi-channel signal processing, RF-signals, MIMO acquisition, multi-dimensional processing, hyper-spectral images, antenna array
Strong technical and nontechnical communication skills
Fluent in English 
 The position we offer gives you a chance to: 
Actively contribute to the new mobility revolution and the emergence of novel data-driven automotive platforms 
Increase your technical know-how in hot topics of autonomous driving 
Experience research and development in an industrial setting 
Work in a vibrant startup environment and share insights within an international team 
Work on your own self-contained R&D project 
 What we offer: 
The chance to immerse yourself in autonomous driving, with tasks from embedded design to machine learning 
To work closely with world class European, Asian and American companies 
To work in a dynamic start-up environment in the heart of Berlin, and to share insights with an international team spread across Europe and the US 
To work in a small, but highly motivated, multidisciplinary, multicultural team with flat hierarchies. 
Free public transport around within Berlin and free German classes

(SENIOR) DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT*

DAS SIND WIR 
 Als erfolgreiches Young Fashion Unternehmen ist NEW YORKER weltweit mit über 1.200 Filialen in 47 Ländern vertreten und kontinuierlich auf Wachstumskurs. Mit einem Team von rund 23.000 Mitarbeitern arbeiten wir am Puls der Zeit und legen Wert auf ein freundschaftliches Miteinander. Durch unsere Leidenschaft für Mode, unsere Spontanität und Schnelligkeit haben wir es geschafft, seit über 50 Jahren ein fester Bestandteil der Modewelt zu sein. Werde Teil unseres Teams!

Das Team Data Science verwendet modernste Machine Learning und Optimierungsverfahren, um die Geschäftsprozesse bei NEW YORKER stetig zu verbessern. Auf die Standorte Berlin und Braunschweig verteilt arbeiten wir in agilen Projektteams an einer Vielzahl von Anwendungsfällen, u.a. in der Orderoptimierung, den Reduzierungen, der Warensteuerung und der Logistik. Wir sind ein sehr ambitioniertes und internationales Team und sind stolz auf unsere hohen Standards. Das Team ist in der Abteilung BI & Data angesiedelt und wird durch Consultants aus diesem Bereich dabei unterstützt, die richtigen Anwendungsfälle zu identifizieren und deren Umsetzung und Nutzung zu etablieren.

Zur weiteren Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir Dich für unser Headquarter in Braunschweig oder am Standort Berlin als:

SENIOR DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT (M/W/D)

Schnittstellenfunktion zwischen dem Data Science Team und den Fachbereichen
Beratung der Fachbereiche und des Managements hinsichtlich Auswahl, Ausgestaltung und Optimierung von Anwendungsfällen
Entwicklung von neuen Anwendungsfällen, die zur Geschäftsoptimierung beitragen, Einordnung dieser in die Gesamt-Roadmap des Unternehmens
Begleiten und Optimieren des gesamten Prozesses von der Idee bis hin zu Etablierung und späteren Nutzenüberprüfung
Organisieren, Planen und Leiten von Projektmeetings
Enge Abstimmung mit den Teamleitungen im Projektalltag um die Ziele entlang der Roadmap zu erreichen
Eigenständiges Arbeiten an agilen Projekten mit verschiedenen Themenschwerpunkten

Abgeschlossenes Studium der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Mathematik oder ein vergleichbares Studium – alternativ auch entsprechende Berufserfahrung

Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowohl gegenüber dem Management als auch gegenüber den Entwicklern
Wille, sich tief in Unternehmensprozesse einzuarbeiten
Engagement und Überzeugungskraft gehören zu deinen Stärken
Ergebnisorientierte und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise, sowie Hands-On-Mentalität
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort & Schrift

Mitgestaltung der digitalen Transformation in einem innovativen Unternehmen
