job_title: Senior Consultant Business Analytics/Business Intelligence - Data & Analytics (w/m/d)
job_desc:
Das erwartet dich bei uns – Erfahrungen, von denen du ein Leben lang profitierst

In spannenden Projekten löst du in unserem Team Data & Analytics in München, Stuttgart, Köln, Düsseldorf, Hannover, Berlin, Hamburg oder Frankfurt/Main Fragestellungen rund um Advanced Analytics, Artificial Intelligence sowie Automatisierung und entwickelst Technologiestrategien für weltweit führende Konzerne. Dabei übernimmst du vielfältige Aufgaben:

Beratung nationaler und internationaler Unternehmen hinsichtlich Performance Management und Informationsgestaltung
Unterstützung bei der Optimierung der Unternehmensleistung
Begleitung der Kund:innen bei der Integration und Aufwertung von BI-, Analytics- und Big-Data-Lösungen
Nutzung mathematisch-statistischer Verfahren und Erstellung von Szenariomodellen
Verantwortung für Projektfortschritte und fachliche Führung von Teammitgliedern

Das bringst du mit – Fähigkeiten, mit denen du die Zukunft gestaltest

Mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Beratung mit Schwerpunkt Business Intelligence oder Analytics (Datenbanken, Datenmodellierung, Software-Programmierung, Statistik)
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Ingenieurwissenschaften, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik oder Statistik
Analytische Fähigkeiten und präzise Arbeitsweise
Teamplayer:in mit Engagement und hohem Verantwortungsbewusstsein
Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch

Das bieten wir dir – ein inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld

Bei EY setzen wir alles daran, dass die Welt besser funktioniert. Dafür hinterfragen wir täglich den Status quo und suchen schon heute die Antworten von morgen. Stillstand? Keine Option. Wandel? Sehen wir als Chance und Treiber für Innovation.

Wenn du auch so tickst, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig. Wir suchen Macher:innen, die Unternehmen, Entrepreneuren, Privatpersonen und der öffentlichen Hand helfen, über sich hinaus zu wachsen. Das erfordert Zusammenarbeit auf Augenhöhe und das Verlassen ausgetretener Pfade. Diese beschreitest du als Teil von interdisziplinären Teams – innovativ und multikulturell aufgestellt in Deutschland, Europa und der ganzen Welt.

Damit auch du persönlich und beruflich über dich hinauswächst, begleiten wir dich auf deinem Karriereweg mit auf dich zugeschnittenen Arbeitsmodellen sowie Trainings- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten on- und off-the-Job. Das Tempo und Ziel auf deinem Weg bestimmst du selbst.

Wir wissen: Erstklassiger Service für unsere Mandant:innen und Kund:innen beginnt bei zufriedenen und motivierten Mitarbeitenden. Deshalb reicht unser Angebot von flexiblen Arbeitsmodellen, Auslandeinsätzen und Weiterbildungen über Sport- und Freizeitangeboten bis hin zu Rabatten bekannter Marken und Anbieter sowie Altersvorsorge. Erfahre mehr über deine Benefits bei EY.

Du hast Lust was zu bewegen? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams. 

Bewirb dich jetzt über unser Jobportal: www.de.ey.com/karriere.

Mehr Informationen zum Bewerbungsprozess bei EY findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

Deine Fragen beantwortet gerne unser Recruitment Center unter: +49 6196 996 10005.

Was andere über uns sagen, findest du auf kununu und Glassdoor.

Job Description

We at sevDesk:

We at sevDesk don't have a universal formula for happiness in the world of work either, but we work together every day to understand exactly what can permanently increase our sevFamily's sense of happiness. One thing is for sure: with us, you can be exactly who you are and work in a way that suits you and your needs! It's not the work that defines us, it's us that define the work!

Our culture is not artificial, it is real. Be yourself at sevDesk - BE YOURSEV!

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our product portfolio. With your analyses, you identify growth potential and influence our product roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:

You analyze user behavior data and use it to support our product teams in identifying the most important customer problems.
You design success metrics, help set goals and design experiments to find the best solutions for our customers.
You prepare your findings visually so that it is easy for your stakeholders to incorporate them into their decisions.
You design optimizations in data collection and continuously develop the reporting ecosystem.
You support your colleagues in the use of product data and help to keep our quality standards high with peer reviews.

Your Qualification:

You have at least 5 years of experience in the digital environment. You have already worked as a Data Analyst (m/f/x) for at least 3 years and have mentored other analysts.
You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics or comparable.
You have at least 2 years of application experience in SQL and a good technical understanding.
You have experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI, Tableau) and analytics tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics).
You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, good knowledge of statistics is a plus.

__

Our Techstack:

SQL | Redshift | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevDesk Experience

Your Freedom: Embrace the freedom to work from wherever you choose.

Your Flexibility: Define your working hours to maximize productivity while being an essential team member.

Your Projects: Participate in Open Code Fridays and bring your own ideas to life.

Your Ideas: Actively contribute your innovative ideas to shape sevDesk's future.

Your Training: Engage in flat and brown bag sessions, celebrating knowledge sharing.

Your Career: We support and challenge you on your unique career journey.

Your Team: Collaborate seamlessly with our inclusive team, whether in-person or through online channels.

Your Equipment: Select your preferred hardware, and if needed, we provide you with a desk and chair.

Your Perks: Enjoy a monthly voucher, such as for shopping or refilling your tank.

Your Share: Join our employee share ownership program and become an entrepreneur yourself.

Your Dream Bike: Pursue your ideal bike through our bike leasing program.

Your Dress Code: Express yourself in a blazer or sweatpants; our focus is on inspiration, not attire.

Your Retirement Plan: We contribute to your company pension plan and add €30 to it.

Your Benefits: Access discounts at over 600 partner companies via our corporate benefits.

Your Commute: We cover travel costs for your visits to our Offenburg office if you work remotely.

Your Commitment: Dedicate 3 working days annually to contribute to social or environmental projects.

Your Relaxation: Enjoy 30 vacation days each year for your well-deserved rest.

Your English: Take advantage of our Speexx learning program to elevate your English skills to the next level.

Your Wanderlust: Whether it's the mountains or the sea - enjoy 30 days of workation wherever you go in Europe.

For more insights, visit us on Instagram

Contact:  Marc Riehle

Description

About The Role

Are you passionate about harnessing advanced Data & Analytics to build retailers and CPGs of the future? Are you an experienced leader in the Data & Analytics space, who enjoys solving complex consulting challenges and driving Data Analytics solutions? Are you hungry to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment? If so, then EPAM is looking for a Senior Data Analytics Consultant to join our rapidly expanding Data and Analytics Practice in Germany. This position is a part of the Global Consumer Data and Analytics Consulting team including experts from many different sectors. The positions require a strong Data & Analytics consulting background with the ability to assist clients in defining their overall technology strategy and delivery.

Responsibilities

Provide the leadership in shaping enterprise-wide, transformational, Data & Analytics solutions
Establish and cultivate strong relationships with Retail/CPG clients at senior levels, as well as external and internal partners, to maximize growth within an account/client portfolio
Act as industry expert on Retail/CPG topics both internally within EPAM and externally with clients
Be part of the team building EPAM’s overall Data & Analytics offering and go-to-market, making sure it covers Retail/CPG clients’ key strategic problematics
Work with the local and wider global technical and business data practice to advise clients regarding their overall Data & Analytics strategy and implementations
Understand the intersection between technology, customers, and business
Work closely with project/program management to ensure successful delivery through an integrated delivery model
Lead research and strategy creation and sponsor development of new Data & Analytics products or services to expand markets, monetize data and grow company revenue
Drive revenue within the client/account portfolio by identifying opportunities and influence/sell-in EPAM services


Requirements

Retail and/or CPG industry visionary and avid technologist at heart
Extensive experience in Data & Analytics
Extensive experience developing and growing client relationships
Experience in connecting the dots between business questions/challenges and analytics and then technological tools
Ability to operate at the strategic level, yet being close enough to the details to add value to clients and be a real support to your team
Experience of working with relevant delivery teams
Confident in expressing points of view, making recommendations and presenting analysis and recommendations where appropriate
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Native/fluent German speaking skills are essential


We Offer

EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
30 days holiday per annum
Company Pension Scheme
Competitive compensation depending on experience and skills
Regular performance assessments
Opportunities for personal and professional growth
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
Friendly and enjoyable working team
Relocation package support
Regular corporate and social events
Flexible and remote working opportunities
All benefits and perks are subject to specific eligibility requirements


About EPAM

EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential


Why join EPAM

Work across markets and verticals and gain exposure to a great variety of projects and cutting-edge technologies
Become part of a global community of well-connected experts across 50+ countries: enjoy a career without borders within an international environment
Carve your career path: as the Fastest-Growing IT Services Company in the Fortune 100 List, EPAM is committed to help you discover your fullest potential by creating career plans that best suit you and your future plans
EPAM Germany was named a Top Company 2022, 2023 & 2024 by Kununu for its people centric culture built on life-long learning
 Apply

We are currently partnered with a leading Digital Consulting Partner who are looking to hire an experienced Digital Analyst.

As a Digital Analyst within their consulting team you will have the opportunity to leverage your Google Analytics expertise to bridge the gap between their clients product teams and business, consulting with stakeholders on how to use data to gain meaningful insights and how to turn them insights into tangible business value.

Your day to day will involve consulting with stakeholders and working with customer product teams to improve their product through the creation of Analytics, Data Management and Customer Data Platform solutions.

Required Skills
Digital Analytics & Tag Management experience
An understanding of Digital Marketing
Understanding and knowledge of Tealium Tag Management, Google Cloud Big Query, SQL
Strong experience in Google Analytics UA/GA360/GA4, Power BI, Data Studio, Looking Domain Skills and Tableau

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You’ll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy.

Smart Pricer ist das führende Unternehmen für die Optimierung von Ticketpreisen in Europa

Wir bieten Pricing Services in den Bereichen Bergbahnen, Sport und Entertainment an. Wir sind stolz darauf, mit Partnern wie den Bergbahnen Sölden und Zermatt, dem FC Bayern München, DFB, Hertha BSC und vielen mehr zusammenzuarbeiten. Unsere Arbeit ist geprägt von unternehmerischem Denken, effektivem Transaktionsmanagement und innovativen individuellen Lösungen. Unseren Erfolg als einer der weltweit führenden Spezialisten auf unserem Gebiet verdanken wir nicht zuletzt einer ausgeprägt teamorientierten Arbeitsweise.

Gemeinsam wollen wir weiter wachsen und suchen daher zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in Berlin eine:n

Junior Data Analyst:in (m/w/d)

Aufgaben

Du bist Teil unseres jungen und dynamischen Teams. Unsere spannenden Projekte bieten Dir täglich neue

Herausforderungen und viel Raum für eigene Ideen und Initiativen.

Als Data Analyst:in bei Smart Pricer wartest und verbesserst du unsere zentralen Daten-Microservices und treibst die Produktivität und Datenverfügbarkeit im gesamten Unternehmen voran. Du begleitest unsere innovativen Pricing-Projekte vom Scoping bis zur Auslieferung. Weiterhin verstehst du die Auswirkungen der Preisgestaltung auf das Geschäft unserer Kund:innen, indem Du große Datensätze verarbeitest und statistische Analysen durchführst, um ihnen so zu besseren Entscheidungen zu verhelfen. Dafür erstellst Du Berichte und Dashboards zur Unterstützung der Stakeholder.

Intern stehst Du in engem Kontakt mit unserem Tech-, Consulting- und Produktteam, um in allen datenbezogenen Fragen beratend tätig zu sein. Extern nimmst Du zusammen mit dem Consulting-Team an ausgewählten Kundengesprächen teil.

Qualifikation

MUST HAVES

Abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im Bereich Statistik, Operations Research, Informatik, Physik, Mathematik oder einem ähnlichen quantitativen Bereich
Du bist ein:e Datenanalyst:in mit praktischer Erfahrung statistischer Untersuchungstechniken wie linearer/nicht-linearer Regression, Zeitreihenmodellierung, statistischen Tests, etc.
Solide Erfahrungen mit Python und den relevanten Data Analytics Bibliotheken (Pandas, Numpy, etc…)
Gutes Verständnis von SQL-Programmierung und dem Umgang mit Datenbanken
Du verfügst über eine analytische und unternehmerische Denkweise und hast eine Leidenschaft dafür, neue Abläufe aus technischer und kaufmännischer Sicht von Grund auf zu entwickeln

Smart Pricer ist das führende Unternehmen für die Optimierung von Ticketpreisen in Europa

Wir sind stolz darauf, mit führenden Skigebieten wie Sölden und Zermatt sowie Sport und Entertainment Playern wie dem FC Bayern München, der Deutschen Entertainment AG (DEAG) und mehr als 100 weiteren Kunden zusammenzuarbeiten.

Als nächsten Schritt wollen wir unsere Dynamic Pricing Modelle mit verbessertem Forecasting Engine und Machine Learning auf das nächste Level heben und dafür brauchen wir dich zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in Berlin als

Data Science Analyst:in (m/w/d)

Aufgaben

Als Data Science Analyst:in bei Smart Pricer bist du verantwortlich für unsere Daten-Microservices und treibst die Produktivität und Datenverfügbarkeit im gesamten Unternehmen voran. Du begleitest unsere Pricing-Projekte vom Scoping bis zur Auslieferung, hinterfragst und optimierst unsere Pricing Algorithmen. Du entwickelst ein tiefes Verständnis der Preisgestaltung auf das Geschäft unserer Kund:innen, indem du riesige Datensätze verarbeitest und tiefe Analysen durchführst. Einerseits erstellst du dafür Berichte und Dashboards, andererseits entwickelst du unsere Machine Learning Modelle für Nachfrageprognose und Pricing weiter, um sie auf das nächste Level zu heben.

Du bist Teil unseres Data Teams und stehst intern in engem Kontakt mit unserem DevOps-, Consulting- und Produktteam als der/die Expert:in für alle datenbezogenen Fragen. Extern nimmst du als Sidekick für das Consulting-Team an ausgewählten Kundengesprächen teil.

Qualifikation

MUST HAVES

Datenanalyst:in mit mindestens 3 – 5 Jahren Erfahrung in statistischen Untersuchungstechniken wie linearer/nicht-linearer Regression, Zeitreihenmodellierung, statistischen Tests, etc.
Vertraut mit der Erstellung moderner BI-Dashboards, idealerweise mit Qlik Sense
Fundierte Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in den Bereichen ETLs, Datenmodellierung und Datenvisualisierung. Du beherrschst Python und SQL und bist mit Github vertraut
Umfassende Erfahrungen mit Machine Learning, vorzugsweise im Bereich Forecasting und Time-Series Modelling
Fähigkeit Ergebnisse souverän, intern vor dem Team und extern gegenüber den Kunden, zu präsentieren


NICE TO HAVE

Erfahrung mit REST APIs
Erfahrung mit der Google Cloud Plattform
Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im Bereich Statistik, Operations Research, Informatik, Physik, Mathematik oder einem ähnlichen quantitativen Bereich

company_name: 7 of 10 skills match your profile - you may be a good fit
job_desc:
Du hast Lust, aus unserem umfangreichen Datenschatz spannende Insights zu generieren, die unseren Marktplatz im Ratenkredit voranbringen? Du willst Verantwortung übernehmen und dich in einem agilen Umfeld austoben? Dabei suchst du außerdem Weiterbildungsperspektiven und Flexibilität im Arbeitsalltag? Dann bist du bei EUROPACE in Berlin genau richtig!

Wer ist Europace?

Hidden Champion: Die Europace AG ist ein Tochterunternehmen der Hypoport Gruppe. Wir sind seit über zehn Jahren erfolgreich und haben den Finanzierungsmarkt revolutioniert. Mit unseren Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd. Euro im Monat und einem Wachstum, das deutlich über dem Markt liegt, schreiben wir gerne mit dir unsere Erfolgsstory fort. 
FinTech: Wir sind Deutschlands größter Finanzinerungsmarktplatz für Immobilienfinanzierungen, Bausparprodukte und Privatkredite. Wir gestalten und bewegen Märkte und befinden uns auf einer stetigen Mission für die Verbraucher:innen. 
B2B2C: Wir sind B2B und denken B2C. Wir bringen Banken und Vertriebe zusammen, um für Verbraucherinnen den einfachsten Zugang zu den besten Finanzierungen zu schaffen. 

Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit, dich in einem Team kreativ auszuleben. Durch das Einbringen deiner Erfahrungen, Ideen und deiner Leidenschaft für Daten hast du die Möglichkeit, Einfluss auf deinen Tätigkeitsbereich zu nehmen und deinen Arbeitsalltag abwechslungsreich zu gestalten.

Wir freuen uns auf dich - come as you are!

Wie sehen deine Aufgaben bei uns aus?

Du bringst dich ein: Du begleitest die Produktentwicklung im Ratenkredit bei Europace, identifizierst selbstständig relevante Fragestellungen und unterstützt eine datengetriebene Kultur im Unternehmen. 
Du bist vorausschauend: Du hast im Blick, welche Daten für zukünftige Analysen relevant sind und initiierst rechtzeitige Erweiterung unserer Datenbasis. 
Du unterstützt: Du hilfst den Produktteams beim Ableiten, Visualisieren und Hinterfragen relevanter Metriken, um den Erfolg des Produktes, die Erreichung von Geschäftszielen und den Effekt einzelner Initiativen kontinuierlich zu messen. 
Du befähigst: Du ermöglichst es deinen Team-Kollegeninnen, auch selbst mit Daten zu arbeiten. Neben den technischen Grundlagen vermittelst du hierzu das Bewusstsein für den Wert von Daten sowie ein Verständnis für unsere Datenbasis. 
Du wertest aus: Du erstellst praxisnahe Ad-Hoc-Analysen, Visualisierungen und Dashboards, die es uns selbst und Stakeholdern ermöglichen, fundierte Entscheidungen zu treffen. 
Du bringst uns weiter: Wir entwickeln nicht nur eine Plattform, sondern auch uns selbst. Du trägst dazu bei, dass wir als Team immer besser werden. 

Was erwarten wir von dir?

Fachlich: Du beherrschst deskriptive Statistik und hast deine Fertigkeiten bereits in der Vergangenheit in einer Beschäftigung als Data Analyst unter Beweis gestellt. Du kannst Metriken-Frameworks sowohl für ganze Produkte als auch für einzelne Features zusammenstellen, ins Leben rufen und revidieren. 
Technisch: Du kennst moderne Programmiersprachen im Bereich der Datenanalyse (wie z.B. Python oder R) sowie Datenvisualisierung-Tools (wir benutzen Qlik und Redash, sind aber für Bereicherung offen) und kannst dich mittels SQL selbst mit Daten versorgen. 
Methodisch: Du hast Erfahrung mit agiler Produktentwicklung und schätzt die Vorteile von selbstorganisierten cross-funktionalen Teams. Für relevante Projekte setzt Du Dich gerne ins Driver Seat. 
Kommunikation: Du bist ein "Data Socializer" und stets in der Lage, komplexe Analysen in und um Deine Domäne deinen Kolleg:innen aus cross-funktionalen Teams verständlich zu erklären. 
Arbeitsweise: Du bist strukturiert, flexibel und arbeitest eigenständig und verantwortungsbewusst. Wenn nötig, stellst du auch den Ist-Zustand in Frage und denkst ihn neu. Dank deinem Urteilsvermögen kannst du Anforderungen verstehen und hinterfragen sowie schnell zuverlässige Analyse-Lösungen bereitstellen. Dabei bist du neugierig, lernbereit und kreativ. 
Mindset: Du zeichnest dich durch Pragmatismus, einen guten Geschäftssinn und ein gesundes Maß an Detailgenauigkeit aus. Außerdem engagierst du dich, bringst dich ein und bist motiviert uns voranzubringen. Deine Neugierde und Auffassungsgabe helfen dir, die für dich neue Domäne Ratenkredit schnell zu verstehen und neue Themen rasch zu adaptieren, Ideen zu entwickeln und weiterzudenken. 

Was erwartet dich bei uns?

Ein Arbeitsplatz frei von Stereotypen! Die Energie unserer Teams wächst mit der Vielfalt an, mit den Perspektiven, die alle einbringen.

Vollzeit oder Teilzeit? Kinderbetreuung, psychische Belastung, Pflege von Angehörigen, Wiedereintritt ins Arbeitsleben nach längerer Pause - ganz egal aus welchen Gründen du nicht Vollzeit arbeiten kannst oder willst, bei uns ist Teilzeit genauso möglich.

Wir sind inklusiv! Ob spezielle Hilfsmittel, besondere Bedürfnisse oder sonstige Barrieren, wir sind motiviert eine Lösung zu finden, damit du bei uns so barrierefrei wie möglich arbeiten kannst. Gerne kannst du dich auch vor oder während des Bewerbungsprozesses an unser Diversity Team wenden: diversity@europace.de

What else? Auf @Europace, dem Europace-Blog und Inside Hypoport erfährst du noch mehr über uns. Wenn wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Bei Fragen wende dich gerne an Johanna:

Johanna Siepmann

Talent Relation Managerin @ Europace

johanna.siepmann@europace.de

Hypoport SE | EUROPACE AG www.hypoport.de | www.europace.de

CrazyLabs is a top 5 mobile games publisher with over 6 Billion downloads to date, a worldwide leader in hyper-casual games development, distribution, and innovation.

We’re looking for an experienced Game Data Analyst to work closely with the product teams to analyze performance metrics, create insights, and guide data-driven decisions.

If you have Passion for Gaming and work in a dynamic fast fast-paced environment, then this position is for you!

Here’s what we need, up for the challenge?

Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of players to address strategic and operational business questions
Optimization and maximization users monetization
Recommendations for segmented offers based on user segments and behavior
Data mining, pattern recognition & correlation analysis and insight generation
Definition, measurement and evaluation of AB test 
Provide actionable recommendations from game data to shape features, game economy, and future product roadmaps
Be involved in building automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide understanding of business KPIs and player experience
Identify and communicate key trends and potential development improvements
Collaborate with stakeholders to drive insights that will help produce monetization and retention improvements
Recommendations based statistical analysis of data

Requirements:

What we're looking for:

2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in a gaming company -A MUST
BA/B.Sc. in Statistics / Math / Engineering/ Economy or another quantitative field
A methodological approach for data with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisions
Excellent mathematical and analytical skills
Excel/Google spreadsheet skills
Proficient with SQL 
Experience with Tableau or similar analytical tools
Ability to query data in order to evaluate ongoing player behavior and interests in relation to game features
Ability to effectively communicate data results and related conclusions
Team-player with excellent initiative and motivation
Great organizational and problem-solving skills

What we offer:

Join an experienced, supportive, and creative team of professionals
Make an impact - shape our next hit mobile games, reaching millions of people worldwide! 
Personal growth - we encourage continuous learning and development within our international teams

The role

We are seeking a driven and ambitious Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team, based in Berlin. Our team provides support across all teams like Product, Sales and Operations by developing insights and enabling analytical and automated decision making. We build strong partnerships with key stakeholders and work on challenges such as defining, implementing and tracking company-wide metrics, and leading initiatives to improve them

Zenjob is on the mission to become the digital staffing platform delivering companies best staffing experience with the highest flexibility and reliability, and workers the best choice and fair pay for side jobs. Our service is available in over 39 cities in Germany. Our growth financing round of $50 million (€45 million) from February 2022 is helping us to scale our platform and add new data-based automation features for our rapidly growing customer base.

What you'll be doing

Requirements gathering

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and define data analytical requirements that will help driving business initiatives
Define KPIs, success and health metrics in the context of product and business initiatives

Data collection and preparation:

Identify relevant data sources and work with data engineers and tracking experts to source the right data into the analytics environment
Prepare data to make it suitable for the analysis in context

Data exploration and analysis:

Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights
Utilize statistical methods to extract actionable information from data
Develop and maintain core data models to support business analysts

Experimentation

Support stakeholders during the hypothesis formulation and validation phase
With the collaboration of the data science and engineering teams, design and implement experiments around upcoming product features 

Visualization and reporting

Design and create effective data visualizations to communicate insights and trends
Hands-on experience with traditional BI tools (Tableau, Metabase) and, ideally, product analytics tools (Indicative) as well

Communication and collaboration

Communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and nontechnical audiences
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, data engineers, and product managers and decision makers
Provide training and support to end users for interpreting and using data visualizations in a self-service manner effectively 

What you'll bring 

5-+ years of relevant experience interpreting data as an analyst or equivalent
High proficiency in querying and modeling data using Python and SQL
Ability to translate a business question into an analytical requirement considering its context: what the business is trying to achieve, the processes around it, the systems that interact and the data points available
Analyze the results of A/B-test experiments and derive conclusions or new hypothesis the business can follow up on
Great communication skills in stakeholder management from diverse backgrounds
Great communication skills in storytelling capable of creating a consistent narrative that gives meaning to the numbers
Extensive experience using different data visualization and reporting tools
Experience on analytics engineering using dbt is highly desirable
Plus: experience with experimentation platforms (eg. ABSmartly, Optimizely) and product analytical tools (eg. Indicative, Amplitude)

What we offer:

A supportive, open, and fun team that will have your back from day 1. 
Twenty-eight days of vacation (increases based on tenure to up to 30 days), 1-day special leave paid for charity work, five days of paid educational leave, and the option of unpaid leave. 
Hybrid work setup combining office & remote work (3 days from office, 2 days home), flexible working hours, bring your dog policy. 
Ongoing focus on your personal development (annual development budget of EUR 750, mentoring opportunities, continuous career conversations)
Mental Health support via Likeminded
Monthly 30 EUR subsidy on Urban Sports Club, 25% discount on FitX gym membership
Monthly 40 EUR credit for NAVIT- a sustainable mobility solution spanning public transport bike-sharing. 
Tax-free meal allowance (saving EUR ~50 net per month!)
Quarterly team get togethers, budget for employees birthdays, winter & summer parties plus regular cultural talks & events

If this sounds exciting to you, then we'd love to find out more about you! Apply and send in your application.

Life at Zenjob revolves around innovation, collaboration, and growth. Check out our video for a glimpse into what it's like to be part of our team: Link to Video 🎥

We invite you to explore our Career Page, follow our LinkedIn page, and connect with us on Instagram.

We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to assessing every qualified person according to their skills, regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. It is not necessary to include your photo and age with your application.

KNUTH is a leading, international machine tool supplier in the manufacturing industry, with a global presence across 4 continents and a 100-year history. Today, the family-owned business is run by the 4th generation of the Knuth family with the Group’s headquarters located in Germany.

KNUTH strives to become the digital leader in a traditional B2B market worth more than €100B. We currently acquire 50+% of our new customers through online channels and we plan to scale this even more. We have started a project to building a modern, global tech stack consisting of a new ERP, new CRM and new data warehouse and BI.

We are looking for an experienced and self-motivated Senior Data Analyst (remote-first) to support in our tech stack migration projects. The main goal is to take over responsibility for synching data flows of both our legacy and new tech stack, while gathering model requirements from business stakeholders and translating them into data pipelines. This is a unique opportunity to work for a leading company in the machine tool industry and to make a real difference in improving business processes.

Aufgaben

Designing and constructing the new company data warehouse according to most advanced standards of scalability and security 
Developing complex ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes that are crucial for transforming and transporting data from various sources into a unified format for analysis.
Communicate effectively and collaborate proactively with different stakeholders/departments (Sales, Product Managers, Finance, ...) to gather data model requirements, to define detailed pipeline and data models designs, and to define successful analytics outcomes, while making recommendations and implementing best practices
Provide strong data modeling expertise to all Data Team members through code reviews, pairing, and training to help deliver optimal, DRY, and scalable database designs and queries in Snowflake
Implementing data pipelines and synchronizations that automate the flow of data across various systems, thereby enhancing the efficiency of data processes (e.g., moving data from 4-5 different systems: ERP, CRM, PIMCORE for content management, etc.).
Regularly monitoring and optimizing data systems to ensure they perform efficiently and reliably.
Create and maintain architecture & systems documentation
Facilitate and drive the definition and documentation of analytical KPIs within the whole company (e.g., developing further reporting capabilities in Power BI)
Develop and communicate strong opinions about best practices in Analytics Engineering


Qualifikation

Very good German and English language skills 
5 years of professional experience in Data Engineering
Proficient in SQL & Python (C# is a plus, as it's needed for almost all Microsoft APIs)
Database knowledge: MS SQL, Snowflake, MySQL
Flexibility to travel to our headquarter in Wasbek (Germany) occasionally
Proficient in usage of dbt & GitHub (and version control)
Knowledge of ERP & CRM data flows and table structures (ideally AP+, MS Business Central & MS Dynamics 365 CRM and Field Sales)
Excellent project management skills paired with business acumen (e.g., cost vs. benefits mindset)
Great and proactive communication skills by regularly achieving consensus amongst technical and business teams, i.e. being able to abstract technical challenges into business language and translating business requirements to data pipelines
Demonstrated capacity to clearly and concisely communicate complex business activities, technical requirements, and recommendations
Proven track record of supplying analytics solutions for existing teams, with ability to take open ended goals and scope them into defined and impactful objectives
Positive, solution-oriented mindset and high comfort working in an agile, iterative environment
Ideally first experience in a BI environment with Power BI
Ideally first experience with or interest in IoT-related products (e.g., Machine Learning)


Benefits

Competitive compensation and benefits package (remote work possible)
Exciting projects that you work on and supervise independently, and hands-on implementing them in our organization
Directly reporting to the Head of IT & Digital Transformation
A significant opportunity for personal and professional growth: Working with driven, young professionals around the globe in a creative working atmosphere with more than 20 nationalities in several global offices (Wasbek near Hamburg, Chicago, Moscow, Johannesburg, Shenzhen)
A challenging and diverse task with an opportunity to set your own footprint from day one and decisively influence the success of KNUTH 
Digital-First: We are a global family business in a generational transition. Together, we are forging new, digital paths to question existing processes and to create new business models in Industry 4.0


If you are passionate about designing, maintaining, and implementing complex data models and have a proven track record of successfully implementing them, then we would love to hear from you. Join us and help us to improve business processes and achieve our goal of transparency across all departments of the KNUTH Group.

Your mission

Dive deep into our datasets to extract valuable insights
Transform complex data into meaningful visualizations that tell a compelling story, enabling decision-makers to quickly grasp key insights
Leverage your analytical skills to provide solutions to business challenges, playing a pivotal role in driving our company's growth
Apply robust and appropriate methodologies to ensure the accuracy and relevance of your findings
Work closely with various teams to understand data requirements and provide analytical support, while also learning from and sharing your knowledge with team members
Present complex data findings in a clear and accessible manner to a diverse range of stakeholders, ensuring that everyone, from technical experts to non-technical team members, can understand and act upon them
Leverage your analytical skills to provide solutions to business challenges, playing a pivotal role in driving our company's growth


Your profile

A minimum of 2 years of experience in data analytics or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, with an ability to write complex yet well-structured and well-documented queries to extract and manipulate data. Familiarity with dbt is a definite plus
A firm grasp of statistical and data analysis methodologies, ensuring that all conclusions drawn are valid and actionable
Proven ability to communicate data findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, tailoring presentations and reports as needed
A creative mind that constantly seeks new ways to analyze data and present findings, ensuring our data analytics remains cutting-edge
You have a learner’s mindset and always seek out new tools, techniques, and perspectives to enhance your work. You are also open to learning from team members and are generous in sharing your expertise with them
Ability to collaborate smoothly with cross-functional teams, understanding their needs and delivering insights that make a real difference
Adaptability: Comfortable and adaptive in a high-speed, dynamic work environment, ensuring timely deliverables without compromising on quality


What we offer

A meaningful job! We create a great product with real social impact
Collaboration in a great, experienced and international team that exchanges ideas and learn from each other
Insight into the entire work process of our startup as well as the nebenan.de foundation
Responsibility and great opportunities to get actively involved
A flexible vacation policy - take as much vacation as you need. We also offer the option of a sabbatical
Your nebenan.de Spendit Card - per month you receive an additional income of 35 Euro, which you can use for things of your choice
A strength-based development culture (we work with the Gallup StrengthsFinder)
A workplace in Berlin-Kreuzberg, in a cheerful team and regular events such as lunch roulette / lunch & learn / yoga / back courses
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remote

We are Gemma Analytics: a Berlin-based company specializing in generating insights in high-performance data infrastructure. Gemma was founded in early 2020 by two data enthusiasts. Ever since we have helped over 60 companies to become more data-driven and successful. We have a fun, honest, and inclusive work environment. We are always looking for data-minded people we can learn from.

Tasks

As a Senior Data Analyst, your mission is to empower businesses with data-driven insights and strategies that propel their growth and success. You do not accept a solution, but ask for the “Why?”. You will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, enabling our clients to make informed and trusted judgments and gain an advantage in their respective industries.

In addition to that, you will contribute to the growth of our organization by mentoring and guiding associate data professionals and sharing your knowledge and expertise to foster their professional development. Furthermore, you will responsibly stay abreast of the latest industry trends and technologies, continuously nurturing your skills and providing thought leadership and support within our company.

By embracing this mission, you will help businesses unlock the potential of their data, driving tangible results, sharing your knowledge with colleagues, and enthusiastically nurturing decision-making in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.

Requirements

We believe in a good mixture of experience and upside in our team. For this role, related experience is required in addition to a proof of trajectory.

Besides that we are looking for the following:

2 or more years of experience as an analyst in a fast-paced environment driving projects and business insights
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability for critical thinking and reflection
Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proven ability to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities
Ability to leverage both SQL and visualization tools to generate insights for our clients
Business Fluency (C2 or native) in German
Preferred: You managed to bring a data science model to production
Preferred: You have strong expertise in one or more core functional data areas (e.g. product/marketing/operational/etc.)


Benefits

We are located in Berlin, close to Nordbahnhof. We are currently 15 colleagues and will grow to 23 colleagues in the next 12 to 18 months. Other perks include:

We are a hybrid company that meets in the office twice a week - one common office day and one flexible day
We allow for intra-EU workcations for up to 3 months a year (extra-EU workcations also if this is allowed)
We have an honest, inclusive work environment and want to nurture this environment
We don’t compromise on equipment - a powerful Laptop, extra screens, and all the tools you need to be effective
We will surround you with great people who love to solve (mostly data) riddles
We believe in efficient working hours rather than long working hours - we focus on the output rather than the input
We learn and share during meetups, lunch & learn sessions and are open to further initiatives
We pay a market-friendly salary and we additionally distribute at least 20% of profits to our employees
We are fast-growing and have technology at our core, yet we do not rely on a VC and operate profitably
We have a great yearly offsite event that brings us all together for a full week, enjoying good food, and having a good time (2021: Austria, 2022: Czech Republic, 2023: Germany)


How You'll Get Here

CV Screening
Phone/Coffee/Tea Initial Conversation
Hiring Test
Interviews with 3 future colleagues
Reference calls
Offer + Hired

job_title: Business Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
job_desc:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

 Our Purpose –  Bridging the World Through Travel 

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

 Get to Know our  Team: 

The Flights Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing – Flight Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

 In this Role, you’ll get  to: 

You’ll be heavily involved in growing our Flights business
Experiment with various pricing strategies on Agoda and Metasearch to grow the business
Analyze massive amounts of data generated in experiments, build dashboards, and develop predictive models
Work with diverse stakeholders to arrive at investment plans for markets and channels

 What you’ll Need to  Succeed: 

Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently and succinctly in English 
Good numerical reasoning skills
Strong problem solving skills
Proficiency in Excel and SQL
Intellectual curiosity

 It’s Great if you  Have: 

Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL
Experience in digital marketing

Für unsere Kunden analysierst Du Daten, konzipierst Datenströme und entwickelst Lösungen, die aus Daten einen Mehrwert schaffen

Du gestaltest aktiv die stetige Weiterentwicklung unseres BI-Portfolios mit

Du hast erste praktische Erfahrungen in der technischen Konzeption und Entwicklung von BI- und DWH-Lösungen, idealerweise mit Cloud-Background

Unser Beitrag: konzernweites Stipendienprogramm für junge Menschen in Indien und viele weitere Corporate-Responsibility-Projekte in den Bereichen Bildung, Beschäftigung und digitale Inklusion

Datenanalyst:in im Einkauf

Nur mit den Kollegen und Kolleginnen aus diesen strukturierten, leistungsbereiten und unterstützenden Abteilungen wie dem Personal, der Buchhaltung, dem Controlling, der IT und der Kommunikation, ist es uns möglich über uns hinaus zu wachsen und unsere Ziele als Unternehmen zu erreichen.

Fließende Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Erfahrung in Data Analytics und Reporting Tools (z.B. Spotfire)

Weitere Informationen

job_title: (Senior) Data Analyst / Business Intelligence Developer (m/w/d) // Remote möglich
job_desc:
Fashion und Lifestyle, 6.500 Mitarbeiter:innen, 13 Department Stores, Online-Shops in Deutschland, Polen, Österreich, Belgien, Luxemburg, Spanien, den Niederlanden und der Schweiz, über 2000 Marken, 25 Restaurants & Confiserien, 15 erstklassige Services, drei Friseur-Salons und stets ein besonderes Einkaufserlebnis – das ist Breuninger. Ein Traditionsunternehmen, das internationale Wege geht, seine Ziele klar definiert und innovative Möglichkeiten schafft.

Deine Aufgaben

Als Teil des Data Modeling & BI Teams bei Breuninger spielst Du eine entscheidende Rolle bei der kontinuierlichen Weiterentwicklung unserer Data-Plattform. Deine Hauptaufgaben umfassen:

Du entwickelst Datenmodelle durch fundierte Analysen für verschiedene Unternehmensbereiche wie Einkauf, Logistik, Verkauf, Webshop sowie Finance/Controlling und bist für deren Qualitätssicherung und Optimierung verantwortlich. 
Durch die Erstellung von Dashboards stellst du einfache Analysemöglichkeiten für Unternehmensdaten bereit, um den Fachbereichen eine verbesserte Steuerung zu ermöglichen. 
Du stellst wiederverwendbare Datenprodukte zur Verfügung und visualisierst sie für die einfache Nutzung durch andere Analysten in logischen Datenmodellen. 
In enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Bereichen Data Engineering, Data Science sowie anderen Fachabteilungen gestaltest du gemeinsam die Zukunft unserer Data Plattform bei Breuninger. 
Genau wie unsere Systeme stehst Du nicht still und interessierst Dich für neue Technologien und Software insbesondere in den Bereichen Data Management, Data Warehousing und Big Data. 
Du treibst Data Governance Themen voran und trägst du dazu bei, Regeln, Standards und Prozesse zu definieren um somit "data driven work" auf ein neues Level zu heben. 


Dein Profil

Um in dieser Position erfolgreich zu sein, bringst du folgende Qualifikationen und Fähigkeiten mit:

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit Schwerpunkt auf Datenanalyse, Datenmanagement oder einem ähnlichen Fachgebiet und hast bereits Berufserfahrung im Datenbereich gesammelt. 
Du bringst fundierte Programmierkenntnisse insbesondere in SQL mit 
Es macht dir Spaß, die fachlichen Anforderungen unserer Stakeholder zu verstehen und in die Sprache der Daten zu übersetzen. 
Du hast ein gutes Verständnis von Datenbanken und Datenmodellierung. 
Clean Code und Test-driven Development sind für dich selbstverständlich 
Du bringst Erfahrung in der Aufbereitung und Visualisierung von Daten, idealerweise in Power BI, mit 
Du weißt, wie man effiziente Datenstrecken aufbaut, und kennst dich idealerweise mit dbt aus. 
Bestenfalls hast du bereits Erfahrung mit Google BigQuery gesammelt. 
Teamwork ist für dich wichtig und du bringst Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit agilen Methoden mit. 
Du verfügst über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse und kannst Dich somit ideal in unserem multi-kulturellen Team integrieren 


Wir bieten

Bei uns erhältst Du die Möglichkeit, in einem modernen, agilen sowie wertschätzenden Umfeld zu arbeiten. Fühlst Du Dich angesprochen? Dann findest Du bei Breuninger ein Team, in dem Du Dich wohlfühlen und nachhaltig wirken kannst.

 Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit betrieblicher Altersvorsorge und freiwilligen Sozialleistungen wie Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld 
 30% Mitarbeiter:innenrabatt auf alle Produkte und Leistungen inkl. Gastronomie, Friseure etc. 
 Persönliche und fachliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten bis hin zum Führungskräfteentwicklungsprogramm 
 Maximale Flexibilität bei Urlaubstagen in Form von zusätzlichen, bezahlten Urlaubstagen durch Gehaltsumwandlung 
 Familienfreundliche Arbeitszeiten für DeineWork-Life-Balance 
 Corporate Benefits und attraktive Rabatte von bis zu 21.000 Unternehmen 
 Company Bike mittels Entgeltumwandlung günstig und unproblematisch leasen 


Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann sollten wir uns schnell kennenlernen.

Bei Fragen steht Dir Katrin gerne jederzeit zur Verfügung.

Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Online Bewerbung mit Angabe Deiner Verfügbarkeit sowie Gehaltsvorstellung.

About Grover

Unlock the future of tech with Grover! We're revolutionizing access to cutting-edge technology, offering affordable and sustainable solutions through flexible tech rental subscriptions. No deposits, no commitments—just the latest tech on-demand, exactly when and where you need it. Join us in transforming the tech landscape across Germany, Austria, Spain, and The Netherlands. Your journey to limitless possibilities begins with Grover!

Our Mission & Vision

To date, Grover has circulated over 1.2 million devices, employs over 400 people, and stands as one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe. We hit Unicorn status in 2022, and are scaling internationally!

We're proud to champion a more sustainable way to use tech. With an average of 3-4 rental cycles per device depending on the category, we estimate that the rental of our portfolio from 2015-2021 resulted in 160,000 fewer e-waste products and about 250 tons of e-waste.

To continue this incredible adventure, we are looking for an ambitious Sr. Pricing Data Scientist (m/f/x) who has successful experience applying data science techniques to economics, ideally to pricing or similar commercial topics. You would be joining a small data team within Commercial who is tasked with building and improving our pricing engine, and ultimately targeting smart automation. The role is a hybrid full-time position at our Berlin HQ (2 days per week).

🎯 What you will contribute:

Help build the pricing infrastructure at Grover which includes improving and automating current models as well as creating innovative new approaches
Drive system design initiatives to optimize processes
Drive our scientific roadmap to build a price-demand relationship
Design clear experiment frameworks to analyze and operationalize relevant elasticity KPIs in Grover's Commercial team
Look at further economic factors like supply, costs, and competition to finetune the key insights
Work closely with pricing analysts, data team, and commercial stakeholders to understand the business requirements
Communicate your findings and R&D initiatives to upper management to show incremental value adds to Grover's unique business mode

🤝 What you bring:

A Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (eg Natural Science, Economics, Computing, etc)
At least 5 years of hands-on work experience in Data Science, including 2 years which were focused on pricing models or similar commercial topics
Advanced quantitative and programming skills with the ability to process data with SQL (Redshift) and Python (Pandas, Numpy)
Experiment design and statistical analysis skills with the ability to share key insights with all your stakeholders
Understand, and have experience training and deploying supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms, with particular applications to time-series datasets
A passion for building models and solving complex problems independently
Strong communication skills in English (C1)

 ⭐ Nice to haves:

Experience using Kubernetes infrastructure for building automation
A/B testing experience
Experience using Google APIs

❤️‍🔥 Why join Grover: 

Hybrid model with 30 days per year to work abroad 
28 days of paid vacation, plus another additional day after 3 & 4 years 
BVG monthly discount to drive you anywhere in Berlin
Company Pension Scheme and a top-up to Parental Leave (for both parents)
Online Mental Wellness support with Nilohealth
Urban Sports Club or ClassPass Corporate Discount
Annual learning budget of 1000€ 
1 Paid Volunteering Day per Month 
Online German Classes through LanguageHero and Babbel subscription
Exclusive Grover Tech discount for you & your loved ones
Engaging, open office located in Berlin-Schöneberg with free snacks and drinks, underground parking including bikes & e-cars, regular events, a music studio, and a gym… to name a few! 
A diverse global team of 72 nationalities (and counting!) - genuinely the nicest group of colleagues who will soon become friends

Embark on a rewarding journey with the Grover Rocketship, where your impact is felt, and together, we cultivate a more circular world. 💚

We are looking forward to e-meeting you! 🚀

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Grafana Developer Advocacy (Remote, Germany)
job_desc:
This is a remote position and we're considering candidates in Germany.

Our Community

We were born from Open Source and it’s in our founding and company DNA. Our job in developer advocacy is just that - to advocate for this community, and nurture the people within it. When they succeed, Grafana does as well. We believe that a big, vibrant, participatory community is how the most innovation happens, and how we grow.

About The Role

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who can lead analytics for our function. You will use Grafana as a platform to produce analytics about the Grafana Open Source community and communicate publicly about the results. Everything we do in developer advocacy is public, and we want you to talk about your work.

Internally, we want to better understand how users learn & progress through our software, and we use our own stack to get that done, as well as to teach others how to do similar things. This role will partner closely with our self-serve cloud, analytics, and engineering departments and report to our Director of Developer Advocacy in an all-remote team of advocates and community specialists.

You will be joining a developer advocacy & community team of 13 to provide insights into our community and demonstrate the impact of developer advocacy. We work in the R&D part of the organization, alongside product managers and engineers. The aim of the role is to help users build cool stuff.

If working at the intersection of analytics, open source, and developer advocacy is something you’re excited about, we’d love to hear from you.

You Will

Partner across areas to establish top-level KPIs, and dashboards for the developer advocacy function
Guide the instrumentation of product data in collaboration with our PMs, UX, and Engineering teams
Play a key role in the implementation of our product analytics tooling (e.g., Rudderstack, BigQuery and others)
Develop DBT models to transform and test our growth data in partnership with our Analytics Engineering team


You have

Familiarity with developer advocacy as a function and how open-source communities work
Experience partnering across organizations, and some familiarity with typical product KPIs and frameworks (e.g., DAU/MAU, funnels, A/B testing)
SQL: writing complex yet efficient SQL is a daily habit for you
Data Visualization: experience with any of the following tools Tableau, Looker, Mode, Hex, or of course, Grafana!
Experience writing dbt models, and implementing product analytics tooling (e.g., Heap, Pendo, Amplitude, FullStory)
Excellent communication skills, able to explain technical topics to non-technical audiences


A plus if you have

Knowledge about observability
Familiarity with Airflow or Prefect - generating ad hoc ETL jobs


In Germany, the Base compensation range for this role is EUR 71,688 - EUR 86,026. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.

Compensation ranges are country-specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.


About Grafana Labs: There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies -- including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay -- manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).

Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.

For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.

As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.

Tasks

Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.
Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.
Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.
Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.


Requirements

You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.
Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.
Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.
Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.
Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.


Benefits

Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement
An environment that offers room for personal and professional development
A centrally located office in Berlin City West
Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs
The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products
A pet-friendly environment
Salary progression based on length of service with the company
Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.


At Puls Technologies GmbH, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be part of an exhilarating expedition that is reshaping the very fabric of the SME landscape. If you're passionate about driving growth, igniting innovation, and leaving a lasting impact, your adventure begins here!

You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart, talented people in the heart of Berlin's City West.

Get in touch with us now!

Puls Technologies GmbH
Desired Skills and Experience

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Q-Commerce, Store Operations Science
job_desc:
Want to be a hero? - Join the #1 Global Leader in online food ordering and delivery!

We are looking for creative and motivated Senior Data Analyst (all genders) to join our Quick Commerce vertical with a focus on fulfilment operations data products Contribute to the creation of our fast growing next-generation platform, which works on expanding our amazing delivery service to new products such as groceries, pharmaceuticals, electronics and more.

You’ll analyse billions of data points generated across 50 countries by more than 100 million customers. Work hand-in-hand with experienced data scientists and data engineers to analyse and scale our machine learning models and deliver meaningful insights to your team and various stakeholders across the business, directly shaping the product roadmap.

If you're a creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your Mission

Build and own the business logic for the attributes, metrics, and KPIs we calculate. You work in synergy with our data scientists, engineers, partners, and product managers, to facilitate the execution of evaluation experiments at scale, and drive adoption of global data solutions by analyzing the relevant metrics.
Work in a diverse, highly effective team responsible for optimization of the Quick Commerce product content, covering more than a hundred thousand stores and millions of products in more than 50 countries 
Analyse data to answer key questions with an eye for what drives product performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement. Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives.
Collaborate with the central teams in Berlin as well as with the local teams in APAC, MENA, Latin America and other locations to iterate and improve our models
Take ownership of data analytics within the team and work autonomously with stakeholders to deliver insights
Solve business problems with data, forming and testing hypotheses along the way
Support, collaborate and learn from data scientists to use statistical and machine learning techniques for strategic deep dives 
Challenge the status quo by proactively bringing new ideas and suggestions to the team

Your Heroic Skills

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field, e.g. computer science, mathematics, physics, economics or equivalent experience.
4+ years of relevant work experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or comparable fields
Experience in processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities (Millions to Billions of rows) of data from different product groups and business functions - Advanced knowledge of SQL (e.g. complex querying BigQuery, Aurora, etc) in an analytical context, and experienced in using cloud services (Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure)
Working proficiency with Python (e.g. Pandas, Jupyter, Matplotlib, Plotly, Altair, ) for Exploratory Data Analysis. Experience with visualisation and reporting tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, DataStudio, etc)
Basic familiarity with mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques (such as regression, extrapolation, statistical hypothesis testing, or econometric models)
You work in a goal-driven environment with strong analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of using data to tell stories, effectively articulate data challenges and solutions, and deal well with ambiguous and undefined problems; You can lead presentations on different abstraction levels depending on the technical and business depth of the audience. 
You communicate with business customers (strong communication skills with fluency in English ) on various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our research, as well as sharing insights and recommendations.

Nice To Have

Experience with machine learning or optimization algorithms
Experience with tools and data querying languages (e.g. NoSQL, Hadoop/Hive) for handling big data (e.g. Redshift, Spark, Docker)
Experience with workflow management tools (eg: Airflow).
You follow the practice of tracking and managing iterations of your analyses by using version control systems (e.g. git).

Who We Are

As the world’s leading local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech but driven by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable ambitious talent to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

What's In It For You

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support

The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts

Als führendes Unternehmen im Digital Listening sucht die complexium GmbH, Berlin, aktuell mehrere OSINT-Sicherheitsberater:innen, die unser Team weiter verstärken.
Seit 2004 sind wir auf die Generierung von Intelligence aus öffentlich zugänglichen Digitalquellen spezialisiert:

... den wirtschaftlich-politisch-sozialen Kontext verfolgen, Open Source Intelligence #OSINT nutzen, durch eigene Tools #Telegram & Co. transparent machen, Entwicklungen & schwache Signale & #Desinformation erkennen, Geschehen bewerten, #Lagebilder erstellen und mit Unternehmenssicherheit / Personenschutz auf Augenhöhe diskutieren: The Next Line of Defense.

Mit eigener Technologie (auch: KI) und einem Analystenteam arbeiten wir daran, Bedrohungen für Unternehmen und exponierte Persönlichkeiten frühzeitig zu erkennen: insb. für Konzerne aus den Bereichen Auto, Bank, Chemie, Defense, Energie, Flughafen, Gesundheit und Industrie.

Aufgabe
Du unterstützt – nach kurzer Einarbeitungszeit – eigenständig renommierte Klienten mit einem regelmäßigen Sicherheitsbericht, bei akuten Bedrohungen oder präventiven Analysen.
Du erfasst – mit einigen interessanten Werkzeugen – das digitale Geschehen, kannst Aspekte qualitativ hinterfragen.

Erwartete Qualifikationen:
Belastbare Analyse- und Social Media-Kenntnisse
Hervorragende Schreib-, Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Selbstständigkeit und Teamfähigkeit: Organisiert, verlässlich und zuverlässig
Wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium: Sicherheitsmanagement, Politikwissenschaft, Internationale Beziehungen, International Security Studies, Journalistik, Kommunikationswissenschaft, Sozialwissenschaft

Unser Angebot:
eine schnelle Lernkurve mit sicherer Perspektive: Zukunft.
die Möglichkeit, schnell Verantwortung zu übernehmen: Augenhöhe.
abwechslungsreiche Projekte in unterschiedliche Branchen: Nah am Geschehen.
ein fröhliches Team aus erfahrenen Sicherheitsexperten: Wachstum.
einen Arbeitsplatz in Berlin-Mitte und Homeoffice: Flexibilität.
Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie: Wichtig!
