We are looking for a dynamic, experienced individual to be part of a team conducting business intelligence across Europe. The successful candidate will be based either in London, Berlin or Madrid. They will be a critical thinker with good written and communication skills, with an interest in business transactions and operations. We are looking for an inquisitive individual keen to investigate, evaluate and interpret both open source and human intelligence information in the context of due diligence and business intelligence. The right candidate will be a proactive team player, able to maintain a positive attitude under pressure. They will speak fluent English as well as at least one European language.

Role Tasks And Responsibilities

Investigative case management


Researching a range of business intelligence and compliance projects including due diligence, business intelligence, market entry studies, problem solving and stakeholder mapping exercises
Liaising with clients to understand their requirements and ensure that our proposals deliver solutions tailored to those needs, and then delivering projects aligned with that requirement
Liaising with our human source network and expand it by cultivating contacts in Europe
Ensuring the delivery of projects on budget, scope and deadline
Briefing and presenting findings to internal and external clients


Business and practice development


Seek opportunities to be improve our current methodologies, including through the application of new technology and new sources
Supporting senior staff by identifying sales leads, providing research into prospective clients, and helping to organise sales meetings


Requirements

Essential

Previous professional experience within the Business Intelligence industry

Experience of managing projects and presenting findings to clients

An understanding of Europe's political and commercial environment

Ability to work in a team and independently

Strong grasp of key anti-bribery and corruption principles in the commercial sector

Good knowledge of commercial databases, information sources and investigation focus

Professional fluency in English and at least one other European language

Education to Bachelor's degree

Benefits


Control Risks offers a competitively positioned compensation and benefits package that is transparent and summarised in the full job offer.
We operate a discretionary global bonus scheme that incentivises, and rewards individuals based on company and individual performance.
Control Risks supports hybrid working arrangements, wherever possible, that emphasise the value of in-person time together - in the office and with our clients - while continuing to support flexible and remote working.
As an equal opportunities employer, we encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join us and are fully committed to equal treatment, free from discrimination, of all candidates throughout our recruitment process.


Apply for this job

Ihr Aufgabenbereich

Leitung von Teilprojekten sowie Erbringung von Consultingleistungen in den Themengebieten (Big) Data Analytics, maschinelles Lernen und künstliche Intelligenz für Anomalie- und Mustererkennung in Daten sowie Vorhersagen
Analyse von Geschäftsprozessen und Datenbeständen von Kunden sowie Ableitung von Empfehlungen für konkrete Data-Analytics- und KI-Anwendungsfälle und der zugrunde liegenden Technologien
Selbstständige Vorbereitung und Durchführung von Kundenworkshops und Präsentationen sowie selbstständige Durchführung von Anforderungsanalysen für komplexe Kundenlösungen im Umfeld der genannten Themengebiete
Selbständige Erstellung von Lösungskonzepten unter Einbeziehung von Kunden sowie weiterer interner und externer Stakeholder
Eigenständige fachliche Koordination von interdiszplinarischen Teams im Rahmen von Produktentwicklungen zum Ausbau des KI-Portfolios
Mitgestaltung der Portfolio-Strategie und selbstständige Begleitung von komplexen Produktvorhaben mit Künstlicher Intelligenz und Data Analytics im Rahmen der Konzeption, technischen Entwicklung, des Deployments und Ramp-ups
Eigenständige Unterstützung des Vertriebs bei Presales-, Sales- und After-Sales-Maßnahmen

Ihr Profil

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem der MINT-Studiengänge, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder vergleichbare Hochschulabschlüsse mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung
Praxis in der Analyse von Daten und Erstellung von Datenmodellen zur Generierung neuer Erkenntnisse und zur Umsetzung der Anwendungsfälle der Kunden
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Anwendung gängiger Algorithmen und State-of-the-Art-Lösungen für die Umsetzung von Data Analytics- und KI-Projekte (z. B. mit Hadoop, Spark, R, Python usw.) sowie in Technologien für die Datenvorbereitung (ETL) und zur Datenvisualisierung
Erfahrung in der Erbringung von Consultingleistungen oder Portfolio- und Produktmanagement in mindestens einem der genannten Themengebiete
Programmierkenntnisse sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse

Ihre Vorteile

Gemeinsam mehr erreichen: toller Teamspirit in einem kompetenten und zukunftssicheren Arbeitsumfeld mit einzigartigen Projekten
Attraktive Arbeitsbedingungen: ausgewogene Balance zwischen Beruf und Privatleben dank flexibler Arbeitsmodelle und -zeiten, 30 Tagen Urlaub im Jahr und mobilem Arbeiten
Moderne Arbeitsausstattung: top Equipment und innovative Tools für die interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit
Persönliche Entwicklung: individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie Fach- und Führungskräfteprogramme
Optimale Verkehrsanbindung: attraktiver Standort mit sehr guter Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr
Angebote zum Gesundbleiben: Sportkooperationen, Präventionskurse und Laufevents
Weitere Extras: betriebliche Altersvorsorge, vermögenswirksame Leistungen, unterstützende Maßnahmen bei der Kinderbetreuung und der Pflege von Angehörigen

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Experience Analytics (all genders)
job_desc:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


You will join the Customer Experience Analytics team. Our main goal is to delve deep into the customer experience, revealing its hidden elements. We are part of the customer care organisation, putting us in a unique position to understand and detect customer issues better and faster than any other team. We empower various teams across the entire organisation to tackle the hidden opportunities that we discover, ensuring a continuously improving experience for our customers. In this role, you will be instrumental in enhancing the CX data foundation, a pivotal asset that will be utilised to decode and enhance the customer experience comprehensively. Your contributions will not only shape our data landscape but also directly influence our ability to understand and elevate every customer interaction.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


Data Analysis and Insights Generation Utilise advanced analytical techniques to extract insights from large and complex datasets. Translate these insights into actionable recommendations to drive business growth and optimization. 
Data Visualization and Reporting Develop visually compelling dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics and trends to stakeholders. Ensure that data visualisations are intuitive, informative, and tailored to the needs of different audience groups. 
ETL Process Optimization Design and optimise ETL pipelines ensuring data integrity and reliability throughout the data lifecycle. 
Self-Service Analytics Enablement Develop self-service analytics tools and resources to empower stakeholders to access and analyse data independently. Provide training and support to enable users to leverage data effectively in their decision-making processes. 
Continuous Learning and Innovation Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in data analytics. Proactively identify opportunities to innovate and enhance our analytical capabilities. Share knowledge and best practices with team members to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. 


WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF


 You have strong expertise in SQL and Python. You have experience building and optimising data pipelines, as well as applying data modelling techniques to design datasets for Business Intelligence systems. You are familiar with Databricks Spark, AWS. 
 You have a solid understanding of statistical principles and their application in data analysis. 
 You are familiar with causal inference methods and their application in data analysis. 
 You are adept at tackling complex data challenges, possess strong analytical skills, and can devise efficient, scalable solutions. 
 You are experienced with data visualisation tools. 
 You understand the importance of data quality and the implications that issues in data quality can trigger in other teams. At the same time, you understand the tradeoff between complexity and practicality and know when to favor one over the other in your solutions. 
 You excel in a collaborative environment, can articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and enjoy working in cross-functional teams. 


Zalando Benefits

 Career Development 


 We offer direct mentoring from a more experienced Applied Scientist to help you advance your career 
 We offer peer-to-peer performance reviews twice a year 
 Learn and develop through our extensive Zalando training platform 
 Join regular all-hands, team meetings, Q&A sessions, and quarterly anonymous employee surveys to ask your questions and provide your feedback 
 Support from an international team of experts; mentoring and professional development opportunities 


 Wellbeing 


 2 days paid leave per year for volunteering 
 Minimum of 27 holiday days per calendar year 
 Online sports courses, wellbeing, and nutrition advice offered by Humanoo personal wellbeing coach app 
 Mental wellbeing support by our Employee Assistance Program and professional consultants to help you find health resources 


 Flexibility 


 Flexible working hours 
 Relocation assistance for internationals 
 A generous Hybrid Work model that allows for 3 days working from home 
 A choice of office equipment to be delivered to your home office, to support you working from home 


 Financial 


 Access to the employee shares program 
 40% shopping discount on products shipped and sold by Zalando, and 30% discount on Zalando Lounge 
 Discounts from a wide range of external partners 


 Family 


 Employee parents’ forums and employee resource group 
 Supported transition into and out of parental leave, with a buddy and re-onboarding plan 
 3 fully-paid child sick days per year 
 Free counselling, assistance, and referral service for all matters concerning yourself and your family via the Fürstenberg Institute 


About Zalando

It’s the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 23 markets.

Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 46 million active customers through a team of diverse skill-sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.

Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset

do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainability

Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando

About Zalando Payments

Positioned at the bustling intersection of eCommerce and FinTech, Zalando Payments helps ensure that Zalando’s customers can securely pay how they want when they want.

Zalando Payments builds the technologies for all financial transactions in the Zalando fashion store and our other consumer-facing apps. We work to deliver a flawless user experience in the checkout, as well as the processing of payments and reconciliation in the backend.

Payments website https //sites.google.com/zalando.de/zalando-payments/what-we-do

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Lust auf einen tollen Arbeitgeber?

Genug von komplexen Strukturen und veralteten Technologieunternehmen? Wir auch! Bei uns finden Branchenexpert:innen, Technikbegeisterte und Macher:innen ein Zuhause. Unser Fokus ist die leidenschaftliche Beratung auf Augenhöhe - dabei setzen wir auf klare Strukturen und eine moderne Arbeitsatmosphäre.

Lust auf was Neues? Wir suchen dich, um gemeinsam neue Konzepte für den Einsatz innovativer Technologien im KI-Umfeld zu erarbeiten. Du unterstützt unsere internationalen Kunden durch den Einsatz von KI im Prozess der Digitalisierung und hilfst unserem Team beim weiteren Aufbau des Business Intelligence Bereiches.

Du hast noch nicht genug? Arbeite wie es zu deinem Leben passt: keine vorgeschriebenen Office Tage und dein Standort spielt keine Rolle. Bei uns hast du die Chance Arbeitszeit und Ort flexibel zu wählen.

Das sind deine Aufgaben

Du führst komplexe Datenanalysen im Bereich Business Intelligence, Big Data und Data Lake Szenarien durch und leitest entsprechende Handlungsempfehlungen ab
Für die Themen Predictive Analytics und KI sowie für die Automatisierung und Big Data Entwicklung von Analyse- und Prognosemodellen und die Überführung in fachgerechte IT Lösungen bist du Haupttreiber:in
Auch die Identifizierung und Evaluierung von KI-Einsatzmöglichkeiten und Business Cases bei unseren Kunden fallen in deinen Aufgabenbereich
Du leitest und setzt innovative Beratungsprojekte mit dem Themenschwerpunkt KI und Big Data um
Den Themenbereich Data Science gestaltest du aktiv mit und baust diesen aus

Das bringst du mit

Du bringst mindestens 5 Jahre fundierte Berufserfahrung im Analytics und KI Umfeld, idealerweise auch gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Mining, Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics
Dein souveräner Umgang mit mindestens einer Programmiersprache wie z.B. Python, R, Java oder C++ zeichnet dich aus
Statistische Methoden und Algorithmen wendest du sicher an
Du hast Kenntnisse in Big-Data Infrastruktur, Cloud-basierten Analyseinstrumenten und relationalen Datenbanken 
Die Themen Business Analytics und Business Intelligence begeistern dich
Du hast erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, der Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Zudem bringst du Wissen und Interesse an aktuellen Trends, Konzepten und Technologien im Bereich KI und Big Data mit
Du bist teamfähig und besitzt sehr gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten
Abgerundet wird dein Profil mit sehr guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnissen sowie einer projektbedingten Reisebereitschaft innerhalb des DACH-Raums

Branche

Business Intelligence Planning and Analytics

Warum wir perfekt zu dir passen

Wir sind ein Team 

Starker Zusammenhalt
Ausgeprägte Hilfsbereitschaft
Preisgekrönte Feedback-Kultur
Zusammenarbeit auf Augenhöhe & flache Hierarchien

Unser Arbeitsklima ist Top 

Offener und kollegialer Umgang
Erreichbare Führungskräfte
Überdurchschnittliche Unternehmenszugehörigkeit
Langfristige Kundenbeziehungen

Du wirst individuell gefördert 

Eigene Academy für Trainings und Weiterbildung
Onboarding- und Mentoringprogramm
Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben
Spannende Projekte bei namhaften Kunden

Dein Leben bleibt in Balance 

Flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten (z. T. auch im europäischen Ausland)
Vertrauensarbeitszeit und -urlaub
Selbstbestimmtheit und Verantwortung
Team- und Unternehmens-Events
Familienfreundliches Arbeitsumfeld

Bei uns bekommst du mehr 

Sport- und Fitnessangebot
Private Unfallversicherung
Auslandskrankenversicherung
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
JobRad oder E-Auto als Dienstfahrzeug

Upsilon Global are searching for 3 Freelance Senior Biostatisticians to be homebased in Europe, to support activities within a Niche Sponsor, based in Western Europe who are expanding their capabilities on a global scale. As a result, their needs have grown within the biometrics team.

This position will be on an initial 12 month contract, on a 0.8 - 1.0FTE, starting in March 2024, with possibilities also in April or May 2024. We require experienced Biostatistician's with a minimum of 10 years' experience, with a proven background working within CRO/Pharmaceutical companies in Europe. The desired candidate will also have experience in CDISC and SAS along with mentoring, managing and training Junior Statistician's.

This role can be based anywhere in Europe.

Please get in touch for more details to discuss further RE: Daily Rates and details on the opportunity!

Join a Microsoft Gold Partner with the chance to be a part of a dynamic and friendly team, and work 100% remotely on BI and Data focused projects with various international clients.
 In this job your tasks will be:
Overseeing entire BI projects for our customers, beginning with requirements gathering and consulting.
Developing concepts and documenting the requirements for the projects.
Partner with Solution Architects and other team members to help create a design concept.
Acting as the main point of contact for the end client throughout the project.
Overseeing testing with regards to usability and process optimization.
Using PowerBI to create reports and dashboards to be used throughout the project.
Managing the handover and integration to the client at the end of the project.
 The required skills for the role are:
Strong experience in Business Intelligence, specifically as a consultant to a client.
Ability to conceptualise business requirements and transition them into technical solution designs.
Experience with BI tools and Microsoft Data tools (PowerBI, DataBricks, Data Factory)
A background in working with one of the major public cloud providers.
Excellent communication and presentation abilities.
German language skills
 What we can offer you:
An excellent team dynamic, with frequent get togethers and team trips.
The option to work 100% remotely from within Germany.
Working with cutting-edge technology (such as Fabrics) and staying up to date with new developments in our sector.
The option to work for a Microsoft Gold Partner and study for any specific Microsoft Certifications you may want to add to your skills.

If that speaks to you and the mentioned is what you like, please apply today to find out more!

Build the future with Enter.

Our mission is to decarbonize homes by making home retrofits easy and accessible for everyone! We've raised 20 Mio. € from top-tier investors like COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global to make a carbon neutral home reality. Enter allows homeowners to make the best decision regarding the energy efficiency of their homes.

We believe in:

Working software over comprehensive documentation
Responding to change over following a plan
Embracing mistakes over avoiding them
Full ownership over full control
Simplicity and focus over completeness


We’re looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.

Within Enter’s analytics team your role as the BI Analyst will be crucial to plan, build and maintain the dashboards we rely on in our strategic decision making as well as to provide the adhoc analyses we need in our day to day processes. Your area of focus will be our Operational Excellence domain. As part of this role you’ll build on the foundations of our BI processes, craft and improve data models, and set the trajectory for our data-driven future.

Your mission

Craft Business-Centric Data Models: As an integral part of Enter's analytics team, you'll feel responsible for all layers of data modeling, from raw to refined.
KPI Blueprinting & Deployment: Ideate, define, and establish key performance indicators (KPIs) for the Operational Excellence domain in collaboration with it’s business stakeholders. In addition to defining KPIs, you'll pioneer the development and upkeep of a comprehensive KPI catalogue.
Transform Data to Decisions: Combine the structured data models with KPIs to build and maintain expansive reports and dashboards that drive the strategic and operational business decisions in your domain.
Elevate the Data Discourse: Help foster data literacy within Enter. By equipping teams with the knowledge and tools they need, you ensure that data isn't just consulted but conversed with.
Hands-On Collaboration & Innovation: While you'll primarily be immersed in the world of BI, your collaboration with the data engineering team and hands-on work where possible ensures that the data models are cohesive, coherent, and capable of catering to both granular analysis and high-level insights. Your expertise will constantly bridge the gap between raw data and refined intelligence.


In this capacity, you'll be entrusted with the autonomy to innovate, drive changes, and make impactful contributions. You will take ownership for any analytics related topic within your domain. With the freedom to innovate and a team to harmonize with, your contributions as the BI Analyst will reshape how Enter perceives, processes, and proceeds with data.

Your profile

You have a minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role, ideally during a growth phase of the company/team or the strong ambition to join a growing area.
Ideally, you have worked with operational focused business units before.
Proven hands-on experience with BI tools and databases, especially within data warehouses like Snowflake and transformation tools like DBT. Proficiency in SQL.
A robust track record of collaboratively developing and implementing KPIs, ensuring they remain actionable, relevant, and aligned with business needs.
Profound analytical skills, highlighted by a history of proactively driving BI projects from conceptualization through to production.
Expertise in creating, refining, and maintaining data models and KPI catalogues, ensuring seamless integration with business strategies.
Stellar communication skills, paired with the talent to convey intricate data insights in a lucid and engaging manner to a diverse audience.
A solution-centric mindset, underscored by an autonomous work ethic, enabling you to yield impactful results without incessant direction.


Benefits

Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.
Attractive & competitive compensation.
Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.
Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.
Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.
Corporate Pension for your safe future.
Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.

You are fascinated by data about the social media behavior of your target group? You love drawing concrete conclusions from a large, disorganized amount of numbers and making your knowledge understandable to others? You are also fond of detail and keen to help shape new processes?

In that case, we’re looking for you as a Social Media Data Analyst (f/m/d).

Apply now! Even if the profile doesn't fit 100% at first glance.

Tasks

Evaluation and analysis of performance data on all relevant social media channels
Maximize the functionality of analysis tools (Google Analytics, Emplifi, Sprinklr, Talkwalker, etc.)
Deriving and presenting relevant findings and recommendations
Optimization/automation of data processing and processes
Leverage the full potential of visual data preparation & dashboarding
Support of interdisciplinary project teams
The opportunity to work with one of the world's leading automotive brands


Requirements

Expertise in social media analytics, additional knowledge in social media strategy and advertising
A flair for numbers
Competence in dealing with the currently relevant social media networks
Ability to build trusting customer relationships
Confident handling of MS Office and an irrepressible passion for Excel
Excellent German and good English skills
Interest in the automotive industry is a plus


Benefits

Hybrid working with flexible working hours, regular team events and the opportunity to come to our office in Berlin Kreuzberg
30 vacation days for all employees
Permanent contract after a 6-month probationary period
Room to develop and work independently in your new role
Annual training budget with individual scope for development


About Us

Creative agency and management consultancy with over 250 very good people in Berlin and New York since 2008.

Autonomy, trust and creative freedom are our vision of the modern working world of tomorrow.
We support each other and believe in the culture-building effect of regular team events for professional and personal development.
Diversity, equal rights and a healthy work-life balance are among our most important values.
Our transparent feedback process contributes to an open and appreciative communication culture.
We want to fit your life. We offer the full work-life care service of the Fürstenberg Institute to support you in every phase of your life.

Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

 

We are currently seeking a passionate Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing

Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs 
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance) 
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business 
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products 
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies 

What You Bring

Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field 
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python 
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau 
Knowledge of data analysis methods and storytelling 
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment 

It’s also a plus if you have… 

Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git 
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence 
Understanding of statistical methods and ML 
Usage of ETL frameworks

What We Offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, an annual Headspace membership, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, discounts for Bertelsmann employees etc.
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.

This Is Us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. About The Team

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to strengthen the Global Finance Analytics Team and support SumUp's strategic initiatives. Your role will involve assisting the Global and European Finance Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team by constructing data models, generating reports and dashboards, and offering advanced analysis and actionable insights. You will make a significant contribution to the business by being part of an experienced data team and actively participating in the development of the analytics chapter.

What you'll do:

Create efficient data models that track financial performance and KPIs, from acquisition to churn, including metrics like recurring revenue, payback, lifetime value or customer acquisition cost with dbt
Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Finance team and Sumup Leadership
Collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to develop strategies based on data-driven insights and qualitative analysis
Drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals, such as small merchant segmentation and readout
Collaborate closely with Analytics Engineer to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for analytics

You'll be an excellent fit for this role if you possess:

Over 5 years of professional work experience in data analytics and in data model design, preferably with experience in dbt, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques, such as regression, classification, and clustering
The capacity to examine Finance requirements across various functional areas and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, coupled with effective communication skills and a strategic mindset, enabling seamless collaboration with GTM leadership
Strong technical expertise, encompassing proficiency in Finance, stakeholder management, and data visualization tools

Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally from the Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program - you will own a stake in SumUp’s future success.

👩🏼‍💻 The opportunity to work on large scale fintech products used by millions of businesses around the world

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidized office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

job_title: Business Consultant Data Architecture und Data Analysis Supply Solutions (m/w/d)
job_desc:
Sie denken smart, begeistern sich für modernste Technologien und sind erst zufrieden, wenn alle Prozesse und Systeme einwandfrei funktionieren? Dann sind Sie bei uns genau richtig. Durch unsere digitalen Lösungen aus den Bereichen MDM, BI, Analytics, Big Data sowie IoT gelingt es Unternehmen aus Daten relevantes Wissen zu generieren, Prozesse auf smarte Weise zu digitalisieren und somit die Welt von Morgen mit neuen Produkten zu begeistern. Unser Geschäftsbereich New Data Solutions fokussiert auf innovative Lösungen für die Industrie mit modernsten Technologien!

msg ist eine unabhängige Unternehmensgruppe mit weltweit mehr als 10.000 Mitarbeitenden. Unseren ausgezeichneten Ruf verdanken wir unserem ganzheitlichen Leistungsspektrum aus einfallsreicher strategischer Beratung und intelligenten, nachhaltig wertschöpfenden IT-Lösungen für eine Vielzahl von Branchen.

Das erwartet Sie bei uns

Als (Junior) Consultant arbeiten Sie in nationalen und internationalen Data-Management-Kundenprojekten und erwerben dabei wertvolles (Praxis-)Wissen 
Sie unterstützen bei Digitalisierungsvorhaben durch Identifikation, Analyse und Visualisierung der bestehenden Datenstrukturen und Informationsflüsse 
Sie beraten Datenverantwortliche in Fach- und IT-Bereichen zum Aufbau einer transparenten und leistungsfähigen Datenarchitektur. Dabei berücksichtigen Sie organisatorische und prozessuale Aspekte von Data Governance 
Sie unterstützen bei der technischen Konzeption / beim Entwurf der passgenauen Lösungen 
Sie sind aktiver Teil unseres interdisziplinären Wissensaustausches in unserer Community 
Sie erhalten eine individuelle Aus- und Weiterbildung mit der Möglichkeit zur Zertifizierung

Das bringen Sie mit

Einen guten bis sehr guten Abschluss in einem (Fach-)Hochschulstudium - Bachelor oder Master (Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften) oder einer vergleichbaren Qualifikation 
Erfahrung in der toolgestützten Modellierung von komplexen Prozessen 
Interesse an Datenharmonisierung/ -cleansing und Aufbau von Datenkatalogen/ Data Quality-KPIs und deren Analyse 
Fundierte Kenntnisse in den Verfahren und Methoden der Datenexploration, -integration, -analyse sowie agiler Entwicklungsmethoden (z.B. Scrum) 
Teamplayer sowie analytisches Denkvermögen und Leistungsbereitschaft 
Sichere Kommunikation in Wort und Schrift (Deutsch, Englisch) sowie Flexibilität, Mobilität und Reisebereitschaft

Das ist unser Angebot

Bei uns steht der Mensch im Mittelpunkt - dieses Kultur-Programm ist unser tägliches Selbstverständnis! Wir leben flache Hierarchien mit Duz-Kultur und treffen nachhaltige unternehmerische Entscheidungen. msg bietet flexibles Arbeiten, attraktive Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und zahlreiche Benefits. Wir sind vielfältig und begrüßen alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Herkunft, Behinderung, Nationalität, Religion/Weltanschauung, Alter, Geschlecht sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität. Vielfalt macht uns als Team stark – werden Sie ein Teil davon!

job_title: Senior Consultant Search & Analytics (m/w/d) at SHI GmbH
job_desc:
SHI mit ihrem jungen und schnell wachsenden Geschäftsbereich „Search, Big Data & Analytics“ sowie dem traditionellen Bereich „Publisher Services“ gehört zu den ersten Ansprechpartnern für namhafte Kunden, wenn sie komplexe Fragestellungen lösen möchten. Wir sind im Stammgeschäft seit 25 Jahren auf erstklassige Implementierungs-, Consulting- und Engineering-Services für Unternehmen aller Branchen spezialisiert.

Wir fördern Sie durch Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen und gemeinsam gestalten wir Ihren Weg zu Ihrem beruflichen Erfolg für die Zukunft.

Unser Firmensitz ist zentral in Augsburgs bester Lage. Direkt am Königsplatz, 5 Minuten vom Bahnhof entfernt und damit ideal zu erreichen.Aber wenn Sie möchten, dann gestalten Sie Ihre Tätigkeit auch eigenverantwortlich im Homeoffice.Denn als kreatives Unternehmen setzen wir auf Desk Sharing und Homeoffice.

Aufgaben

Spannende Projekte im Zukunftsfeld Data Science, Search und Analytics warten auf Sie. 
Sie gestalten die Beratung, Konzeptentwicklung und Umsetzung von modernen Search und Advanced Analytics Lösungen für E-Commerce, Enterprise-Systeme und Big Data Use Cases. 
Sie wissen, wie Maschine Learning zur Gewinnung neuer Wettbewerbsvorteile einzusetzen ist. 
Sie glauben an „Open Source“ und an die Idee, dass eine riesige Community innovative Themen vorantreibt und „Business Needs“ individuell mit IT erfüllt. 
Sie fungieren als Ansprechpartner und Projektleiter für unsere Kundenprojekte und generieren neue Themen bzw. Engagements in Ihrem Umfeld. 
Sie können Ihre Erfahrungen aus Projekten in die Ausrichtung der Business Unit einbringen. 

Qualifikation

Eine aktive, vertriebsaffine, technikversierte Person, die bereit ist Verantwortung zu übernehmen
Sie bringen ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Masterstudium, bevorzugt aus den Bereichen Informatik, Computerlinguistik, Mathematik oder ähnlich mit. 
Sie haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung und Erfolge in abgeschlossenen Projekten zeichnen Sie aus. 
Kommunikation und Beratungsmentalität umschreibt Ihren Arbeitsstil. 
Diverse Berührungspunkte mit Apache Solr, Elastic Stack, Spark, NiFi und Data Science. 
Ein hohes Maß an Motivation sowie Lernbereitschaft bestimmt Ihre Persönlichkeit. 
Gute Ausdrucksweise und Empathie zeigen Ihre Wirkungsfähigkeit. 
Englisch in Wort und Schrift befähigt Sie zur Korrespondenz mit dem Ausland. 

Benefits

Es erwarten Sie das Feeling und der Drive eines Start up’s mit der Sicherheit eines etablierten Unternehmens. Unkomplizierte Kommunikationswege, flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten und unsere namhaften Kunden eröffnen Ihnen herausragende Lern-, Entwicklungs- und Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten. Neben einem attraktiven Gehalt, Getränken, Obst und Kuchen bieten wir Ihnen ebenfalls remote Tätigkeit vom Homeoffice aus.

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

job_title: Fully Remote - Data Analyst in Germany
job_desc:
TELUS International AI Inc. partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects.

We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community.

Tasks

We are hiring freelance English and German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and German
You must be living in Germany the last consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information 
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance) 
Applicants must be 18 years or over.


Benefits

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative 
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss 
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle 
Be a part of an online community


Please make sure that your device location is set up properly when creating an account on our website so we can validate your country of residence. In case you have a VPN turned on, please turn it off and refresh the page just so we can validate your IP & render a personalized experience.

Important notice: TELUS International will never request a monetary deposit for any role or project with the company.

"All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.”

We at sevDesk:

We at sevDesk don't have a universal formula for happiness in the world of work either, but we work together every day to understand exactly what can permanently increase our sevFamily's sense of happiness. One thing is for sure: with us, you can be exactly who you are and work in a way that suits you and your needs! It's not the work that defines us, it's us that define the work!

Our culture is not artificial, it is real. Be yourself at sevDesk - BE YOURSEV!

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our product portfolio. With your analyses, you identify growth potential and influence our product roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:

You analyze user behavior data and use it to support our product teams in identifying the most important customer problems.
You design success metrics, help set goals and design experiments to find the best solutions for our customers.
You prepare your findings visually so that it is easy for your stakeholders to incorporate them into their decisions.
You design optimizations in data collection and continuously develop the reporting ecosystem.
You support your colleagues in the use of product data and help to keep our quality standards high with peer reviews.

Your Qualification:

You have at least 5 years of experience in the digital environment. You have already worked as a Data Analyst (m/f/x) for at least 3 years and have mentored other analysts.
You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics or comparable.
You have at least 2 years of application experience in SQL and a good technical understanding.
You have experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI, Tableau) and analytics tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics).
You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, good knowledge of statistics is a plus.

__

Our Techstack:

SQL | Redshift | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Your SevDesk Experience

Your Freedom: Embrace the freedom to work from wherever you choose.

Your Flexibility: Define your working hours to maximize productivity while being an essential team member.

Your Projects: Participate in Open Code Fridays and bring your own ideas to life.

Your Ideas: Actively contribute your innovative ideas to shape sevDesk's future.

Your Training: Engage in flat and brown bag sessions, celebrating knowledge sharing.

Your Career: We support and challenge you on your unique career journey.

Your Team: Collaborate seamlessly with our inclusive team, whether in-person or through online channels.

Your Equipment: Select your preferred hardware, and if needed, we provide you with a desk and chair.

Your Perks: Enjoy a monthly voucher, such as for shopping or refilling your tank.

Your Share: Join our employee share ownership program and become an entrepreneur yourself.

Your Dream Bike: Pursue your ideal bike through our bike leasing program.

Your Dress Code: Express yourself in a blazer or sweatpants; our focus is on inspiration, not attire.

Your Retirement Plan: We contribute to your company pension plan and add €30 to it.

Your Benefits: Access discounts at over 600 partner companies via our corporate benefits.

Your Commute: We cover travel costs for your visits to our Offenburg office if you work remotely.

Your Commitment: Dedicate 3 working days annually to contribute to social or environmental projects.

Your Relaxation: Enjoy 30 vacation days each year for your well-deserved rest.

Your English: Take advantage of our Speexx learning program to elevate your English skills to the next level.

Your Wanderlust: Whether it's the mountains or the sea - enjoy 30 days of workation wherever you go in Europe.

For more insights, visit us on Instagram

Contact: Marc Riehle

At SumUp, small business owners are at the heart of everything we do. That’s why we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses.

In the Global Bank Team, we create a business account for SumUp’s customers (our merchants) across the globe that offers financial services that are accessible to all and are offered in a fair, transparent, and honest way. We want to do banking differently from how it has been done until now.

Becoming a part of the Global Bank Team at SumUp of 200 people across Berlin, Cologne, São Paulo, Santiago, Sofia and Vilnius, who love to take ownership, work with purpose, and are building the number 1 bank for small businesses.

Join our global team as a Senior Data Analyst and shape the future of our banking products, you'll not only apply your expertise to the challenges of a complex and evolving tribe but also actively contribute to the broader data analytics team.

What You’ll Do

Document and create data marts and key metrics so others can easily work with the data
Enhance product research with internal data insights to advise the global product strategy. Support product improvement by helping teams with data-driven insights, and qualitative analysis, and enable experiments with proper tracking
Analyze business requirements in various functional areas and translate them into data models and actionable dashboards
Embrace a customer-centric mindset, recognizing and prioritizing the needs of clients and end-users in all decision-making processes
Analyze data sets to spot trends and patterns that can be translated into actionable insights and conduct ad hoc analyzes to address pressing questions around product, operations, and business performance
Collaborate with teams to define clear KPIs and data models to help measure the effectiveness of our product strategies in achieving overall business goals. To deliver product performance insights you will develop user-friendly dashboards

Previous experience: 

Min 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in a fast-growing company or banking sector
Experience in data warehouse principles (ideally Snowflake), architectures, and technologies (DBT experience is desirable)
Advanced experience writing, optimizing, and validating SQL queries
Understanding version control concepts and Git operations
Ability to digest information, and data and deliver recommendations
Ability to derive conclusions with analytical evidence using descriptive statistics, basic inferential statistics, and data visualizations - ideally with Tableau
Proven track record of leading large and complex projects, demonstrating adaptability and concise communication skills
Having a foundational understanding of basic software development concepts will support you in your collaboration and understanding of the Engineering and Product team’s needs. 

Nice to have: 

Defining and running A/B tests and knowing when results are statistically significant
Experience tracking data on Mobile & Web Products
Previous exposure to dynamics of startups or scale-up organizations
Familiarity with Tracking tools (Segment, GA, Mixpanel, Amplitude)
Experience with Python

Additional Information

Start date: as soon as possible

Full-time

Location: On-site role in Berlin (office first set up)

Interview Process Overview

Recruiter Interview - 45 Minutes

Take home Challenge

Technical Interview - 60 min

Hiring Manager & Stakeholder Interview - 60 Minutes

Team interview - 30min

Bar Raiser Interview - 60 Minutes

Learn More About How We Hire Here.

Why you should join SumUp

The opportunity to work on large scale fintech products used by millions of small businesses around the world
Work on a high impact squad that is at the core of the Bank Tribe
A dedicated annual Learning & Development budget for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education
Enrollment onto our virtual stock ownership program - you will own a stake in SumUp’s future success
A corporate pension scheme
You'd enjoy other great benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, subsidized office lunches and other location-tailored benefits, Babbel language platform subscription and more
You’ll attend global offsites and/or hackathons.
Join a truly global SumUp team of 3200+ people from 80+ countries, spread across 4 continents

About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder’s mentality and a 'team-first’ attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!

Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.
Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.

Benefits

· Work up to 20 hours per week.
· Earn a competitive rate of pay.
· Develop your research skills.
· Avoid the long commute.
· Work from the comfort of your home office.
· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!

Apply Online Today!

Du hast Erfahrung mit der Adobe Experience Platform und hast bereits mit der Customer Data Platform und idealerweise auch einem weiteren AEP-Produkt gearbeitet? XDM, RT-CDP, AJO und CJA sind für dich keine Buchstabensalate, sondern gängige Begriffe? Eine wertschätzende Unternehmenskultur und kollegialer Zusammenhalt sind dir wichtig? Dann willkommen bei diva-e!

diva-e ist Deutschlands führender Transactional Experience Partner (TXP), der digitale Erlebnisse schafft, die Unternehmen nachhaltig voranbringen und deren Kunden begeistern.

Mit der geballten Erfahrung aus über 20 Jahren realisieren wir E-Business-Lösungen für Kunden wie den FC Bayern München, Carl Zeiss, EDEKA, E.ON, Lieferando und Ravensburger. An insgesamt 10 Standorten in Deutschland, Bulgarien (Sofia) und den USA (Cincinnati) gestalten rund 900 Mitarbeiter in unseren Büros, remote oder bei unseren Kunden die Zukunft des digitalen Business. Besonders stolz sind wir auf unsere Unternehmenskultur. Respekt, Vertrauen und Verantwortung werden in unseren Teams im täglichen Miteinander gelebt – und das über den Arbeitsplatz hinaus.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir dich als

Data Analyst AEP (m/w/d) in remote

unbefristet, in Vollzeit

Gemeinsam mit einem bunt gemischten Team aus CMS- und Applikationsentwicklern, UX und UI, SCRUM Coach und Product Owner treibst du die Umsetzung anspruchsvoller CMS Lösungen voran und hilfst unseren Kunden dabei, ihre Marke mit Adobe AEM und AEP online optimal zu präsentieren.

Schwerpunktmäßig nutzen wir dabei in der Entwicklung Java Technologien.

Was du bei uns machst

Basierend auf den Anforderungen unserer Kunden, setzt du komplexe und agile AEP Projekte um.
Hauptsächlich fokussierst du dich mit RT-CDP aber auch mit den weiteren Produkten der AEP-Welt. 
Du betreust die vollumfängliche Beratung unserer Kunden, Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung der Projekte und vor allem die Einführung der AEP RT-CDP mit all ihren Besonderheiten sein. 
Insbesondere die Beratung rund um das XDM-Datenmodell, Datenflüsse und die Einführung von Prozessen beim Kunden werden dich tagtäglich begleiten.
Darüber hinaus entwickeln wir uns im Adobe Bereich permanent weiter und du spielst an der vordersten Spitze der Neuentwicklungen mit. 

Wann du zu uns passt

Du bist ein echter Teamplayer. Einer für alle, alle für einen – das ist dein und unser Motto.
Technologische Neuerungen stehst du offen gegenüber. Du hast die intrinsische Motivation und den Willen zu lernen. Dich on the job kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln und dein Wissen an die Kollegen weiterzugeben. Dabei unterstützen wir dich gerne mit einer Vielzahl an Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen und internen Angeboten!
Du bist kommunikationsstark, mindestens auf Deutsch. Gutes Englisch ist wünschenswert.
Du hast ein sehr gutes Verständnis und Projekt Erfahrungen mit der Adobe Experience Platfor
Darüberhinaus hast du einschlägige 
Kenntnisse der anderen Tools aus der Adobe Experience Cloud, ein Verständnis der Funktionsweisen und Architektur vor allem im Kontext der Adobe Experience Platform. Adobe Web SD, Adobe Target, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Commerce, Marketo, Adobe Campaign
Sehr gutes Verständnis über die wichtigsten Enterprise-Marketing- und Data-Tools
Du kennst die technische Funktionsweise von Data Storage Lösungen, Datenbanken und CRM-Systemen sowie Advertising Tools & Plattformen und von Social Media Tools Facebook, Instagram, Linkedin
Mit Marketing Automation rund um Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Oracle, Mailchimp hast du dich ebenfalls beschäftigt und du kennst die wichtigsten Funktionsweisen.
Grundlegendes Verständnis über die Funktionsweisen von APIs und von API-Requests

Was du von uns hast

Deine Erfolgsmomente sind unsere Inspiration. Bei uns bist du Mensch – und keine Nummer! Wir legen sehr hohen Wert auf einen freundschaftlich-kollegialen, aber auch ehrlichen Umgang miteinander. Respekt, Vertrauen und Verantwortung werden bei uns großgeschrieben. Ellenbogenmentalität findest du bei uns nicht. Jedes Projekt bringt neue, spannende Herausforderungen mit sich. Wir wissen, dass wir diese erfolgreich nur im Team meistern und helfen uns daher gegenseitig. Das gemeinsame Arbeiten, Austüfteln, Umdenken, Umsetzen und Optimieren macht uns Spaß und wir lernen jeden Tag dazu. Bei uns gewinnen die besten Ideen und deine sind uns jederzeit willkommen. Deine Work-Life-Balance nehmen wir sehr ernst. Viele von uns haben gerade eine Familie gegründet oder zeitintensive Hobbys. Wir glauben, dass ausgeglichene Mitarbeiter das Team deutlich weiterbringen, als wenn wir ihnen Überstunden aufbürden. Daher achten wir darauf, dass diese möglichst gar nicht erst anfallen und unterstützen dich beim eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten – und im Umgang mit deinen eigenen Ressourcen.

Deine Vorteile

Flexible Arbeitszeiten: Wir tun alles dafür, damit du Privatleben und Beruf unter einen Hut bringen kannst. Freie Zeiteinteilung und mobiles Arbeiten gehören dazu.
Weiterbildung satt: Ob interne Chapter Sessions, Hackathons, die diva-e Akademie oder der Besuch von Konferenzen und Barcamps – für deine Weiterbildung tun wir alles und sind dabei offen für deine Wünsche. Außerdem entwickelst du dich „on the Job“ stetig weiter und lernst immer dazu.
Reichlich Perspektiven: Wir haben 10 Standorte und ein großes Dienstleistungsportfolio. Dich zieht es an einen anderen Standort oder du möchtest andere Aufgabengebiete. kennenlernen? Kein Problem, bei uns hast du die Möglichkeiten dazu.
Hardware frei wählbar: Bei uns kannst du die Hardware, mit der du arbeiten möchtest, aus unserem Hardwarekatalog frei wählen.

Und wir haben noch viel mehr Mitarbeitervorteile für dich!

Du hast Lust auf tolle Kunden, mit denen du spannende CMS Projekte realisieren kannst? Du blühst bei Teamwork erst so richtig auf? Du brennst für das, was du tust und wagst dich aus der eigenen Komfortzone? Du willst unsere Zukunft aktiv mitgestalten? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Ein Anschreiben benötigen wir nicht, aber wir sind schon neugierig, was dich an dieser Stelle interessiert. Nach Bewerbungseingang melden wir uns schnellstmöglich bei dir. Passt der erste Eindruck, findet ein erstes Gespräch in der Regel schon innerhalb einer Woche statt. Und wenn da die Chemie stimmt, machen wir einen zweiten Termin, indem du im Rahmen einer kleinen Fallstudie deine fachlichen Skills unter Beweis stellen und das Team und deine Arbeitsumgebung kennen lernen kannst.

Du hast noch Fragen?

Fragen zum Bewerbungsablauf beantwortet dir Steffen Krüger aus dem HR-Team. Er freut sich auf deine E-Mail an hr@diva-e.com. Vernetze dich gerne direkt auf XING oder Linkedin mit ihm oder schau dir an, was Mitarbeiter und Bewerber auf kununu über uns sagen.

Schwerbehinderte Menschen oder Gleichgestellte werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt.

Peroptyx ist ein Anbieter von Daten- undAuswertungslösungen, die von globalen Technologie- und Finanzunternehmengenutzt werden, um die lokal relevantesten, sichersten und intuitivstenOnline-Dienste für ihre Kunden zu entwickeln.Bei Peroptyx kannst du dir deineArbeitstage nach einem flexiblen Arbeitsplan einteilen, an Wochenenden oderspät abends von deinem Homeoffice aus arbeiten. Da unsere Aufgaben so flexibelsind, werden die Auswirkungen auf deinen Tagesablauf minimiert.Egal, ob du dir als Student neben demStudium etwas dazu verdienen möchtest, als Rentner eine neue Herausforderungsuchst, als Berufstätiger in Teilzeit oder als Elternteil von zu Hause ausarbeiten möchtest – Peroptyx hat die richtige Stelle für jeden!Wir sind derzeit auf der Suche nach freiberuflichen Mitarbeitern /Freelancern alsMaps Evaluator | Kartenbewerter (m/w/d)Quereinsteigermöglich (m/w/d)


Tasks

Nebenjobim Homeoffice 
100% Homeoffice
DatenanalystDeine Aufgaben
Du wirst Aufgaben im Zusammenhang mit Online-Karten und Routenplanung für Deutschland erledigen.
Du wirst die Daten in Bezug auf diese Aufgaben einordnen/auswerten.
Du verwendest Online-Tools, um die Genauigkeit von geografischen Abfragen, Adressen und Routen zu untersuchen.
Um sich für diese Stelle zu qualifizieren, wirst du eine Online-Aufnahmeprüfung absolvieren.


Requirements

Idealerweise bringst du mitFließende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch 
Sehr gute Recherche-Kompetenzen 
Ausgezeichnete Ortskenntnisse in deinem Heimatland 
Gutes Verständnis und allgemeine Kenntnisse der Geografie und Kultur Deutschlands 
Analytische DenkweiseUnsere Anforderungen 
Du lebst mindestens seit den letzten 5 Jahren ununterbrochen in Deutschland 
Du erklärst dich bereit, je nach Verfügbarkeit der Aufgaben, mindestens 10 und bis zu 20 Stunden pro Woche zu arbeiten.

Virenschutzlösung, die auf dem neuesten Stand gehalten und regelmäßig überprüft wird
